description:
I was having dinner at a girlfriend's house amd she decided on Thai. We had dinner on Thursday, August 23rd around 6:15pm. Not sure if she got takeout or delivery, but I believe it was delivery.

*Angel Wings: Fried chicken wings with sweet garlic sauce and crispy basil ($11)
*Tom Yum Chicken Soup: Spicy and sour soup with onions and mushrooms ($10)
*Pad See You: Pan-fried flat rice noodles with broccoli, eggs, and garlic, Chicken ($12)
*Crab Meat Fried Rice: Pan-fried rice with crab meat, egg, and onions ($14)
*Eggplant: With Japanese eggplant and bean sauce, Served with Chicken $12)
*String Bean Tofu: Sauteed crispy outer layer tofu with string beans and homemade spicy sauce, Hot and spicy, Vegetarian ($11)

I didn't have anything to do with the ordering, but I believe we had the items above. (I found the prices online.) The crab fried rice had a good amount crab. And a nice salty savoriness to it. I'm a huge basil fan, so I was happy the wings and eggplant came with a good amount of basil. I'm big on veggies, so I enjoyed the string bean tofu. Plus, the green beans retained a nice crunch. I believe we ordered everything mild, so I added sambal to my plate to give the dishes some heat. I do love my spice.

Great option for Thai delivery if you live in the Chinatown area.
author: Elena N.

description:
I ordered delivery via DoorDash and I was pleasantly surprised by how good their pad see ew was. My sister and her boyfriend also liked theirs as well. They give you a lot of food, and the flavors are quite strong. I would daresay it was one of the better pad see ew dishes I've had, and I eat this dish a lot.

Their chicken with string beans dish was okay, but their pad see ew was better!
author: Danielle C.

description:
It's been a really long time that I've been here and a couple of days ago I had a hankering for thai food so I decided to call Thai Spice to get some take out. Unfortunately, I either ordered the wrong dishes because the dishes I got were an expensive mistake!

What I ordered:
Red Curry with chicken ($13) - this dish was very rich with coconut milk and it had a strong flavor which I attributed to not just the curry but alot of salt (eeck!). The dish just had tons of bamboo strips and maybe a couple of pieces of basil. No other vegetable in this dish which made it very boring.

Sauteed Mixed Vegetables with Polk ($12) - trying to be healthy? Well this dish had baby corn, cabbage, onions, zucchini, carrot bits, green beans, bean sprouts and small oblong strips of pork in a brown sauce. When I opened the take out container most of the veggies were really limp. Eating some of this dish, I thought it tasted somewhat odd 'cause it was super sweet like there was tons of sugar in that sauce making it inedible after a while.

With these two entrees I got one order of jasmine rice ($2) and one order of brown rice ($2.75). Personally, I enjoyed the texture of the latter much more because it has some bite to it; whereas the jasmine rice is small grain and has a refined texture that really has a too soft mouth feel for me.

Overall, I was highly disappointed by my entrees from Thai Spice. With a total cost of $33 for dinner and bad tasting food sadly I'm not likely to order from them again. :(
author: Joanna T.

description: Here is a relaxed atmosphere. Here work very friendly girls and boys. The food is delicious. As we sat down we immediately brought slightly cold water in the glasses as we like. There is real Thai cuisine. Be sure to try here to eat, you will like it.
author: Oleg K.

description:
We wandered in here after doing the SCRAP Escape room a block away.

I ordered the pad see ew with tofu and asked for thin noodles. The tofu was really good! I paid ~$16 after tax and tip. Service was fast, maybe because we were there a bit off-hours.

My only complaint is that the restaurant was mostly empty, but they seated us right next to the door where we were blasted by the wind every time it opened.
author: Annie C.

description: Really solid Thai food. Easily seated on a Sunday evening. Service is attentive and kind. Try the green basil curry with chicken and vegetables. The brown rice is particularly good. Not much spice in the dishes despite the name, but you can request heat. Eats aren't too expensive here; around $40 for 2 people. Ambiance is pleasant but not much to write about - spices line the red walls, tables are closely packed, not particularly modern or romantic. Gelato down the street :)
author: Ray J.

description: My favorite Thai in the city! My boyfriend and I are regulars, we order it 1-2 times a week. It always is consistent, tastes authentic, and very good! I have lots of annoying requests to make mine how I like it and they are always able to accommodate!
author: Liza H.

description: Stopped in and had pad Thai with chicken as a litmus test and I was pleasantly surprised.  I would come back here again.
author: Aaron D.

description: This place was delicious!! The waiters were friendly and attentive, the atmosphere is relaxed, and the food was delicious and extremely well-priced. We ordered the money bags appetizer, a yellow chicken curry, and the string bean beef. Some of the best chicken I've ever had. Just found our new favorite Thai place.
author: Lauren M.

description: Thai spice babyyyy. Get ready for some pad Thai-licious. We ordered from Thai spice on door dash on a weeknight because sometimes a salad just doesn't cut it. I ordered the low carb pad Thai with shrimp, which I think the low carb is even better than the normal full carb version. Still super filling and tons of flavor. I wish it was spicier and had more peanuts on it (my two suggestions). We also ordered veggie egg roll bites and the spinach wraps. What looked Ah-mazing was the vegetarian giant spring rolls. Holy num, almost stole them from my manager! Would love to explore the menu further and try out some of the curry options as well.
author: Kara N.

description: Came here with a bunch of people and would say this place is good ambiencs wise. They have different spice jars hung on the wall which was pretty cool. Tried thai fried rice which was pretty good and upto my expectation.
author: Sharad B.

description: I'm positive that the owner is not Thai, since pretty much nothing here tastes like they're supposed to. The only thing they get right is the fried rice, but then how can you screw that up? I tried their stir-fried chicken with eggplant, which is one of my favorite Thai dishes, and it was incredibly bland and barely had any chicken in it. The ku chai was supposed to come with a sweet soy sauce with chili but it was actually--I'm not kidding--melted brown sugar. They're not even trying.
author: Carl W.

description: Amazing Thai food every time I come here. Over the past few years ordered almost everything on the menu. I have yet to be disappointed. I would vote this best Thai food. Toto and dipping sauce amazing. Pad see ew always a most. Yesterday got the salt and pepper fish which turned out to be better than I thought. I take everyone that comes to visit here and they all agree it's the best. I
author: Michael M.

description: I love ordering from here, excellent spring rolls. But they do not always include all the pieces of your takeout order...so check before delivery leaves! We were without rice for our curry last night :/
author: Sarah N.

description:
Wandered into Thai Spice on Polk recently and was warmly received and offered any seat not taken. I ordered chicken satay and Thai spring rolls, both with peanut sauce.
I was not disappointed. Satay was perfectly seasoned and grilled magnificently. The spring rolls were large enough to almost be a stand alone meal. The peanut sauce was so delicious, I wanted a bucket full. 
All the while, my water glass was repeatedly topped up- attentive and not in a helicopter way.
I will return to try more menu items. I can't wait!
author: Fredric R.

description: Good tom yum soup, but roti prata could use some work. The roti was more of a dense, greasy pancake than a flaky, thin crust. This made it very hard to eat, as it was very heavy.
author: Lillian B.

description: Good food but the service is unbelievably bad. Particularly from the woman behind the main cashier's desk. My sister ordered some lunch from there today and when she ordered it, we thought we would take it to go. As things turned out and we realized we had a little time to eat, we figured we could eat there. So we went back (we had only walked a block), and told the woman that we wanted to eat there. Not thinking it was a big deal, I couldn't fathom what the issue was so I gave her the benefit of the doubt and said " we just ordered this food from your restaurant. We want to eat it here". Nope. Nope. You can't eat it here because you said it was to go. Wow!! Really!! I was shocked. We will never go back there and frankly, there are tons of places where the folks in charge actually know what customer service means. Not these guys. Spend your money somewhere else.
author: S T.

description: Great local spot. Pad thai is awesome though medium spice can range from not spicy to very spicy
author: McGee J.

description:
Been going to this Thai spot for years now; not saying I dine here every day. The thing I can say about Thai Spice is that it is consistent. I haven't varied my meal choices but their fried rice, especially the Crab Fried Rice, has always been my go to (and yes I mostly do take out).
The ambiance inside is quaint, good place to actually hear yourself speak.
Just had another meal here today and I can safely say I will keep getting my Thai craving satisfied here.
author: Andrew C.

description: I was really excited to try this place out but disappointed once I did. We ordered the shrimp over the blanket and the shrimp was not cooked!!! Make sure to check the shrimp if you order it. The basil seafood is not so good, the scallops tasted very Oceana and the mussels were very dry. The chicken mango was good and so was the pork Thai fried rice (heavy)
author: Angel P.

description:
The ambiance is a bit too dim for my taste.
I really enjoyed the spring rolls & peanut sauce that came with it! Had a hint of curry which was surprisingly tasty. 
Tom yum came with a lot of mushrooms and not enough seafood, but it was flavorful, a bit too sour though. 
I didn't like the pad Thai papaya too much. I think it's just because I had Tom yum, which was sour along with pad Thai , which was a bit sour also. 
The Thai tea was on point. 
Overall, I think there are some things that could be improved. The restaurant is quite spacious compared to a lot of restaurants around San Francisco. Service was good, our server was nice, just wish she was a bit more attentive. 
It's an okay restaurant to grab a bite and have a conversation.
author: Bao L.

description: This is my go-to Thai spot. The ambiance isn't anything special, but the food is . Fresh rolls are delicious. Curries, pad see ew, and basil leaf tofu are great too.
author: Talia G.

description:
Ordered food from here for the first time during lunch the other day. I chose the spicy green bean with chicken. It annoys me how so many places do this just to save a bag but when I went to pick it up, they stacked all four plates together. Unfortunately, mine was on the bottom and so my plate tore on the bottom. It started leaking so much sauce everywhere, which was so annoying. 

Despite that, the food was really good! The chicken might've been a little dry but the spicy sauce was delicious. Lots of flavor. It would've been good if the sauce was a bit spicier too, but that's okay. I don't know if they did this on purpose or not, but there was sauce in the two extra slots in my plate, which I used for my rice. Definitely would order this dish again.
author: Annie H.

description:
The restaurant was clean and neat. Decor was good also. 
Was seated quickly. The server was very nice and attentive. She did a very good job. 
I got the lunch combo, salad which was good. Thai spicy rolls again delicious. Green curry chicken which unfortunately was flavorless. I was blown away how bad it was.
author: Jim R.

description:
My coworkers and I (group of 10 people) came here after doing Escape the Room on a Friday evening. We had made reservations a few days prior for a 6:15pm dinner. The first few things I noticed when making a reservation at this place is that the employees are super chill. Some restaurants we checked out previously denied us because we weren't willing to pay the minimum amount per person or that they didn't take reservations. But the person I talked to on the phone easily booked us for Friday evening.

The restaurant itself is super quaint and the environment is extremely peaceful and romantic. Even on a Friday night, the place was relatively empty and I felt like we had the place all to ourselves. The lighting was dim and the seating arrangements were comfortable.

Since we had a huge party, we pretty much ordered all over the place. We started with several appetizers (Chicken Sate, Roti, Spring Rolls) and went bonkers on the main dishes (Eggplant, tofu, more tofu, Pad Thai, Crab Fried Rice, etc.). It was hard to track how good each dish was, but from a very neutral perspective, I thought that everything tasted fine and we had an amazing time. 

In short, I found that the service was decent - the waitresses left our party alone to indulge - and the food was very delicious. This obviously wasn't the best Thai food I have ever had but this was a great space that met the needs of a huge party of hungry individuals.

Eat well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description:
Disclaimer: only had a single dish here, so perhaps not quite a broad perspective review here. Though in saying that - the dish is a signature, traditional one for Thai cuisine so quite justifiably disappointed :-(
The service was unenthusiastic, vaguely unfriendly and seemed irritated when we asked for a water refill - ouch. 4/10, likely won't eat here again.
author: Gia P.

description: My family and I love Thai spice! Their food is always consistently good, and the service is excellent. We always get the low-carb pad Thai - either vegetarian or with chicken - and a dish of Curry. Their spicy's string bean is also quite fantastic. I probably go here at least once a week for takeout or to dine in. In fact the only negative thing I have to say is that they are making me fat :)
author: jenica b.

description: After a poor experience at another restaurant, I landed here. I chose the mango chicken sautéed with mango sauce. It was so delicious! If you like mango, I highly recommend it. The sauce was a good balance of sweet and complemented the meal very well. The restaurant was quiet, with dim lights. I'm so glad I stopped by!
author: Lisabet Z.

description: The flavors here was pretty good, definitely nothing to write home about. I was happy with what I ordered however I feel for the price and lacking flavors they may want to at least up the portion size. I can't be sure if it was just an off day, but I was very unimpressed with the service and attention to detail by staff. I guess I would stumble back in here if I had to, probably not a restaurant I would purposely seek out.
author: Moon S.

description:
Their duck curry is delicious. 

Also ordered some appetizers. 

Chicken satay.  
Spring rolls(fresh) 
Calamari -  nicely battered and crunchy

We definitely over ordered for three people but happy to take it back for later. 

If I'm in the area and can't decide where to go, I'll definitely go here.
author: Lyman C.

description: Get the Thai spice rolls. They're SO yummy! And the pad see you with beef is my fav! Also the coconut soup with mushrooms never disappoints! Delivery or dine in, I love Thai spice
author: Joy M.

description: The panang curry is good but the entrees don't come with rice!! Rice is $2-3 dollars extra.
author: Aakeynn S.

description:
Love, love, love.

I've ordered food from here a few times now and we are never disappointed. We usually get Pad Thai with chicken and Pad Kee Mao with beef. Great sized portions and always still warm when delivered.

The only reason I didn't give five stars was because we've had a hard time finding the right spice level. We keep going between medium spice, which is a little too spicy, and mild, which is a little too bland. Something in the middle would be perfect.
author: Chelsea M.

description: Cute spot on Polk street with reasonably priced food. I came in on a Tuesday and was seated right away. I ordered green curry with tofu and string beans without meat. The curry was good with a soft flavor. I ordered garlic brown rice to pair with it and that was a mistake. No point in getting garlic rice with brown rice because you can barely taste the garlic. String beans were good but a little too salty for me. Prices were pretty reasonable for Polk street so would probably come back if I was in the area. The ambiance was cute and cozy. Perfect for a date night.
author: Linda L.

description: I got a Tom Yum soup, which was tasty. This was a change from my usual pad thai or pad see yew, so I don't have other restaurants to compare to. It was after a Warriors game/loss (*sniff), so the restaurant was fairly empty. Despite the few customers, the service was slow and I had to flag a waitress down for some water. The food was decent, but not wild about the service.
author: Annie L.

description: Came for lunch and had duck noodle soup - excellent - flavorful- duck is not fatty - enjoyed food more so than Ben Thai - Thai Thai on Hyde/California is brighter and slightly more expensive by $1/2 per dish.    I think Thai Spice is my new favorite Thai place in neighborhood!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: One of my favorite Thai restaurants. Their food is great. Pineapple fried rice and pad see ew are my favorite. Soups are also great.
author: Fernando C.

description:
i came here around 6:30pm on a saturday night to eat dinner. the restaurant was pretty empty. i ordered a chicken thai fried rice while my boyfriend ordered the pad see ew and thai ice tea.  our food came out pretty quick. i enjoyed my thai fried rice. it wasn't too flavorful or salty and it was pretty filling too. the pad see ew was good too. they served the thai ice tea in a really tall thin glass with lots of ice, so there really wasn't much thai tea to drink. definitely not worth it! 

overall, we had a good experience. the waitresses were super attentive to our water needs. but then again, we were practically the only customers in the restaurant during that time. the restaurant is fairly big. there's one single user restroom. and they prices were pretty reasonable for the location.
author: Sylvia H.

description: Please please please do yourself a favor and ran from this restaurant if you are ordering delivery. Unless, you would like to be told to expect your food in an hour, and instead receive a phone call 2 hrs 50 mins later that said "hi, do you still want your food?"
author: Anli C.

description: The crab pad Thai is very good. But tom yum soup is not rich enough, quite watery to be honest. Red curry is quite disappointing
author: Sabrina C.

description:
Thai Spice is a good Thai choice for the Polk Street area. I wasn't turned off by the fact that my Tom Ka Shrimp bowl ($11) wasn't really warm - I was hungry and the big mushrooms in the coconut broth just looked too good to be returned. I also tried Tom Yum Chicken bowl ($11) which was flavorful and hot (literally). My Thai Ice Coffee ($3.50) was okay.

The restaurant looks well maintained, clean, and has a good number of tables. I'm not sure how the evening situation is but if make a reservation you should be on the safe side.

I'll give it another try with a (hopefully) hot dish.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Me: Did you just giggle?
Papa Bear: Yeah.
Me: Why?
Papa Bear: I was remembering Polk Street in the 70s. [Giggles continue.]

While it may not be the stuff of my father's giggles, Thai Spice is something that I love about Polk Street. I can only attest to the deliciousness of their "Pad See You" (I usually see it spelled pad see ew or  if ya nasty but no mind and no matter) but that's enough for me. I always stop by when I'm in the area for a plate of delicious hot veggies and thick noodles. I'm never disappointed and the service is on pizniyee, if I do say so myself. And I do.
author: Gabrielle T.

description:
Their pad thai is good. Not the best in the city, but pretty authentic. Their spicy sauce with it is a must. The beers are super cheap during happy hour so make sure to take advantage.

This is my thai spot before going out on Polk Street. It's probably the only decent one around Nob Hill. The best are primarily in SoMA.
author: Albert K.

description: This place is great. Good food - a step up from a lot of Thai places around. Nice ambience. I've had the Pad kee mao and Pad Thai. Also some appetizers. All great v
author: B J.

description: My friends and I order to go. Thai Spice was very quick and the food smelled great. When we got to our apartment to sit down and eat though it was apparent something was very wrong; one of the pad thais had extremely hot spices on it, which was not what we had ordered. I'm not talking normal hot, this stuff was making all three of us sweat, eyes tear up and mouthes burn to a new degree (we normally eat hot foods but this was a whole new level). When we called to ask for a new order, the woman tried to convince me the order was right, but they would make me a new order if I drove back to them with the old order in hand. Once they could confirm the mistake then they would make a new one. No. No thanks. Bye.
author: Briane S.

description:
Had the tofu pad thai and the beef pad see ew tonight (yes both...  was hungry) and I thought this place is better than average!

The interior is clean/nice/relaxing and the staff friendly and fast.

I only had a couple of their plates but want to assume everything else may be good as well.  We went on a Tuesday night and the place was decently packed.  Lots of techies in the house!

My first time here and will come back.

TIP: they have the best fish sauce with peppers!
author: Ray M.

description:
Everything was good but nothing special.  We ordered:
- the eggplant with pork - ok but not special
- the spinach wrap (which is shredded coconut with peanuts and a spicy sweet chutney you wrap in spinach)- interesting; my boyfriend loves this 
- the green chicken curry - super watery curry; the large chunks of veggies were great but there wasn't much chicken, and 
- fish cakes - decent

Overall a good meal especially for takeout, but I wouldn't go out of my way for this.
author: Vivian W.

description:
A tasty, clean, reasonably priced Thai spot. Food was all in big portions and definitely a bang for the buck.

Papaya salad was yummy-definitely big enough for 2 to share. Fresh spring rolls were good, the warm peanut sauce was good enough to drink! Boyfriend got the pad Thai which he said was one of the better he's had.
author: Sarah G.

description: I would give a zero star if I could. I've  ordered from them a couple of time and each time they get something wrong. Well that's my last time ordering or ever eating Thai spice. Also the food never tends to be the same flavor, each time same thing tastes different.  don't waste your time and money ordering from this places unless you're the type of person who doesn't mind incorrect orders.
author: Amna I.

description:
Great option for quick, pickup Thai food. Ordered a pad thai & rolls on a Sunday night around 9:30, had our food in to-go containers by 9:40. Impressive turnaround on food, and shockingly tasty for such a quick turnaround. The pad thai tasted much healthier than other pad thais' I've had before.

High star count goes for the great accommodations our waitress took to be wary of my boyfriend's peanut allergy.
author: Kerry G.

description: This is place has the worst service.  I've called in and gotten the wrong order so many times. When you call back, they ask for their old food back. Not sure what they plan on doing with it... hopefully it's not to serve it
author: Cici L.

description:
Terrible customer service.

I asked for a paper bag for take out and they said its 10 cents, but I don't have cash on me, their answer was "we're not gonna give it to you because we can't charge 10 cents on credit cards...."

Well there are other Thai places in this neighborhood.
author: No L.

description: Ordered shrimp summer rolls and medium spice drunken noodles for delivery. When it arrived at my hotel it looked very unappetizing and disappointing . The summer rolls tasted good and where fresh however the peanut sauce was so oily it had separated and was clumpy. The noodles where one big clump that was sticking together and were bland w no flavor or spice and again very oily. I threw most of it away. Won't be ordering from here again
author: Layla B.

description: It's first Thai place in USA with original Thai taste! Try appetizer combo it's yummy) main courses are gigantic. Very comfortable atmosphere and good waiters. I will returned this place again.
author: Regina P.

description:
Nice venue and ambiance, but with just "okay" food.

I came here with a few friends, and I ordered the Spicy Thai Fried Rice ($9). The thing that really bothered me about this dish was that the rice was so mushy and sticky. The rice was practically glued together. It was hard to finish because the dish was so dense.

The bf got the Lamb Curry, and he loved it. Unfortunately, it doesn't come with rice. (Who eats curry without rice?) One bowl wasn't enough, so he ordered two servings. 

Be careful about ordering the "Thai spicy" option for your curry. It is extremely spicy, and your tongue will feel like it's been attacked by tiny needles. The bf still loved it, but was sweating near the end of his meal. And sadly, he got a huge stomachache the next morning, the poor thing. :(

The waiters were very attentive, but the food is overpriced and just whatevers. Not coming back.
author: Nari C.

description:
Food proportion for lunch entre is good.
Salad small with lunch is small...whatever.
Waitress is a little kurt.
author: Anthony G.

description:
I like pad tai very much.
And l also like the service here.
:D:D
Everyone should come here.
author: 浚琳

description:
So, the Thai Spice in question is ... sugar? Just loads of sugar?

We ordered two things: Tom Kha with chicken for me, and a spinach/tofu/peanut sauce thing for my love.

The Tom Kha was inedible: completely overcooked chicken, and the soup itself was weirdly watery and sweet sweet sweet. You know that scene in Elf when Will Ferrell has pasta with syrup? It was like that.

What's super-bizarro is that the waitress stopped by to see if everything was alright, and I told her it wasn't. She said, "oh, the soup is too sour?" And I said, "no, it's way too sweet." I told her I didn't want it replaced. (We were on our way to a concert and even if it had been replaced, that wouldn't have fixed the rubber  chicken problem.)

The spinach/tofu/peanut sauce dish was edible, but it was literally a pile of steamed spinach next to a pile of fried tofu next to a bowl of peanut sauce that had the consistency of McDonald's mcnugget sauce. It wasn't much of a dish--it was more ingredients and a packaged-tasting sauce.

They didn't take the soup off the bill, which seemed odd, as they knew that it wasn't good and we'd barely touched it for its not-goodness.

Clearly: we won't be back.
author: Adriana V.

description: Overdue review for my visit to the restaurant on April 11, 2015. Was out in the city with some old friends and we wanted to go  to a pub near by, but it was packed. The lady in our group is hungry so we decided come here, since it has great reviews on yelp! When the food came out everything look so promising the decor and garnish on the plate look great, but that's all. The actual food it self is very salty none of us can finish what we order, not due to portion size but the flavoring was horrific. Some of our plate such as the Pad-Thai have a slight sense of ammonia to it as well. The location get 2-stars for service and garnish, but beside that..... won't be coming back.
author: Reeve N.

description: The food was great! I got the appetizer sampler, chicken pot stickers, and chicken pad kee mao. The sampler could have been a little bigger. We only got one whole egg roll cut in half which was a disappointment. But the taste was good. And the pad kee mao was super flavorful but a little greasy. I'll probably go again!
author: Camille d.

description: Beautiful and excellent food, very aromatic and true Thai flavors! Food served nice and hot, love it!
author: Andrea S.

description:
I live a mile away - and they don't deliver. I tried to get them to cater for my job with a $750 budget - it was like pulling teeth to get them to deliver :/ 

their catering menu was just too expensive/beyond budget for 90 people anyways :(
author: Girl O.

description: Went here on a trip to the city for work. Found the restaurant on OpenTable and thought we would give it a try. The flavor of the food is good but the proteins were all over cooked. We ordered chicken mango curry, pad Thai with beef and pineapple fried rice. The chicken in the curry was so very VERY overcooked, almost like it was a jerky. The beef was not as dry but was still over cooked. Might have just been an off night so I would give them another try. The staff was friendly and was able to answer all of our questions
author: Sarah K.

description:
Got carryout from Thai Spice, ordered through Eat24 (search online for a coupon code to get $2 off or some discount). 

Took only 20 minutes. I forgot to order sticky rice too, but they were able to add that to my order when I got there.

Pumpkin yellow curry was very good! I got it with prawns (lots of prawns, thank you!). I would have preferred more pumpkin, less potatoes, but was still into it. 

Sticky rice was sort of weird, wrapped in plastic wrap in the box (is that a thing?), and very very sticky. I'm guessing maybe it wasn't done yet? I don't know, but it worked.
author: MaryKate M.

description:
I just finished to eat dinner here, the food was great and the customer service was excellent!!!
I really recommend to try who love Thai food.
author: Ofri Y.

description:
Oh, Polk st.  You've got a slew of awesome bars which are perfect for a night of drunkeness. 

Foodwise? we need to work on that. I had oral surgery so I was limited to soups. Luckily, it was also a cold SF night so the Tom Yum chicken was the perfect choice. A whole bowl filled with button mushrooms, chunks of chicken breast, carrots, broccoli and celery made fragrant with lemongrass. It was so yummy but it was weird seeing broccoli float in my soup, like the kitchen just happened to have it on hand and wanted to get rid of it.

A clean environment and nice ambiance make it a decent choice on Polk st. which to say, is truly lacking on really good Asian restaurants. Lers Ros Thai is still my number one spot for Thai food.
author: Janice C.

description: Generous portions.  More than four of us could eat!  Liked the yellow curry best. Service was friendly and quick. Will go back tomorrow for more yellow chicken curry!
author: C C.

description:
Decent appetizer platter with all manner of fried Thai goodness. As usual, my highlight is the fishcake, and Thai Spice's rendition isn't too shabby. Good selection of sauces for condiment lovers!

We split the pad thai w/ chicken and the eggplant pork stir-fry. Both were tasty, and oddly there was almost too much meat in the eggplant dish. Weird complaint, but somehow I wanted the eggplant to be the dominant note, with pork as the sideshow.

Thai coffees in nice tall glasses are a great way to spend a Saturday afternoon, by the way.
author: Kevin L.

description: Got crab/crab claw fried rice.  2 crab claws, no other crab in dish.  Sorely disappointing in a city that shouldn't be allowed to have bad Thai food anywhere
author: Mike R.

description:
When I lived in the 'hood, I used to go here a lot for dining in and take out. It was quick, cheap, and tasty.

Fast forward a few years, and I find myself back in my old 'hood and in need of a quick, cheap, and filling dinner at a place near where my friend's band was playing.

In comes the clutch move.

I've gotta say, Thai Spice is not like it was before. Smaller portions, although with fancier presentation. The flavors just weren't there.

However, the service was swift, even though the restaurant was half full, always a sure sign that the owners care about their customers.

They also accommodated our odd dietary restrictions without problem, modifying the dishes to our needs!

We had:

Basil Leaf Tofu -- Sauteed crispy tofu with garlic, string beans, bamboo shoot, and basil.

Pad See Ew -- Pan fried rice noodles with tofu, broccoli, egg, and garlic.
author: Diana V.

description:
If you are picky about the flavours of your Thai food, this is not the place for you. The Panang curry tasted more like a "peanut curry." The khao soy was basically cold noodles in yellow curry. (Although the chicken was nice and tender). The pad se ew was bland and nothing notable. Service was very slow. 

Ambiance is nice and its a clean place. End of story.
author: Isabel B.

description: Disgusting. I ordered like I always do and got OLD FRESH SPRING ROLLS!!! The shrimp had brown spots and brown spots on the mint. I will never order from here again.
author: Alison C.

description:
-Rude servers 
-delivery takes a long time and not always accurate 
-gets address wrong and prolongs wait time and not even apologetic
author: M D.

description:
Im here for SB 50, Staying at the Wyndham so I did delivery. 
They were quick, the food was good and hot. I got spicy chicken spring rolls, pork fried rice and spicy cashew chicken. They got the spice to flavor right. So there was heat with taste you can enjoy. 
With tip it was 35 bucks. But it could have fed 2 people easily!!! The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because it has to be orgasmically mind blowing. 

I'd say try it!
author: Mike A.

description:
Not great.  Gave me a mild stomache ache.

Bland tired food with an excess of cheap ingredients.  Not with ordering in.

Avoid.
author: M S.

description:
My friend had a gift certificate so we decided to cash it in.

We got here at 5pm on a Friday. Everyone was at happy hour, so we pretty much had the place to ourselves. The staff were friendly and attentive.

We ordered:
Angel Wings
Money Bag
Mango Salad
a Lamb Curry Dish that I forgot the name of
and a noodle dish with crab meat in it
2 bowls of jasmine rice

Overall, the food was good, and I'd definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Bonnie Y.

description: Want some Pad See Ew that hits the spot? Here's your place! The noodles were perfect and the broccoli was amazingly fresh! I got mine with chicken and it had the perfect consistency. It's located in waking distance from many other eateries, so if you're driving, street parking could be an issue....but it's worth it!! Highly recommend!
author: Audra H.

description: Yellow Curry is incredible if has tons of meat and a wonderful flavor. Pad See Ew was really good. We will be back for sure.
author: Karina M.

description:
I ordered via seamless.com and while I understand that ordering food for delivery can cause things to be soggy, Thai Spice should have really accounted for common-sense food packaging. I got the Beef Salad and what I received was soggy lettuce swimming in 2 cm of fish sauce and thin salty slices of dry beef. I am not even exaggerating what I got and yes it was as disgusting as it sounds.

If you know the beef is going to be steaming in a small box with 5 mini pieces of lettuce, maybe you should think to box it separately? Or perhaps not use a half bottle of fish sauce to flavor beef? Maybe their other dishes are more palatable, but if you're going to spend money on Thai food, there are just better options out there for the money.
author: Sandy T.

description:
Be careful - they're pretty shady. Sat down for a lunch here and when I looked at the check there was a line item there for "gratuity". For lunch for 2 people!

And of course the receipt still asked for a tip. I can't imagine how many people never noticed this. When I brought this up with the waitress she was totally unapologetic. Won't be coming back.
author: Leo G.

description: Ordered delivery from here last week. It was my first time trying food from this restaurant so I wasn't sure what to expect. I ordered the pad kee mao and it was delicious ! The delivery time was faster than projected which is always bonus points ! The food was still nice and hot ! I'll definitely be ordering from here again.
author: Nancy T.

description: Not my favorite Thai food and atmosphere isn't great. Also beware: they put mayonnaise on their pot stickers. Who does that?
author: Tara H.

description:
Spicy green curry, mild yellow. Appetizer platter w 3 sauces was yummy. Delightful server named Eve. Cold Singha to top all off 
Oh and fried bananas w coconut ice cream was orgasmic!!
author: Kathy C.

description: This used to be my favorite Thai restaurant to order take out from until tonight.... I ordered extra peanuts for my roommate's pad Thai , NO peanuts at all and the basil chicken is almost inedible. It looks like ground up cat food. And they forgot my rice for my curry
author: tina m.

description: I came in here to grab a bite with my girlfriend, and I was not disappointed. I ordered the pad se ew and it was delicious. The noodles were cooked just right, and the beef was not overlooked.  The portion size was pretty big too, and I couldn't even finish it!  Our waitress also knew her wines pretty well, and recommended me their house red, which was tasty and fruity.
author: Eric L.

description: My boyfriend and I continue to order here because it's the best delivery Thai in our area. One thing they are horrible about is their spice levels! I order the exact same dish every time: Pad Thai with chicken, mild spiciness. It's usually perfect but every so often the "mild" is so unbelievably spicy, it is inedible. I don't understand it! I have a pretty high tolerance for spice, and their most mellow choice is like fire in my mouth! $15 wasted. Please control your spice levels!!!
author: KC W.

description:
Thai Spice has a lot of positive things going for it as its food is pretty good.

The vibes inside the place are a little off though as it's mostly empty. The staff is super nice though so it's not them. Maybe it's just part of the Polk Street vibe that seems to affect all restaurants in the area. 

I usually would order pick up from here when I lived close by and I thought they did a solid job on the food. Portions were healthy and a good value. Overall nothing too special about this place, but they do a solid job.
author: Peter M.

description: Disappointing experience. First off their tom Ka coconut soup did not have the right balance between milk and their sweet/sour spice. Their grilled bbq pork was delivered to our table cold and bland. The yellow curry chicken was a disgrace! Do these people even try their own food? The chicken was boiled, and the yellow curry sauce also bland, as if they just cracked open a can of coconut cream sauce and blended it in with curry. And yes all food was served mild to cold, which is odd because the restaurant was dead! Only 5 people dinning out. I normally don't judge a restaurant when I see it dead, but please do be conscientious about it! Demand knows good food, and this place lacked demand. Avoid yourself distasteful food! Life's to short to eat bad food
author: cristina s.

description: Loved them! They accommodated my preference for tofu even though it was not included as a choice for the dish I wanted  (Tom Yum - delicious) and their yellow curry chicken was BOMB...so tender...great place!
author: Anastasia G.

description: As a party of four, our food came out in pieces, one at a time, some getting theirs before others. It tasted good but the kitchen needs to get it together. Some had finished their plates and others were still waiting.
author: Scotty P.

description: It's surprisingly good + they open 24 hours. Food is pretty  good, wine is ok. Service is not bad considering limited staff. A little pricy but can be justified with operating hours.
author: Aloha W.

description:
Came here for lunch and there was about 4 parties there at around 1pm-ish. We were given the choice to choose where we sit. I like that. I don't want be bossed around when I am paying for food and service.

My friend ordered the 
- pad kee mao in mild but it turned out to be spicier than we can take. It was good though but required a lot of water which the waitress constantly refilled. Pretty attentive. 

I wanted to try something different so I ordered the 
- money bag. i assumed it was one big "money bag" but it was 4 mini ones that came out in this cute little arrangement. each "money bag" is in each own little dish on top of mango and red peppers. The "money bag" is essentially a fried egg roll. Nothing special except its in a different shape. 

We both got thai ice tea. It came in those tall glass and they give you quite a lot. 

Only downside to this space is how dark and dim it is. Overall its a pretty good place and the price isn't bad.
author: Sarah C.

description:
My fiance comes here to grab lunch often since its close to his office. He always gets the tom yum noodle soup, thai spicy. He finally took me there recently and i had the crab cakes for an appetizer to share and the tom yum noodle soup-mild spicy. The crab cakes was amazing, a must order! The tom yum noodle soup is the best i've ever had. They give alot if different meats in the bowl (bbq pork, ground chicken, fish balls) and the broth is super flavorful. 

Only thing it lacks is the service.
author: Kim N.

description: Chicken eggrolls and cashew chicken were delicious but service was a bit slow. Took awhile for them to take our order and bring our check and it wasn't terribly busy. Food was so good is definitely go back! Really liked the spicy mayo sauce on the chicken.
author: Janelle M.

description: If possible i would give half of a star instead of whole... I asked for pad thai fried RICE with PORK but they gave me fried NOODLE with CHICKEN instead... The sad part is i have always order from them and they have never gotten my order wrong so i didn't find out about this until im 8 blocks away from the restaurant.
author: Lina F.

description: Worst restaurant on Polk street ever. The waitress is stupid as hell and won't even move her fat ass around and bring us our checks. We have to go to the front counter and wait for 5 minutes. And it's hilarious that when I asked what's her name and by telling her I'm gonna talk to her boss, she told me:"I don't have a name". Worst experience, will never walk in there.
author: Anna Z.

description: Ridiculous service!! I ordered food and drink to go. I specifically ordered Thai Iced Coffee and they gave me Coke instead and gave me no receipt. When I came back to claim my Iced Coffee they shamelessly told me to pay the difference between the two drinks. The small amount of money isn't the problem here, but this proves that this place is a bad business!! The staff who made the mistake of taking and giving the wrong order should be the one who's responsible, not me! Definitely not coming back! Once again, this place is bad business!
author: Imanuel J.

description: Hands down the BEST THAI IN SF!  Trust me, I have tried a ton of them.  I order delivery and the food arrives in a nanosecond and PIPING HOT!  I don't know how they do it.  Never screw up the order which in and of itself is unheard of for delivery.  I don't eat meat and they somehow manage to accommodate whatever I order in flawless manner.  Super nice on the phone.  Prices are reasonable.  I am so in love with this place!
author: Lynne P.

description: In the city for work and was craving Thai. Passed by this place and the food was excellent. It will be a repeat next time I'm in town
author: Elmer j L.

description:
This place is forgettable, but it isn't bad.  Food is delicious and reasonably priced, but I wouldn't come out of my way to come here.  If deciding between this place and another Thai place on Polk, I would probably just go to the one with a shorter line.

The portions here are slightly smaller than other Thai places I go to, but for the better.  The portions aren't small.  They're just enough to fill you up and not feel like grease-ball after :)

The MAIN difference with this place  compared to other places is that it is a bit cleaner / it looks nicer on the inside.  So, if that's something you care about... then come here!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
2.5 stars

Nothing special about this place except maybe the decor. Portions are on the smaller end for the price. I ordered the Chicken Pad See Ew and it was ok. The presentation of the dishes are aesthetically appealing. I think the decoration of the Pad Thai is the best.
author: Kathy W.

description:
THAI SPICE is a wonderfully quaint & cool place to have excellent Thai food. 

Consistently great vegetarian food with large portions that are artistically presented on the plate. ("Don't take a bite before I take a photo!", I told my pal! )  

It restaurant is very modern chic, and more importantly, the food looks great, with nice portions,  and tastes wonderful ! 

The vegetarian FRESH SPRING ROLLS ($8) are the best in the City. They are large and they do not fall apart when one takes a bite. The peanut sauce that came with it was so good that we practically licked the little dish clean! I mean, really!

BASIL LEAF TOFU...($9) crispy tofu pieces with string beans  with spicy sauce . Makes your mouth water just reading that, doesn't it? Well, wait until you taste it...so delicious. Probably the best I've had in a long, long time. There was so much, that I had to take some home...(no problem!).   

My meat-eating pal had the Basil Leaf Chicken and he absolutely raved about the taste. Also, the portion was hefty that he took some home!

Recommendation: share plates because they are so large!
 
The atmosphere is really nice. The colors rock and there is a wonderful zen feeling to the place. 

Puzzling are the YELPS that really rip the 'take-out' service. I can't imagine that because my left-overs were even tasty the next day! Probably those neg reviews were friends of the heavy competition in the area? Just sayin' Cause I've never had a bad meal, nor bad service at this gem !
author: Addadada A.

description: This place did not serve coconut rice, which I think is essential for an AUTHENTIC Thai restaurant. My food was served cold, the pork bbq I ordered had no flavor, the yellow spicy curry chicken needed salt, the only reason why I give this place a 2 stars and not a 1 is because the roti was good.
author: Erika S.

description:
Meh. Ok, I admit this review is a little perfunctory as I've only tried it once, and we had a small order - prawn pumpkin curry and the beef soup, but between the hour+ wait, less than friendly staff, and so-so food, I'm convinced I won't be back. Also, if I'm going to pay extra, please give me more than 4 tiny baby shrimps!

Sticking with old faithful House of Thai from now on, even if I have to venture to the 'loin to get it.
author: Brianna M.

description:
I LOVED this place !
Great vibe when you walk inside, warm food that warms the soul and a warm atmosphere. Good chill music
PAD SEE YU - we got beef hot, i think it could have been hotter - but i added some chili spice lots of it :D it wasn't drenched in brown sauce, and had like 4 pieces of broccoli (could have used more), the beef was fantastic and the egg was plentiful

Cashew Chicken , the best ive ever had !! a lil cripsy but not too fried

Green tea was yum too!
author: Lindsey T S.

description: It was good, but nothing to scream about. If you're hungry come here. If you're looking for a transcendent Thai food experience, I can recommend a few other places.
author: Candice B.

description: I think this place had a change of management recently and it was not a good change.  We have been coming here regularly and first we noticed the wait staff was totally different from the usual gang.  The service not good; our waiter can barely speak any English so it was very difficult to communicate. Then the food, everything was a couple of notch down from before.  It was fantastic Thai food for a great price, and now it is just bland Thai food that is over priced.  Quite sad as now we have to look another neighborhood Thai, which there aren't any...
author: H. L.

description:
My friend and I wanted to explore Polk St by foot. So, we checked out the menu. 
There are bike racks and parking meters for cars along the street. The bus stops are located on main intersections on Polk St. 
The vegetarian options are limited. So, my friend and I decided to get an combination appetizer. Unfortunately, we did not get what we ordered. The sauces were good. But, the rest was not worth the price. 
The customer service was lacking. For instance, the place had 3-5 customers and 3 servers and they did not answer our inquiry for the past 5-10 minutes.
author: Kristal C.

description: Worst customer service for sure. Only three customers in the entire restaurant but it took them an hour to bring my food out. And it tastes shitty too. The yellow curry has no veges whatsoever just chicken and yellow curry paste. The girls at the counter lack a lot skills and the chef needs to go to culinary school to learn how to properly cook.NEVER returning here for sure. And of course no tip AT ALL.
author: Ronald S.

description:
The food here is pretty damn tasty, but they give soooo little for how much everything costs. Its really at the point where I don't want to go back because of the price. I mean I liked everything I tried there, but I wanted like two or three times the amount. I was still hungry after an appetizer and entree. The fried dumplings were amazing and the eggplant tofu was also quite a delight. 

The service is pretty meh, they are too serious and never checked up on my friends and me. The place is simple and clean, but not very memorable. I would reccomend it as a place to go in the area because taste wise its up there, but ahh the prices and portions....
author: Dexter H.

description: I'v eaten here on previous occasions and hadn't been utterly disappointed but this time was different.  I ordered the lunch special, green curry with chicken and veggies.  The green curry smelled like dish soap and tasted what I would imagine dish soap to taste like.  Not only that but within 15 minutes of eating it I got a minor stomach ache.  Don't think I'll be back.
author: David S.

description:
I've been going here since they opened.  It's an okay place for lunch, we started going as it's close to work.  I've eaten just about everything on the menu, and am partial to the lunch specials so you can get around to trying everything.

No matter busy, or empty, service is always spotty.  It took us like 1/2 hour to get our food, had to ask where my friend's was after 10 minutes of eating mine, then his came wrong and had to be sent back.  They are always nice, but always distracted/confused, otherwise, would have gotten 4 stars for the food, brown rice availability and cleanliness.  Even the bathrooms are good.

~ Ms. Ali
author: A W.

description:
I've been here more times than I'd like to admit. Mostly because it is located one block away from home, it is open late (Mon-Fri till 10 pm... waddup!) and it appreciates take out/delivery orders. 

Thai is a cuisine that just blends so well after a hard day's work... I don't know why, but it just tastes better from Monday to Friday after 6 pm. Maybe that's just me. 

Anyways, I enjoy ordering from here because the people are friendly and the portions are sizable. As for the taste, though, it's okay at best.

I normally for the Chicken Pad Thai or the Chicken Fried Rice because I'm not adventurous when all I seek is a satisfying meal after work. Both dishes come in large portions and don't feel too greasy like some other Asian takeout in the region. However, they do smother their dishes with lemongrass, which I'm not particularly crazy for.

3 stars because the prices are slightly jacked up for what you're getting and Modern Thai down the street definitely tops this place when it comes to Thai cuisine. Nonetheless, I'll definitely keep coming here for the standard Thai fare.

-----

Distinguishing factor: Quick and easy takeout, delicious and varied Thai menu, and charming place to dine-in while roaming on Polk St.
author: Nick A.

description:
Solid food, nice ambiance and good service. If you're in the area looking for a lunch place give Thai Spice a try! 

The ambiance here is nothing special but its neat and clean and semi cute. The service here was good with the waiter bringing out our food quickly. Now on to the food:

1. Golden Tofu- this was alright, you had to smother it with the sauce it came with in order to eat it.....or it was just dry fried tofu

2. Peanut sauce chicken- not bad, not great...if you like peanuts you'll like this dish...if not than avoid....especially if you don't like peanut butter

3. Basil leaf chicken- this one I loved, it was spicy and full of flavor, would definitely order again!

4. Red Curry- good curry, nothing spectacular but it will leave you satisfied

Overall the food is solid and the service is good. Basically if you're in the area try it out, but don't go out of your way to come here!
author: Parul G.

description:
LET ME KNOW IF IM TAKING THIS OUT ON THE WRONG PEOPLE.

I'm not cheap and I'm not broke. I'm not gonna be tacky with numbers but I'm doing just fine in these streets with a comfortable income, even for SF. I just had to lead with that because inevitably when you complain about value in the food service industry some fuckboy who's still traumatized from his days waiting tables (I did it too, dumbass, you want a merit badge or are you gonna move on with your life?) will say something like "if you can't afford to tip, then don't eat out" or "if you can't afford delivery fees, don't order delivery."   

We're not playing that game today.

I tip even when I get a glass of water at the bar; you motherfuckers aren't about to tell me shit, not on this holiest of days. I'm using my Sabbath to recall all the fuckshit that happened to me this week so I can exact my petty revenge via angry Yelp reviews. So, YES, I DO TIP. Stop worrying about what I'm doing and pay your fucking beeper bill, bitch.

What I DON'T do, though, is get gaffled.  Can someone explain to me why my $20 order had over $8 of delivery fees and mandatory gratuity built into it? How the fuck am I paying an additional 30% on top of the cost of my meal for you to deliver it 5 blocks? 

I'm sure some Ron Paul dickrider is about to gallop in here like Paul Revere and tell me to vote with my dollar and just not pay the fee...well guess what, motherfucker, I'm voting with my dollar AND bitching about it on Yelp, so save the free market fuckery for somebody who gives a shit. 

I did order through seamless, which might explain the non-consensual sodomy on my billing statement, and if that's the case feel free to correct me so I can grudgingly admit I was wrong and give you another star.

Oh yeah, the food was good. Would eat here again.
author: Jay S.

description:
This is pretty good Thai from the single time that I went in on 05/29/14.  This is a casual Thai dining experience with not a lot in terms of ambiance wow factor, however, what it lacks in the "mood setting," it makes up for in price.

In other words, for the money, this is a good pragmatic weekday choice when you and significant other are facing the typical dialogue dilemma: 

"What do you want to eat?"  SO 1
"I don't know, what do you feel like?" SO2
"How about a burger?" SO1
"Nah, not unless you want to be a chubby chaser." SO2

So problem solved!  Go to Thai Spice.

As for what I had -- I typically default to Pad Thai...not always, but usually.  I was fascinated with the "Green Papaya Pad Thai" because I had never come across it before and not being the brightest guy thought it had chunks of Papaya in the Pad Thai.  The server patiently explained to me that instead of egg noodles, they simply replace them with "green papaya noodles," which I thought was interesting.  I ordered it with chicken.

Green Papaya Pad Thai is served in a reasonable time-frame, attentive servers.  Pad Thai comes with chopped peanuts and bean sprouts on the side.  As the server explained, it definitely had a sweet sour flavor to it that I thought was delicious!  It left me feeling full, but not overly.  The consistency of the noodles was on the crunchy side which I hadn't experienced before.  Consider 'not completely done' spaghetti squash and that's probably the texture.  It really was good.

All in all a very good experience and I'll be back on the weekday soon to have more of the menu items and report back.
author: Jordan R.

description:
A few things first....
1. Food is not scary spicy here ( I wish it was but it wasn't even when we ordered extra Thai hot)
2. There is no parking validation.

We ordered Tom Kha soup and it was a little too tart for my taste. The flavors were all there but the overwhelming tartness is the only thing we could notice. The spicy Fried rice was okay but a bit too lumpy for my taste and also had no veggies except for basil. It tasted pretty good but wasn't spicy.

The Red curry, though not super spicy was the best dish. The curry was thick and creamy and the flavors are balanced. Overall this place is an okay place. The portion size is decent, the food is flavorful albeit a bit tame.  One overriding theme of this place is big chunks of Tofu... I think if they were sliced a bit smaller/thinner in all the dishes, they would have absorbed some of the flavors.


 Like every place in the city, parking is the one reason why I might not visit this place again.. Apart from the restaurant tab and 20% tip, you have to spend $10 more for parking...I feel that's a bit much.
author: Ravi C.

description:
Ordered for delivery due to extreme laziness. My laziness was rewarded with unfortunately sub-par food. They get 2 stars because the delivery was quick and the chicken satay/peanut sauce was the highlight.

Boyfriend got the basil fried rice, which was okay. The garlic rice was absolutely not even worth talking about. At all. It was so heavy on the garlic that it was pretty much inedible. The roti prata was delicious, but absolutely not worth $7. Literally one piece of bread that wasn't much better than the stuff I can pick up at my local Asian market, and I can get 5 of those for $2. Jeez...

I am actually never going to order anything from here again. How can you even mess up garlic rice? Overpriced food does not make happy times. It feels like the appetizers are the only things that won't be over-flavored (yes, there's bland, there's perfect, and there's "I think this is how spices work so let's just add all the spices that should totally work!"), but it's way too overpriced to make it worthwhile. Nope. Sorry. The menu is now off of the refrigerator.
author: Robbin A.

description: This place rocks     had cashew nut  with tofu     killer dish    good atmosphere   great find
author: Robert E.

description: One of the best Pad Thai's I've ever had! A few of the shrimps still had tails on them. What the hell do I know? Maybe it holds the flavor or some shit. Anyways. The pad thai was fuckin delicious!
author: Xavier T.

description:
This place has the best green curry.  It was so good I had my force myself to stop eating it after I was full.  I'm glad this place is close by, because I will definitely be coming back to try other things

Update: do yourself a favor and get the mango curry....it's fantastic
author: Annette E.

description:
DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM THIS PLACE

The first time we ordered delivery we ordered at 5 PM and it came at 9 PM.  The food was actually pretty good so we thought we'd give them another shot.

We ordered delivery online today and after an hour called to see if it was on it's way: oops they never got the order even though they charged the credit card and emailed us a confirmation.
author: Luke D.

description:
I was gonna go 3 stars but then realized that's pretty shady figuring I've ordered from them at least 20 times. That means either it's at least 4 stars or I'm just ridiculously lazy, probably the lazy... In other words do feel free to message me other comparably priced Thai joints that deliver in the vicinity, I'd love to put this in better perspective. All I know is when 8pm hits and I realize I haven't grocery shopped like a responsible adult, my hand reflexively starts calling this place.

I'd say the food is tasty 80% of the time with the other 20% having me wonder where the hell the flavor is. Not too bad, I mean one chef's "medium spicy" can be another's "Oh god, not spicy at all".  I keep ordering again because I'm lazy (did I mention that already? Twice?) and they deliver. Kudos for them usually being early too, I get the "45 minutes" and it's often closer to 30, and they're always polite.
author: Justin N.

description:
Used to go here frequently years ago. But, with all the killer Thai spots around town now, and esp. just blocks away, it's dated.

Best just to pop in for a lunch special if you are in the neighborhood. Not worth a special trip.

As I recall, the best thing there was the Tom Yum.
author: Josh K.

description:
This is on delivery ONLY!
so I can't comment on their service or decor or ect. 

We ordered on a Thursday night at 8 PM. It took about 40 mins, which is pretty usual for delivery around the neighborhood. 

I think I have only one major thing to say about this place. (mainly because everyone else will have similar comments as me if I wrote a long review.) 
The taste profile is SWEET SWEET SWEET. Now I know most people think of Thai food with some association of sweetness, but I felt like every dish that we've ordered was SWEET on top of SWEET. (we ordered the green curry, the chicken basil, pad see ew, and tom kha.) 
Overall, the taste profile was disappointing. Although, I do have to mention, looking at the pictures on Yelp, the restaurant does look nice, too bad their food was such a disappointment.
author: Jenny X.

description:
Situation
- Dinner with a couple of friends
- Ordered Yellow Curry

The Good
- The food was decent

The Bad
- Piece of a plastic wrapper in my food - gross!

Overall
- I'm not going back, I like my Thai food without plastic
author: Dipesh G.

description:
I've ordered takeout here quite a few times, given the fact that it is literally twenty feet away from my apartment and I'm often too lazy to cook. The food is not going to blow your mind, but it's good and the prices are fair. 

Be aware that when you order your food Thai spicy, it will come SUPER SPICY. Like, getting an ulcer in your stomach spicy.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Hostess was nice and helpful. Food was just ok. The chicken fried rice had this odd smoked earthy taste and a cup of Tom Ka chicken soup was just good not great. It needed more flavor and substance. $15 for both the cup of soup and fried rice. Both small portions.
author: Danielle O.

description: Terrible customer service!!!!! I will never order from them again!!! I will also post on my crew guide as well!!!
author: Danita J.

description:
**WARNING** Delivery Service is HORRIBLE!!

Ordered a veggie fried rice and chicken spring rolls online at 5:18pm  At 6:15pm the food had still not arrived and I called and spoke with the manager.  She said she would call the driver and call me back.  At 6:30pm I still had no call back.  I call back at 6:45pm to cancel the order and she calls the driver.  She tells me if I am not satisfied then I should not tip the driver.  NO DISCOUNT OR APOLOGY!  The food arrives 5 min later and is cold.  The driver cannot get the credit card machine to work so I have to pay cash.  Of course he doesn't have coin change so I had to tip!  UNREAL!

Hard to judge the food because it was cold but on principle alone I will NEVER eat there or order from them again!  How does this place have such good ratings?????
author: Brian S.

description:
Service: terrible, the server did not come out to check on us, i was dehydrated to the max.   the people sitting at the front desk ignored us. it wasn't even that busy. 

Roast Duck Red Curry:
- duck was very fatty
- tomatoes and pinapple gave the dish a tangy kick
- curry itself was nothing really special
- does not come with rice

Papaya Pad Thai:
- they replaced all the noodles with green papaya 
- flavorful and crunchy, but a little oversauced
- shrimp was very buttery

Duck Noodles:
- noodles were the right texture, flavorful, and full of unique tasting spices
- would be better if they used fresh rather than canned mushrooms 

overall, the food is decent but the service was so terrible that i would not consider coming back
author: Tina A.

description: Best Thai I have found in the neighborhood.  We love the Pad Thai and Red Curry.  Plus when we ask for it to be spicy is is actually spicy. :)
author: Kara S.

description: My favorite Thai food in the city. The red curry (gang panang) is to die for. Unfortunately I don't live close anymore but recently we were at a friend's house and ordered take out and it was leaps and bounds above any Thai food in our neighborhood. I discovered them in 2008 and have been going back ever since!
author: Annika M.

description: A good Thai restaurant off Polk.  Tried lots of dishes in our visit and all were good.  Friendly wait staff.  Lots of seating.  Recommended.
author: Brian B.

description:
Dear reader,

Due to the accessibility of yelp, very rarely do I make impromptu trips to a restaurant without first checking it's star rating or reviews.  Feeling adventurous in San Francisco, I decided to "wander into a restaurant," disregard my yelp sense and order off the menu based on "what sounded good."  Foreign concepts I know.

Since you reader have clearly handed your culinary fate to yelp, here is what I suggest.

What to Order Here:
Honey Duck (14)

What to Skip:
Country Style Thai Fish or any fish on the menu for that matter (15)

I absolutely loved the honey duck.  Roasted and glistening golden orange, the duck was presented on a bed of satay spinach, surrounded by boiled broccoli.  The dish also came with sweet soy sauce which tasted beautifully on the duck and really enhanced the honey flavors.  The portions were large.  The presentation of the dish artistic to a level I didn't expect from a Thai restaurant off of Polk.  

Although the country style thai fish was good, it wasn't memorable.  The fish was fried whole (bones, head, and all).  Although this is how fish is traditionally cooked in Asia, it might be a little difficult for some of you to eat.  In addition, the fish meat itself was tough and overcooked.  The simplicity of the dish (literally fried fish with salt with two sauces for dipping on the side), the fact that it was hard to eat, and wasn't made particularly well means I won't be ordering it again.

Love,
Fei
author: Fei L.

description:
Food exceptional....delivery is not!!!

We order from Thai Spice almost every Friday night...and the delivery has always been with 45 mins...

The last 3 times, the delivery has been an hour..the food COLD...
not a way to start a weekend...

I would recommend pick up rather than delivery...unless you don't mind microwave cold food...

Get the delivery fixed Thai Spice...or you are going to lose customers...
author: Dr. Octagon O.

description: I'm always down for a good meal and this place is one of the finest thai cuisines restaurant.  From appetizer we ordered roti prata and dumplings.  Both were equally awesome . I ordered pad see you as main course.  I wanted to check what thai spice level is so I ordered the hottest option the place offered . OMG it was fire in mouth lol but I was actually able to handle it . I loveee spicy food so it was great.  However I'd recommend stick with medium if you have a good spice level as it'll still be pretty hot . Besides food , the place is also in a nice location.  Super clean and super nice staff. :)
author: Neha K.

description:
I found my neighborhood Thai restaurant! 

I've only tried their shrimp pad thai after a ferocious kickboxing session down the street, but was very impressed with how friendly and speedy their customer service was. Definitely will be exploring their menu again.
author: Christie S.

description: Good basic Thai place if you're looking for take out. I judge a place by its Tom kha gai and this place is just ok. Nice atmosphere but always empty so it feels like you're being overly waited on.
author: Carly K.

description:
The food here is pretty goo. d, not spectacular but solidly good... HOWEVER the customer service sucks. It is an epic fail. It is worst than high school kids at McD's with no experience. I have tried to use the coupons they flood our building/mailboxes  with and only been successful with redeeming them half the time (even when mentioning the coupon at the beginning, middle, and end of my phone call, when the driver arrives he just claims there is no record of it on the receipt and therefore the coupon is nonredeemable). 

A few weeks ago I placed an order through Seamless with them and of three items, one was totally wrong (instead of eggplant with tofu, I got pad thai with pork). It was past their closing time when I got my order so when I called I didn't want to make a big fuss about it and asked them to just issue me a credit for next time. An older woman told me that the credit would be in their computer system and that as long as I gave my name/phone number/address, whomever took the order should be able to find the credit. About a week later I went into the restaurant to eat, I tried to use my credit and was told I wouldn't be able to use it for dining in. Um, weird, but ok. Fast forward to today, when I called for a delivery order and tried to use my credit and the girl on the other end of the line said there was no record of my credit and that there was no manager available to speak to and that if she gave me the credit the fee would come out of her paycheck. WTF?!

Luckily Seamless customer service is awesome and they're going to argue with the owner on my behalf and get my refund. 

Thai Spice, I have a couple of questions for you:
1. Why waste time and hundreds of dollars in printing  fees to print coupons if you're going to make it nearly impossible to use the coupons.
2. Why lie to me about the ease of using a credit based on your obvious mistake when I was doing you a favor by not making your kitchen staff stay late to remake a dish.
3. Do you really think your food is that much better than Lemongrass and Modern Thai and Sai Jai that you can treat your local customers so poorly and still stay in business?! It really isn't. 

Some of your dishes are somewhat comparable to Lemongrass or Modern Thai (but Lemongrass has better Tom Yum soup and the chicken basil dish is better at Modern Thai) but your customer service is severely deficient , compared to either, and you really just don't even come close to Sai Jai for intensity of flavor.
author: Dani D.

description:
Try the pumpkin yellow curry with chicken, it's fantastic.  The curry has chunks of pumpkin in it and the chicken is always tender, its like it was cooked till it came off the bone.  The pumpkin reminds me of sweet potato in taste and texture.

I would also recommend trying their basil fried rice or anything with duck.  Their Thai Iced tea is really good here too.  I've also ordered Thai Spice for delivery.  The food is still good and they delivery pretty fast.
author: Kevin W.

description: Solid local restaurant. A little slow on service, but the food is very good. The red curry with chicken is very good, but you can't go wrong with anything.
author: Tanner Z.

description: Be careful of the spice levels - "medium" is actually quite spicy (and I have a pretty high tolerance).  Full of flavor and quick delivery.
author: Stacey R.

description: We ordered the khao soi with shrimp and the green curry with chicken. The khao soi came out spicy just as I requested and it tasted excellent. I even thought the portion size was perfect. The green curry had some really great fresh flavors and the chicken was tender. The restaurant does have a bit of a musty smell but the food was fantastic. We will definitely be coming back.
author: H K.

description:
I wanted a quick, easy, reliable meal to take home... And something spicy and warm to feed my sick friend (man flu... God help us).

I LOVE Thai food so probably judge it harder than any other food group ("food group" seems wrong... But you get my drift). I noticed Thai Spice have an award for their Pad Thai on the window so thought it would be worth a shot. I walked in, was greeted by friendly staff (and was possibly interrupting the staff dinner), ordered (Pad Thai for me, Tom Yum noodle soup for Mr. Sick) and was out the door on my way home within ten minutes... Awesome!

The food was packaged well (I hate having my takeaway explode into a mess when I open it up at home) and tasted great. My Pad Thai was enormous and not the sickly sweet variety you get in some restaurants... And the Tom Yum worked miracles on my friend (although he said it tasted a bit too seafoody).

While not the best I've had, I would go back and recommend to locals for a reliable and satisfying Thai meal.
author: Guida B.

description: I came in with no expectations since we were extremely hungry after drinks at Tonic and Co Nam had a 45 minute wait. I was pleasantly surprised with how tasty my tom yum noodle soup with char siu tasted! First of all, it was piping hot which is a must in my books for noodle soup. Secondly, the flavor of the soup was the right amount of lemongrass and spice. Thirdly, the fried garlic in the noodle soup sealed the deal! It's a quick spot to satisfy your noodle soup craving! I enjoyed my tom yum noodle soup a lot more than my friend's pad sew ew pork.
author: Cindy L.

description: I hate to leave a bad review but I feel sick and I am mad I paid money to feel this way.. Bad food, bad service.
author: Michelle N.

description: We are visiting from Scottsdal, AZ. We were just in New York last week and had so much amazing cuisine. We have had a hard time finding restaurants we enjoy here. While searching for somethi g tjat caught our eye we ran in to this place. We had the green curry with tofu and the vegetable delight with jasmine rice. Delicious!!!! Service was excelent and it was very clean and casual. Would definitely come back.
author: Vanessa R.

description: The takeout here is significant better than Lemongrass on polk.  Nothing to rave about but I think people should give this place a try.  I ordered the yellow curry and papaya salad.  I'm not a fan of salad from a Thai place, but man, that was a well seasoned salad!  I wish there was more than just potatoes and beef in the yellow curry, but I'm just being picky at this point.
author: Kelvin W.

description:
Stumbled here today because Hans Hibachi was closed. Got the satay chicken and egg rolls for appetizers and shared a chicken pad see ew. The chicken and rolls lacked flavor and the pad see ew was too oily. 

Overall, food was ok but I won't be coming back here anytime soon. Go to Chai-Yo a few blocks down for Thai food.
author: Roopa A.

description:
Just tried Thai Spice for the first time and it was SO GOOD. We ordered panang curry with chicken and the cashew chicken with some sticky rice. I asked for the curry spicy and definitely was! The chicken in the curry was really good and clearly high quality. My boyfriend loved the cashew chicken, and he's not even a big Thai food fan. We'll definitely be going back!

Note: The sticky rice is VERY sticky :)
author: Nikolette H.

description:
Great family-owned local business.  All the entrees are very reasonably priced, most of them ranging between $12-18.   The plating is BEAUTIFUL, it is what you would expect to see at a much higher priced restaurant. You can tell that great care is taken in preparing the food.  This was especially apparent in the fresh spring rolls we ordered.  Many places will throw ingredients together in these and as a result, the flavor will be unevenly distributed and the rolls will easily fall apart.  Not true here.  The spring rolls were rolled very tightly and you could taste a little bit of everything in each bite.  

Our entrees were also delicious.  We ordered the Som tum, Mango tofu, barbecue beef, Vegetable delight, and Tom Ka.  The highlight was definitely the Tom ka.  Our party of four was all over it and I think the whole pot dissapeared in about 5 minutes.  I was only sad that we forgot to specify which heat intensity we preferred when we ordered so it was served very mild.  This was actually my complaint with all the dishes.  Everything tasted much too mild and "Americanized".  This was our first visit so we didn't think to ask for more heat.  The wait staff should remember to ask customers' preference upon ordering.  Other than this issue, the food was very delicious and fresh, the atmosphere was relaxing and our waitress was sweet and courteous. Definitely recommend!
author: Elisa F.

description:
This was good but not exceptional Thai food.

Basil Leaf with chicken (with garlic, chili, onions, and basil) - I requested Thai Hot. It was only slightly spicy. There were no whole chilis. There could also have been more depth to the flavors but it was pretty good. From the description I did not expect the chicken to be minced. However, that is not necessarily their fault. I am not a fan of the texture of minced chicken. There was also the usual cucumber salad. It was refreshing.

Chicken Satay - This was a basic chicken satay. A little on the dry side. The peanut sauce was average. Delivery was prompt, professional, and polite. I will order again and try other dishes.

I may eat here again. I think it would be worth trying some of their other dishes. But there are a lot of Thai restaurants in San Francisco
author: Mark D.

description:
If you're looking for a neighborhood Thai spot, this place fits the bill.  I'm a regular at Thai Spice, and while it's not the world's best Thai food, it's tasty and reasonably priced.

The green curry fried rice, prawns and spicy eggplant, fresh spring rolls and pumpkin curry are very good.  The eggplant dish is a particular standout.

The service is very fast and they are friendly.  If you're making subs or changes in your order, they may push back on you.  My friend likes to sub salmon for the prawns in her eggplant dish, and 9/10 times they tell her they can't do that but we remind them that they do it every time and then it's fine.

I've ordered delivery from them once and the food was a little cold, so I haven't since ordered delivery from them again.
author: Caitlin T.

description:
last time I reviewed this place was just the start of my yelp career. now after a bunch of reviews (and eating at this place a ton) i've finally find my dish here: pad kee mao with tofu

great flavor, lots of spices, and good amounts of tofu. probably the best pad kee mao i've had in the city.
