it did take me some time to find my dish here though - I'm usually more of a curry guy when I go to thai places, but the curry dishes I had here weren't as good as the noodles. So i'm still on the lookout for nice, authentic thai curries - but for thai noodles I know exactly where I'm going to go.
author: Amaresh S.

description:
This is a pretty nice restaurant with great customer service. The food was good, but the portions are a bit small. 

Things I recommend: Tofu & String Beans, Red Curry & Pad See You

I'm not crazy about this place, but it was okay in my book.
author: Thy L.

description: I've been ordering delivery from here for years. This place is forever hit and miss. It's good when it's right, it's irritating when it's wrong- but it's 50/50, you know what I mean? The past two times I've ordered Panang curry with veggies (and insisted it has to have veggies or I don't want it) they have delivered me only meat and curry. It's so frustrating.  The best thing are the Thai Spice rolls with the sauce and they have good sticky rice.
author: Lauren M.

description: VERY disappointed to write a review about a restaurant I have loved for over a decade, but the customer service tonight related to an overdue refund was HORRIBLE. They charged my credit card but nothing was delivered and they can find nothing in their system. The manager that can make a decision is on vacation. Unacceptable - loyal customer lost.
author: Stacey K.

description:
I really enjoyed the atmosphere here, it was very peaceful and a lovely reprieve after a stressful day. 

It was not busy when my boyfriend and I visited, but our meal took an exceptionally long time to come out. I can surmise that there might have only been 1 cook in the kitchen, which is fine, but we were pretty hungry so the wait was not appreciated. 

The food itself was mediocre. I ordered the Low Carb Pad Thai. The presentation was lovely, but the meal itself was only mediocre. Not terrible, but nothing to write home about. It was not terribly expensive, so no disappointment to the wallet.

If you're in the neighborhood, I would recommend it, but I would not recommend making a trip across town if you don't live close.
author: Ashley P.

description: I have been here twice, both time during the work week around lunch time. The service is delightful and the food is good. I always try Pad Thai first at any Thai restaurant because I consider that "home food" and a good tell tale of how the other dishes are prepared. I enjoyed the Pad Thai so much that I ordered it again on my second visit to the restaurant. I look forward to returning in the future and trying their other dishes. Metered parking was very easy to get, right in front, both times.
author: Joanne C.

description: One of our to-go places for Thai food.  Good and it's never crowded.  The papaya salad and the pumpkin curry are my favorites!
author: Mariana V.

description:
Perhaps I benefit from my fiancée being a regular here, but I have gotten consistently good service and food at Thai Spice.

The curries are great. I also love the spicy eggplant and green bean dish. We brought a group here one night; everyone was happy with the wide range of dishes we shared family-style.
author: Jason G.

description:
I ordered food from their delivery menu and got  call 15 minutes later stating that they no longer do "Free delivery". They wanted to charge me a $5 delivery fee even though I'm in the same general neighborhood. No way. The food isn't that good to be worth an extra $5.

You are the weakest link. Goodbye.
author: Vincent P.

description: I used to be a real fan of this place. They were on super-convenient Delivery.com, but have since launched their own website for placing orders. So, after going through all of the trouble preparing my order (which was in excess of $50), the payment section gives you ONE option: Phoning the restaurant to complete the order. Why even bother having an online ordering system if you're going to make customers call, anyway? Annoying, but okay ... I called ... only to be told they cannot process payments over the phone. That they do not have that capability! So again, WHY even have a web ordering system? Makes absolutely no sense (and neither did the person I spoke with), so I wound up canceling the order out of pure confusion and frustration over their maddening incompetence and weirdness. Pity, as I always loved their food but will NEVER order from here again.
author: Gregor G.

description: I come here all the time, and usually get the curry chicken which I love.  But today, I must've bit and ate a piece of raw chicken, because I found quite a bit of chicken blood on my rice plate. I told the wait staff and they replaced the dish. But I still feel queasy...
author: Shirley C.

description: Really really good curries.  Literally outstanding.  The yellow chicken and red were both fantastic.  Only issue is the lady on the phone didn't understand english very well, other than that, I love this place.
author: Keeley M.

description: BEWARE! THEY CHANGE THE TIP AMOUNT TO THEIR LIKING. This is the 2nd time that have happened to me at this place. I thought the 1st time was a mistake so I let it go. I go here once every 3 months maybe so can't be a coincidence. So regulars beware. And double check your statement.
author: raymond l.

description:
Great lunch special.

For $8.95 you get a salad, rice and two items of your choosing. You can get brown rice for a buck more. 

I got the red vegetable curry and the chicken with peanut sauce. Both were great. The chicken was piled on a bed of wilted spinach, which I loved.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Went here last night. Was a little apprehensive after reading some reviews- but it seems that the only real issues seem to be with delivery.
The food was great. I had the minced basil chicken. My friend had the yellow curry, she loved it. Each plate was only $8. Service was not super fast, but it was Saturday night and they were busy. 
Parking is the drag here. Drove around for 20 minutes before finally parking in the garage down the block on Sac.
Perfect place to go before a Red Devil Lounge show.
I will be back.
author: B W.

description: Nice atmosphere, friendly service and great food. Order pad Tai and it was so prettily displayed. And there spring rolls are aorable
author: muftia k.

description: I bought fish cakes and supposedly Chili prawns tonight to go. The fish cakes were great, but they forgot to include their peanut sauce. The prawn dish was not chili at all, it was sweet and soy sauce. This is my first time at this restaurant and they blew it. I threw the faux Chili Prawns in the trash. I want a refund: call me at 510-379-8353 to arrange the refund. Tim
author: Tim H.

description:
I have mix feelings about this place.  They are not very consistant with their execution. I've ordered from this place many times only cause this is the only some what healthy restaurant near my boyfriend's place.   There are days that the food comes out perfectly.  Jam packed of veggies and seafood.  Amazing flavors and generous portions. Definitely worth every penny.  Then the last few times, the same dishes I ordered had nothing in it.  Their curry was bare with a few pieces of veggies and maybe 3 strips of chicken...  I paid over $30 bucks for dinner and end up eating rice with curry sauce. That's it!  Where's the substance???  Super annoyed and disappointed with my order and decided to travel over to the tenderloin for Thai food.    

The ambiance in this place is one of the nicer places off Polk street.  But beware of what you order.  Might get stiff with almost nothing in your dish.
author: Ying F.

description: Horrible services, ordered take out and the yellow curry chicken was missing, called them as soon as we found out and they were closed, called them back when they open and the person said she personally packed it and it should be there, but it wasn't. Before you decide to order for pick up. Make sure everything you ordered is in the bag before you pay.
author: Peter C.

description: Money bag, papaya salad, red duck curry and spring rolls are good. Service is quick. Reasonably priced. Miss the orignal angel wings
author: Astha S.

description: Sad display of restaurant poor behavior tonight.  I ordered the angel wings from the menu and when they arrived they were covered in fish sauce.  I looked at the menu to make sure I didn't miss this listed as an ingredient on the menu.  When I pointed it out to our waitress she ignored me and walked away then avoided our table until we were ready for the check.  The manager Chong came over when I complained a second time and her explanation was that is was my fault, for not ask for a dish that did not list it as having fish sauce,to ask for it without fish sauce.  This just makes no sense.  She refused to take it off our check, blamed me, then told me all of SF is this way.  Wrong.  Bad customer service.  I find your "solution" to ignore us then tell us we are wrong to be offensive.  Good luck.  I will continue to go to places taste better and treat their customers better.  Shame.
author: Doreen D.

description:
All I have to say is, THE BEST! Honestly no BS. I tear it up at this place. Please go there. I love Thai and let me say, it's hard to compete after you eat.

Closed on weekdays 3 pm to 4pm
author: Elease T.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and were just coming back home to Nob Hill after driving 4 hours coming back from a long weekend away.  We were tired and ordered take out on Sunday night.  Picked up the food around 8:30pm and ate around 9:30pm after going to the grocery store.  We ordered 2 of the Pad Sew Ew with chicken.   The chicken tasted gamey and was OLD and rancid and overcooked!   It was so chewy and tasted awful.  I spit it out.  I would have called the restaurant, but they were closed.  I called the next morning and told them about the problem.  Chon took my contact info. and said the manager would call me back the next day when he's in.  Never heard back.  I called Thurs. morning and spoke to the manager (Ken?) and he was so rude.  He said I was supposed to call that night.  I said the restaurant was closed, so I called the next morning.  He acknowledged that he got my message, yet still didn't call me back.  He said no refund or credit for next time.  I told him my family has been in the restaurant business for 25 years and you just don't treat regular customers this way.  He didn't seem to care about losing regular customers or that I was going to post up a bad review on Yelp.  He said you do what you gotta do!  What planet did he grow up on?

We frequent this restaurant as we live close by.  We will never come back and will go to Lemongrass Thai down the street instead.  There the food is fantastic and you get consistent friendly service, regardless of what time of the day.
 
Here at Thai Spice, the food and service is unpredictable.  Sometimes we're very surprised how unfriendly the service is.  The last time we dined in there a couple of weeks ago, the female server was either depressed, tired, in a bad mood or all of the above.  She seemed miserable at work and was completely unfriendly and robotic.  

Anyway with this last awkward exchange with the manager, we will never step foot in there again.
author: Deborah C.

description:
We ordered for delivery since we didn't feel like going out.  The price was really good, the delivery quick and pleasant, and we got a lot of food for the price we paid.  I ordered the tofu pad thai and veggie spring rolls, my friend ordered a spicy chicken dish and coconut ice cream.  Between the two of us, we had enough food for two to three meals easily.  

Much better quality than some of the other take-out/delivery places I've ordered from.  Would happily order again!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
The reviews for this place are very mixed but nevertheless I stand by my 5-star rating. 

I find that I've had 99% good experiences with this place. 
In fact, I will probably order delivery tonight. 

The papaya salad is the best I've had in a long list of Thai restaurants.  All the different items I've chosen have not been disappointing and the sauces are all VERY good. 

The takeout process is painless as they keep your info on record, delivery people are all very nice and learn your name quickly, and they take credit card payments at the door. 

p.s. They have low-carb pad thai. Yes, you heard right.
author: Cindy M.

description:
This has got to be one of the best Thai places to dine at-- if you consider food, price, and decor. 

A lot of Thai restaurants I've been to have had amaaazing food, but they're not places you wanna go to on a date, or take your parents to. This wasn't THE BEST Thai food I've had, but considering the overall experience, it's a 4-star spot.

Decor:
I was very impressed when I walked in. Thai Spice looks like a very elegant restaurant without the fancy prices.

Food:
The three of us ordered family style and got Spicy Thai Fried Rice, Thai Basil Tofu, and Pumpkin Curry. We also had Thai (hot) Tea ($1). (The dishes were all around $9)

The fried rice was very good. That was my favorite. Good strong flavors. The pineapple fried rice looked good too. 
I thought the Thai Basil Tofu was delicious-- I really liked the sauce, and the blend of green beans and onions, etc. My sister said she usually likes a stronger thai basil taste, but nothing major to complain about.

The pumpkin curry was so so good, yet I was disappointed because there wasn't very much curry! It was mostly potatoes, pumpkin, and chicken, and especially the chicken wasn't cut up small enough. The potatoes hadn't soaked up the curry flavors well, and I was very sad about that because the actual curry was so good! We had ordered 2 servings of rice for it, and we really only needed one. 

Service:
Very friendly waitresses. There seems to be a lot of them! We were at one point asked to move over a table so they could make room for a large party, and I realized there were about 6 people (waitresses, other staff?) helping us and apologizing for the inconvenience. Probably too many people for such a small place! lol. I used to be a single-shifted waitress at a place 4 times the size...

Only cons:
- Slightly noisy (especially after 8pm). The place gets packed, which is a good sign, but it's not very big, so the noise level is uncontrollable. Just keep shouting :)
author: Saori E.

description: Review for take out only. I would give it 2.5 stars (rounding up). I ordered via yelp which was quick and easy. The order was available very quickly (in less than 10 minutes) which was good. The huge problem I had was that I was craving delicious pad see ew, but the one that this restaurant makes isn't very authentic. The noodles are more like chinese chow fun noodles. I was super disappointed. That's what I get for being a cheapskate and not paying $1 more for Modern Thai's pad see ew..
author: M K.

description: Food is good. But I won't be back. If they quote 15 min for takeout that really means 45-60.
author: Heather L.

description: Have been here few times. best in class, great ambiance and service with quality food. Will recommend this anytime.
author: Hems B.

description:
Bad food (ground pork tasted gamey)
Looooong delivery wait time (1 hr 20 min)
High prices considering what they offer

Don't waste your time & money here.

*Update: I just found eggSHELLS in the pad thai.  Really poor quality.
author: Ashley S.

description:
I am going to be quick and to the point~ 
I have always loved Thai Spice- one of my old favorites in SF. Yum!
Quick take-out, great quality, pretty cool ambiance, great date place and they deliver! Fantastic.
author: Amy J.

description: My new favorite thai restaurant in SF. Love the thai spice rolls and pad see ew. The staff is very friendly and accommodating as well.
author: Stephan S.

description: My brother and his family were visiting us here in SF last week. We took them here for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon. Very delicious and nice service. The portion of curry is a little small, but delicious. We'll visit again.
author: V J.

description: AWFUL!!! so many great Thai restaurants in the city - THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM.
author: Jamison D.

description: Amazing lunch specials. Great portions, delicious food, excellent service and only 8.95. Can't beat that!
author: Blabla B.

description:
I've been going here for years, for rainy night dinners, weeknight dinners, weekend lunches, order in, and even take out.  I usually end of bringing out of town houseguests here at some point during their stay as well.

Food is THE BOMB! Yellow Pumpin Curry is great, tons of Veggie Options, and overall just delicious.  Veggies are fresh and crispy, Tofu is mad juicy.

I was surprised to see I hadn't reviewed it before, so I wanted to make it right.  Eat here!
author: Kevin G.

description: Before going to SFO to fly back home to Germany after our weekend whirlwind trip to the Bay Area, we had to stop in the city to see our old and dear friend Inge. We are planning on taking her for Thai food in the Castro. She, however, at 84, did not want to go out. So she suggested that we order out. She had gotten this flyer in the mail. And we did. I ordered the yum woonsen, the larb with duck as well as the basil chicken. I was quite impressed with the flavors. The basil chicken could have used a little bit more acidity, but it was good nevertheless. I'm only deducting one star for hanging up on me several times when I called 5 minutes before opening time only to be finally told to call back 10 minutes later.
author: Nobbi L.

description:
Good food and big portions for the price you pay. The place was clean, their eggplant dish great. The location is a lot nicer than restaurants in Little Saigon (aka both the neighborhood and the restaurant are considerably less sketchy than Tenderloin Thai spots...which might be a 'duh!' comment --- but I live in Civic Center and I'm willing to make the walk to Nob Hill/Russian Hill area to eat decent Thai and not fear for my life).  
Really don't have much to complain about. Also, they deliver!
author: Kimya P.

description: Great place for a casual dinner. I've walked in twice on random evenings and the food has never disappointed! They have a decent wine collection too! ...and the spinach, tofu and peanut sauce is amazing!
author: Jess M.

description:
My boyfriend and I had a really unfortunate experience with Thai Spice.  Tonight we ordered online for delivery, Pad See Yew with pork for him and Spicy String Beans with Tofu for me.  It took an hour to deliver on a Tuesday night, and when we called after 45 minutes, we got the ever-so-generic response that the delivery guy was on his way.  Fifteen minutes later he finally showed up with our lukewarm food in hand.

The food itself was really bland.  I had to dump a ton of Sriracha on my string beans to obtain any sort of spice.  The pork in the Pad See Yew was "stringy" according to my boyfriend and actually made him feel sick.  With so many Thai food establishments in the area, there's really no reason for me to order from Thai Spice again.
author: Laura C.

description:
Unfriendly and definitely not to take kids here. Staff is rude here. We went here today around 6.30 an ordered 1 dish and 1 drink. The waiter didn't like it that we only ordered dew items. That said he grudgingly accepted our order. After 10 mins instead of our order we were asked to leave since my son who is 14 months was being fussy. Never ever have I been to restaurant like this. My wife was so hungry after breast feeding that we had to go to restaurant across the street. I wish I could comment in the food since Thai is my fav food food. 

Again must avoid!!!!!!! Very rude
author: Aditya V.

description:
On the expensive side, but always tasty & great for take out. 

Favorites include fresh spring rolls, pad thai, green curry & veggie belly.

Delivery is $5 outside of the neighborhood.
author: Kelly C.

description:
I own a business across the street so I usually order to go so my review is based on food quality and my overall experience.
I only order the stir fried flat noodles with chicken and broccoli and it is really delicious!!! Not too oily and a good portion. 
One star off because they somehow always run out of the pickled jelepenos when I order to go and because I think it a bit overpriced but I guess it's the neighborhood.
author: Vi V.

description: I get pad thai from this place and its consistently good. They raised their prices a little bit but food is good. They have a low carb version of pad thai and I tried it. Its made with clear thin noodles and its great too, though who knows what exactly is their 'low' for carbs. Its close by, and they are open most of the time when I feel like thai food, so it all works out.
author: Try E.

description:
Run of the mill thai restaurant. 

The decor is definitely than most of the ones I have been to, especially compared to others on Polk Street. For a Saturday night it wasn't too crowded, which I enjoyed since we had a large group. 

I had the Pad See Yu which I thought was a 4 out of 5. 

The service was a 3.5 of 5.

A nice place for a good thai meal.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I work at SF General Hospital. Today we decided to order Thai food for lunch.
YAY THAI FOOD! 
The food we received was not what we expected. About 10 people ordered. 
When we first started eating, everyone was saying "This is okay"...yet squirting Rooster Sauce on everything (Rooster Sauce that we provided)
We LOVE LOVE LOVE the person who suggested that we order from Thai Spice, so we didn't want to hurt her feelings because we didn't like her choice; however as our lunch hour progressed, the truth came out. No one was wild about the food. A lot of us thought it was awful. 
Why this restaurant is called Thai Spice is a mystery, as the overall #1 complaint was that the food had no flavor. I ordered Yellow Curry with pumpkin and chicken. I specified "Hot". Sure, I didn't go for "Thai Hot", but I expected some amount of burn. I had to add multiple squirts of Rooster Sauce to my food. The curry itself was very disappointing: shredded chicken, 8 squares of squash and two chunks of potato (in a quart container of curry). There were no other ingredients. Yes, those were the ingredients that were listed on the menu description, but I'm used to menus listing the main ingredients, but having other elements as well... such as a leaf of basil perhaps? A slice of pepper or onion?. The curry flavor was more of an indian curry type flavor than a thai curry flavor. The curry was like a creamy mulligatawny soup. It was okay. I ate some of it, but it wasn't THAI CURRY. 
One person got Cashew Chicken. The chicken was fried, so fried that it might as well have been bits of deep fried breading, because that's what it tasted like. Our guess was that it must have been fried, gotten cold, and refried. 
Another co-worker got beef something, I don't know what the name of the dish was on the menu, but she said that it basically was hamburger over rice. No flavor. 
A similar complaint was made by the person that ordered basil chicken. He said it tasted like ground turkey. Period. 
The Silver Noodle Soup was declared to taste like hot water with cabbage in it. There were two prawns. The Tom Ka soup was okay. But again, it contained only the ingredients listed on the menu. Onions, chicken, mushrooms. In my mind there should have been a bit of lemon grass and/or ginger floating about, perhaps some cilantro sprinkled on top? 
The real kicker was Peanut Dressing Salad. Iceberg lettuce, sliced cucumber, a hardboiled egg and A STACK OF PRINGLES POTATO CHIPS on the side (the menu did say potato chips). The dressing was thick and sticky, like a dipping sauce for satay or possibly an eggroll. It was good... but not as a salad dressing. 
We didn't understand why the fresh spring rolls had prawns AND "imitation crab meat" in them. Why? Unnecessary. Why put something fake on something that is delicious? 
We teased and harassed our co-worker for the rest of the shift. She never, ever, again gets to pick where we order from.
The amazing thing about this order was that NO ONE liked their food. Usually most people are happy with what we decide to order. Sometimes people say that they wouldn't order from ___ again, but never before have we spent the rest of the afternoon cracking up about how bad lunch was. 
I have read other reviews about Thai Spice which report that this place is hit or miss.
I guess we missed. It was a shame that we missed totally, and completely, on 200 dollars worth of food.
author: Kate M.

description:
Thursday night dinning out with the boys. 

At first I was afraid to be seen in public with the debauchery displayed before we walked out of the house, but I had to eat!

There was no seating at the first place we wanted to be so it forced us to walk down the street a bit further. We found plenty of seating at Thai Spice. The boys behaved for the most part and our food was so so. 

The service was a bit slow it took them a long time to get us water and to take our order. But once our order were in, our food was out in no time.

The prices were decent. The food was pretty ok. Not my favorite, but I really liked the chicken and shrimp appetizer. I tried to eat them all, but I had to fend off three boys, I wasn't winning there...

I didn't like the fact I had to ask for refills on my water a few times. Hmm... that's about it. Nothing special, but not horrible.
author: Dee C.

description: This is some of the best Thai food I have had in the city. Quick, delicious and affordable. If you are looking for delicious Thai, Thai spice is it!
author: Kendall B.

description: I thought their larb was pretty bad but that their curries, red and green, were more-less solid. Their pad thai tastes like it has pork sung all over it which isn't bad but it is sort of weird?
author: Misha T.

description:
Delivery only!  Was quoted for a 45-60 minute delivery time and I think it got there sooner.. (not sure though, playing video games is quite distracting in my old age).

Got the yellow curry and I must say it was the BEST yellow curry I've ever had.  Now I'm not saying Best as in most authentic.  No, I'm saying Best as in the most delicious things I could ever hope to be in a curry was in there.  It had broccoli, green beans, carrots, potatoes, tofu, cabbage and mushrooms (bleh) in it and was beautifully spiced with a delicate coconut perfume wafting over the plastic take out dish.

Granted at this price I had assumed it would come with rice (but that was a no-go).  Luckily I had some leftovers that I could microwave.  I must say that this would be my go to Thai place if 1) it were closer to my house and 2) if it were more reasonable in price.

Luckily I did not pay, but I would gladly order again given the opportunity.
author: Kimiko Q.

description: Went here for an early dinner with a friend. Food was really good! We ordered calamari, pumpkin yellow curry and pad Thai noodles. Great service too. I will come here again.
author: Chanel B.

description: Very good Thai and its not overly greasy! Great service as well
author: Aanand P.

description: We've been coming here for over three years and the food has been consistently good.  I like the way they prepare the yellow curry dishes and the appetizers are amazing.  Love the décor too.  The staff is very friendly.
author: T. H.

description:
Tonight was my first time ordering with Thai Spice. I had it delivered, and it got here pretty fast. So kudos to fast-enough deliveries.

I ordered the Pumpkin Curry w/Prawns & Spicy Basil Fried Rice w/Prawns. It was still steaming hot when it arrived at my doorstep, and both dishes were super noms.

It's official, they just got themselves a returning customer. ;]
author: Valerie N.

description:
Good flavors.  Lunch specials are a great deal.  They give you a variety of 2-3 items for less than $10.

Comfortable place and nicely decorated.  It's a relaxing place to hang in the middle of the city.
author: Winnie C.

description:
5 stars may seem generous, but I'm trying to figure out how it could be better for the price.  The spring rolls were fresh and very tasty--with a great peanut sauce. The red curry was quite flavorful with lots of chicken. And the brown rice was tender and tasty.
Oh ya, the down side--no vodka and no saki. But I guess they're a Thai restaurant, not Japanese.
author: Signo U.

description: Kind of your standard Thai food. A bit pricey for what you get (quantity & quality), but sufficient to get by if you are hungry.
author: MT Y.

description:
Hey! Why did it take me so long to find this place? Wait, maybe it's because there are a TON of other Thai restaurants in the city, and many of them are on Polk Street. Life is tough.

I was pleasantly surprised by the pricing of Thai Spice's menu, the portion sizes, and the speed of the food preparation. Plus, the decor was tolerably hip (i.e. not a club like Osha but not like being in some old lady's living room where you think you're going to break one of her religious artifacts). I had the vegetarian pad thai, which probably could have had a few more vegetables thrown in for good measure, but the flavors were delicious. And the dish was served with bean sprouts on the side, which are important to munch on when you've been stuffing your face with noodles. My friend had the green curry and gave it her stamp of approval. And we shared the spring rolls--you know, those awesome refreshing ones with the clear wrapping and the mint and the... I'm salivating--which I think I might consider getting several orders of for my next meal. 

I do have a few complaints, though. One, the waiter took forever to bring us our check. Like 10 minutes. That's a long time. Two, the bathroom has a neon sign above it indicating if it's occupied or not. Convenient at first, and then just awkward. Three, STOP REFILLING MY WATER EVERY FIVE SECONDS PLEASE THANK YOU. Okay, over and out. I'll be back.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
Great restaurant. My favorite dishes are Basil Duck and Pat Thai Bu with crab meat. 
Reasonable price..
The only thing is service is a bit overly and unbearably attentative. Sometimes, three different waiters come by and ask you how everything is three times and if you have finished your food, WHILE YOU ARE IN THE MIDDLE OF A CONVERSATION. They are incredibly friendly, irregardless of whether if you were preoccupied with excessive emotions...they drive me nut!!!
author: Xiu L.

description:
Being that Thai Spice is so close to my house, it is the perfect spot for some thai food action. I went here with a date once and they let us linger late -- major plus when you wanna keep the good times rollin'. Plus it's located at a great spot on Polk and two doors down from Bigfoot Lodge & Amelie; also good places to go when don't wanna head home. 

Pad Thai, yum! Clay pot prawns, double yum!! Springs rolls..mmm. Did I mention -- they deliver?!
author: Ashley H.

description: They have the best yellow curry chicken. I used to come regularly for their lunch combo. But they raised their price by almost 20% recently AND limited the choices on the combos. I guess I'll come less often.
author: Angela Y.

description:
I am a big fan of Thai food and decided to try this place with some friends. The food was pretty good and comparable to the majority of Thai restaurants I eat at.  Nothing was really outstanding though and it was a little on the expensive side.

The service was not up to par.  They brought out half our drinks and it took another 5 minutes for them to bring out the other two.  They brought out one entree with our appetizer which was very strange. We got the rest of our entrees about 5 minutes later.

I will probably eat there again sometime but just because it's so close to my house. I'm sure there are better places close by.
author: Ryan J.

description:
I've had their food before and it was good, but today I tried to order on line. I place my order at 3:30pm and waiting for them to call me to for billing information. No one called and it was almost an hour after my order was placed.

I called them and they did they did not see the order until 30 minutes after I ordered and then told me it would take another 45 minutes.

Slow, slow customer service. Not worth it.
author: Alex P.

description: Horrible. I got delivery and the pad ke mao wasn't even cooked all the way. I got the papaya salad (how can you mess up papaya salad??) and it was just weird. Everything was cold too. Ugh never ordering from here again.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Even though I have consumed food hailing from quite a few countries in the Far East, I had yet to have sampled Thai until last night. 

The last few months I have been spending an extrodinate amount of time in the beautiful city of San Francisco with several friends and we try to eat somewhere about half the time. Last night we decided upon this place as it was a favorite of the couple I was traveling with. 

Upon being seated we were each given three menus: drinks, appetizers and dinner. The waitress came around promptly and took our drink orders while we perused their fine offerings contemplating what we were hungry for. When she came back with the drinks and a pitcher of water we ordered. 

I kind of felt like the sore thumb since everyone ordered something with tofu and I selected pork, but I am just not that kind of girl. Not saying tofu is bad for ya, but I prefer real meat all the way :) Anyway, back on track. I opted for the Basil Leaf and white rice. In what seemed like minutes our food arrived. 
The soup one in our group ordered came in a stainless steel bowl situated upon a stand with flame underneath keeping it steaming hot. The rest of us had a bowl of rice and a plate of food with a little cock sauce nicely placed on the plates edge. 

Overall we had an enjoyable meal, however I am disapppointed I left my midnight snack in my friend's car. :(
author: Christy P.

description: When I used to live in Russian Hill, Thai Spice's delivery service was probably a 2 star experience.  However, for a sit down meal, they are very attentive.  In the few times I've been here now, there haven't been a ton of people sitting in the restaurant.  One of my best friends lives around the corner from Thai Spice, so this is always an easy meal for us.  I've had their Pad Thai and Pad See Ew, and both dishes come exactly as they're typically served in Thai restaurants here.  Both of us usually order a Fresh Spring Rolls order to share, and this time we ordered a side of Chicken Satay as well.  The spring rolls are OK, it tastes like they've been sitting in the refrigerator for awhile since everything's a little on the firm side.  The satay skewers were surprisingly really good, especially with the awesome side of peanut sauce.  Rather than going with the usual, I ordered the Silver Noodle Salad.  It wasn't nearly as filling as some of the rice/noodle dishes, but I enjoyed every ingredient in the salad (silver noodles, ground chicken, shrimp, crispy garlic, onions, cilantro and lemon juice).  Since it was chilly outside, we also ordered two hot teas and it came out in these beautiful glass tea pots.  The tea was hot oolong tea, but it didn't taste like anything standard.  It was a beautiful cup of tea (be careful if you're wearing light colors, the tea is an orange-ish color and will stain if you get it on you).  I'll probably end up coming back to Thai Spice in the future, most for convenience.  It's not the best Thai food in SF, but it certainly is reasonable and fast if you're sitting down.
author: Lisa I.

description:
This used to be a decent Thai restaurant, so sad. Here's what not to have for dinner :

1. Red Curry with chicken - there were more bamboo shoots than chicken! bummer...
2. Crab Fried Rice - the fried rice was fine, but where was the crab??! another bummer...
3. Calamari appetizer - nice and crispy but totally no flavor - relied on the dip....

Their only saving grace was the Thai Spice's Rolls : crispy rolls stuffed with chicken, shrimp, and vegetables. Totally worth the 1 star for this review.
author: Juliet W.

description:
The food are good.  I love this place cause I have been coming here since middle school.  When dinner money are left on the table, I know I deserve good food even without company every night. 

I love their meat lover plates, is BBQ short ribs & Pork Chops.  Taste like home cooking....
author: Wasabi L.

description:
This Thai place is definitely significantly above average. The Pad Thai is great and they do this pumpkin curry that is out of this world.

Sometimes the service can be slow though, so prepare to take your time.
author: Paul C.

description:
Thai Spice is an average Asian restaurant, IMHO.  My Asian-American wife gave the place 2 Stars, but I thought it was OK....

Atmosphere:  All ready for Halloween, with lotsa interesting touches, plus the authentic Thai carved wood panel was well done.  We were seated at the window, so we could watch the Polk Street pedestrians come and go, featuring a leashed Chihuahua defecating on the sidewalk !!  ( All part of the charm of the City by the Bay-----).

Service:  Was unusually non-attentive.  The male waitperson had a flat-affect personality and the female did not visit our table except at the very last to refill my water glass, although she was exceptionally kind and friendly.

Food Quality:  About average for Thai cuisine...nothing particularly memorable nor exceptionally bad.  Tasty Thai in Modeso ( Modesto !! ) has better cuisine and at the same inexpensive prices.

Overall:  A pleasant, little hole in the wall SF restaurant where you can enjoy a reasonably priced, modest Thai meal....
author: Ron C.

description: I always get the green curry here (tofu and veg). It's been my favorite so far of the places that deliver to my building. Great Thai hot, I was once surprised to find the recipe had changed, but the management graciously replaced my curry and once also replaced a som tum that they had made the mistake of making mild instead of hot. (just another annoying thing about ordering authentic Asian food on this side of the ocean, having to specify hotter-than-default heat level if you want the real thing) Was ecstatic when I found out they'd retained the old recipe for the green curry, so I'll be ordering again sometime.
author: Kit A.

description:
Overall, a very good Thai restaurant.

A little bit more of a modern style interior than most Thai places. Nice, slightly dark and clean.

Tom Yum shrimp soup was tasty. Chicken satay was excellent, a generous portion that was perfectly seasoned and cooked. Everything else we at was also very good.

We'll be back for more soon :)
author: Mike B.

description:
I've only had their delivery so can only speak to that. 

They are my go-to neighborhood Thai place. When we feel like ordering in and want something hot and yummy, I call them. The food is consistent, the food is delicious. I can't speak to how "authentic" it is (there are always people on Yelp who are authenticity snobs).  What I can say is that it is great food, delivered faster than they quote ("underpromise, overdeliver"). Very happy with them. Have ordered from them at least two dozen times over the past two years.

My favorites are the papaya salad, yellow pumpkin curry (oh yum!), and their red curry. Their panang beef is also very delicious, but after several tries, I'm pretty sure it is not gluten-friendly, so I had to give it up.

My husband had their crispy spring rolls the other night and thought they were good, but a little on the small side. The pad thai was ok. I don't really care for their Laab salad.  

So my advice is, come here for their curries!  And the papaya salad (if you like that sort of thing).
author: Rosie S.

description:
Agree with the other reviewers.  DO NOT ORDER ONLINE OR OVER THE PHONE.

First of all, they get orders wrong over the phone a lot.  You think online would be better?  Not really.  Well, I should rephrase - it depends on how much you're spending.

So I work pretty close to here, and when we order food for 6 at night online, they always have the food ready, eventually.  It takes a while and the food had not always been ready even 30 minutes after I arrive.  They also never include any utensils and plates, which can be a real annoyance.

The problem comes when you order anything less than a certain amount, and who knows what that certain amount is.  I had the misfortune of showing up twice with no food.  Tonight, I ordered online at 9:20 and showed up at 9:45 (they close at 10:00 this particular night).  Their door was already locked and no matter how much I gesture, point to my phone to try to say that I ordered online, they just stared blankly at me.  Finally, someone took the trash out and I walked in around 9:55.  My order was right on the computer screen, but the guy says, "This computer doesn't refresh itself."  To which I responded, "then why do you have an online ordering system?"  Not an apology.  Nada.  They don't think they should be responsible at all.  It certainly wasn't my fault.  The problem is  if they don't think your money is worth their effort, they pretend there are technical difficulties.

I think the food's okay, but I think they're REALLY dishonest.  STAY AWAY and give your money to more honest people.  There are plenty of good Thai restaurants around here.
author: David Y.

description: We have been here three times so far and have great food each time.  Last night I got the Pad Tay Lay and the seafood was cooked perfectly.  For $15 it was a pretty good value as you got prawns, scallops, fish, mussels and squid.  My daughter had the mango chicken and loved it and my wife's clay pot prawns were nice and rich.  I don't know how they do delivery but if you have time to sit down and eat it is worth the trip.
author: Michael B.

description:
Solid Thai place for your basics: peanut satay, yellow curry, pad see ew, etc.  I go for lunch regularly and it's never too crowded and service is prompt, with lots of refills on water.  

Lunch special for $8.95 you get small salad, rice and a medium-sized serving of two selections, which really is enough food that I almost always take some home for leftovers the next day.
author: Elwood B.

description: God....I do not understand how people like the food here!  I ordered for delivery and the food was just outright horrible! Bland as other yelpers stated.   The yellow curry with chicken was disgusting!  It was a big blob of f'd up dark chicken in a puddle of yellow curry with way too many onions....no bell peppers or potatoes as most places have.  I did not eat more than two bites.  The Satay was bland.  Delivery service was good, but that's all.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Food: The food here has that little extra zing you look for when you choose thai.  Spicy, seasoned and strong - you're gonna enjoy every bite.

Price: $9 isn't cheap for a plate of rice but their generous with the extras/add-ons and the quality that you're paying for can be tasted.

Service: Fast and friendly. They understand you clearly when you order and make it exactly to your liking.  Most places think I'm kidding when I say "make it spicier than you've ever made it before".  The lady who took my order knew I meant business.
author: Mack D.

description:
I have ordered from this place over 10 times and it is hit and miss everytime.
The one dish that is consistently good is the Silver Noodle Soup..the broth is to die for! Beware when ordering their fresh spring rolls..it isn't made with rice paper..but one with doughy texture (Thai style rather than Vietnamese style) Their salads are very mediocre at best
I would stick with the curries and the noodles rather than "special" dishes.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Admittedly, I'm a little bit of a pu$$y (no offense, ladies -- it's just a term of art) when it comes to Thai food because I've had some bad experiences in the past. Once bitten, twice shy, that sort of thing. So, these days I stick to mostly vegetarian dishes at unknown restaurants that happen to catch my fancy.

Thai Spice had a Pad Thai Jay which was awesome. Tofu, peanuts, green onions ... it was delicious. Very nice, and it came out quickly, as well. The kitchen was going to close in ten minutes when we arrived, so maybe that was them encouraging us to get the eff out as soon as possible, I don't know. Either way, it was good.

Service was efficient and friendly, and the place seemed pretty clean. I liked the low light atmosphere, contrasted by the big picture windows at the front of the place.
author: Wes T.

description:
We randomly chose this place because there was an hour wait at the House of Prime Ribs and we were hungry.  Not bad as a second choice restaurant.  We ordered the following:

Appetitizer Combo -  Combination of Thai Spice Rolls (FRIED), fish cakes (FRIED), shrimp in the blanket (FRIED), curry puff (FRIED) and crispy tofu (FRIED) served with 4 kinds of sauces. Notice that everything on this combo is FRIED.  The shrimp was the best.

Pad See Ewe - very good.  This is a very basic Thai dish, so it can't be done wrong! 

Crab Meat fried rice - it was really good. They use real crab (I think from Alaskan crab legs). Tasty!

Prices are reasonable.  Portions are good.  Service is not the best, probably because we were sitting out by the window and the waiters don't walk all the way out there until you wave them down.

They offer free 1-1/2 validated parking in a nearby garage.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
I can't possibly be the first to point out the irony that the restaurant's name is "Thai Spice" and the actual amount of spice to be found in any of their dishes is somewhere between that found in mom's tuna casserole and grandma's orange jello.  Unless you count sugar as a spice.  

Two stars for being pretty inside...?
author: Laurence W.

description: Everything was amazing. Went with a big group and enjoyed every moment. The pad Thai is amazing. Great for Saturday day drinking.
author: Alain D.

description:
They don't mess around with spicy here.  My nose usually starts running about halfway thru my "medium hot" veggie green curry.  Pumpkin and red curries are also good, as are the soups. I don't recommend the appetizers so much. 

A solid lazy-let's-order-in place. Delivery is ridiculously fast.  They always say 45 minutes, and most times they are buzzing downstairs in 15.  If you don't have a coupon, just walk around Russian Hill for a few minutes (you're bound to find one on someone's door) and you'll be rewarded to a free pad thai, 15% off, $5 off, something.
author: Joyce W.

description: Fairly average. So many Thai restaurants in the City are much better than this place. It's fine. The food is good but the flavors could be stronger. Will do in a pinch but you're not missing much if you've been curious to stop in.
author: Kiristen R.

description: Very disappointing delivery experience. Placed an older over the phone for a delivery order and was told it would be 45 minutes. After the food hadn't arrived an hour and 15 minutes later, it was too late for me to eat and I decided I would cancel the order. No one answered the phone. When the food finally arrived an hour and a half later on, it was cold and had the taste of sitting out. It didn't taste fresh or as if it had just been prepared. I took the time to call, and they were rather indifferent. All in all, it makes it a 1 star experience.
author: Amy Z.

description:
Pretty bland overall, not a huge fan. Had gotten takeout once, and then there was a 1/2 off coupon and I ended up buying 2, so got to try quite a few of their dishes. Probably won't be back in the future though. 

Curry is watery, lacking vegetables and not spicy at all. Literally just meat and bamboo shoots. All noodle dishes - drunken noodle, pad thai and pad see ew - were mushy and not all that flavorful. Clay pot shrimp was nothing special. Wines are terrible and terribly overpriced. They ran out of large beers when we were there. Not good business on a Friday night.

It does have a great location going for it, and a pretty nice interior date-like environment. But sorry, there's just so many thai places in the city I expect more from the food.
author: Natalie H.

description:
super hungry, super sick, super busy day....so decided to order delivery even though we live a few blocks away (don't judge me)

it took 50 minutes which really it shouldn't have since we literally are 3 blocks away

 asked for extra spicy and definitely still needed to take the sriracha out the fridge. kinda on the bland side. her shrimp pad thai was pretty decent but my shrimp mixed veggies was pretty blah. maybe 2.5 stars

might give it another shot but most likely will be going back to T2J thai instead.
author: Faina G.

description: I had an appointment across the street but I was early.. I felt hungry so I looked up and there was this Thai place. I looked on yelp, reviews weren't too bad, so I ordered for pick up.  I had ordered fishcake ($8) Thai iced tea ($3.50) and cashew nut chicken with rice (about $9.50). Fishcakes were awesome and the portion size for cashew nut chicken was great! It also came with a small side salad as well. Food  was delicious and I would definitely come back!
author: Kimberlie M.

description: Fantastic food and service! One of the best places I've been.
author: Vincent S.

description:
Thoughts going through my head while waiting 15min for an order of tofu skewers:

"Clean, modern decor. I'd dine in here."
"Why are skewers taking so long?"
"Why are the lights being dimmed so low?. This is not helping me read the paper as I pass the time waiting for my skewers."
"Such friendly people, but not so quick. Where are my skewers?!"

Finally they arrived. Three stars were upgraded to four when I discovered it was one of the most generous skewer servings ever. There was enough for 1) my salad that night, 2) my omelet the next morning and 3) a little Replate down the street to share the wealth.

Worth the wait.
author: Jason B.

description:
This is the closest Thai place to my house so I've gone a few times. I'm no expert, but the food seems fine. The price isn't bad, but not cheap either (most things are $10). The Pad Thai does the job, the prawns in the clay pot with silver noodles has been the standout for me. Strong flavors with onion and ginger. 

The major up side is the place is clean and the service is good. That's lacking in a lot of places these days.
author: Corey V.

description: I started with the deep fried shrimp eggroll appetizers. They were golden brown and the shrimp wad perfectly cooked. It came with a sweet and sour sauce. I always order the same dish at every Thai restaurant I go to so I can compare, Basil Chicken.  The chicken was minced just right, the fish sauce had a good taste of basil. The Thai ice tea was sweetened perfectly with the right balance of cream to tea, the ice was shaved and added a nice touch to the tea.
author: Craig R.

description:
We've had great Thai food and bad Thai food from the same restaurant (Lemongrass). Decided to try something new, so we went to Thai Spice which is down the street. We'll definitely be back, and I'm crossing my fingers that they will be consistently good!

Money Bags (4 stars): Minced chicken wrapped up in cute little fried wontons on fresh pineapple chili salsa.

Pad Thai w/ Shrimp (4 stars): Definetely a go-to pad thai. When I get a craving I will be ordering this again. They do delivery and pickup orders which is awesome. But getting it in the restaurant is nice if only for the presentation. Actually I was blown away by the presentation of all the food. Definetely not expecting such pretty dishes for the price!

Yellow Pumpkin Curry w/ Chicken (3 stars): Great taste, but it would be better with more pumpkin and more juice. Rice costs extra. 

Coconut Ice Cream (5 stars): I love coconut ice cream. And I really loved this ice cream. The texture was almost custardy, and I really liked how dense it was. Oh, and it came in a cute cone shaped glass in a pick ice mixture. 

The restaurant is was cute and service was great. The plating of each dish felt so fancy, but the whole meal for two (including a glass of wine each) was only about $48 (w/o tax and tip).
author: Melissa H.

description: Constant server changes has clearly taken a toll on their service and food.
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
Born and raised in San Jose, I have to say that nothing will ever top Thai Pepper in Campbell. Hey, I gotta stay true to my roots...

That being said, Thai Spice takes second place. Yesterday, after making that cash money, I went home and ordered Tom Kha soup, Pad See Ew (which is not ew at all, but totally YUM!) and Pumpkin Yellow Curry from Thai Spice. 

After devouring the deliciousness, I saw the Giants win bigtime (9-0) and I slept like a baby, with a belly full of happy. Thanks Thai Spice. I hope all ya'll are reading this. Holla!!
author: Anita A.

description:
Thai Spice entered my life for one reason: because I am lazy.  I used to live just one (steep) block from delicious Lemongrass.  However, when I am feeling too lazy to cook, I am also feeling too lazy to walk my lazy a$$ down and back up a freaking steep San Francisco hill.  

That being said, I love Thai - especially when i'm feeling lazy - and needed to find some place close enough to deliver quickly, but not too close that I would feel embarassed to order delivery.  A girl has to have some standards!

Enter Thai Spice.

I don't even really know where it is since I've never been there in person.  But I also can't count the number of times I have called and ordered my usual: pad thai with prawns, pad see ew with tofu, and spring rolls with shrimp.  The nice delivery guy always comes way before promised, and I get a consistently delicious meal that satisfies both my laziness and my Thai cravings.
author: Lisa R.

description:
I have ordered take out from this place twice. Both times not a great experience. 

The food took an hour for delivery on a Monday night. Although I repeated myself several times on the phone my order was not correct. When I called back to let them know, the girl sounded irritated and told me she would let the manager know. No offer to correct the order. 

i will not order from this place again.
author: Wheat K.

description: Food is actually decent, especially the yellow curry. Unfortunately, the service we received was terrible. Won't be going back.
author: Marta C.

description:
I ordered the fried rice green curry with chicken.

The chicken portion was okay, the rest was bland and kinda gross.  They threw in large chunks of uncooked garlic apparently has an afterthought, hoping to impart some flavor on an otherwise tasteless meal.

I probably will not eat here again.
author: Brian C.

description: Great! It's pretty authentic so if you are used to an Americanized taste, be sure to let the staff know. This place can get packed but during off season hours, you can get the whole place to yourself. Remember, spicy foods is a potent vasodilator and makes you sweat without working. (Why spicy/piquant foods come from equatorial countries and your sub arctic countries don't put black pepper on their foods.) And that you are in San Francisco. :)
author: Outside J.

description:
The service here is quite warm, the food served up quickly, and the amount of spice pretty acceptable. I have a high spice tolerance and so order all my dishes here 'Thai hot' and, although it's still pretty weak sauce, once had a light sweat after finishing a Tom Yum noodle soup. 

Recommended items: the aforementioned noodle soup, pumpkin curry, the spring rolls
author: Annie M.

description:
Veggie green curry and chicken satay with brown rice= one of my favorite meals EVER. Sometimes we throw in some Pad See You or Pad Thai when we want to get crazy. I've never had anything bad here, and I would bet that I never will. 
Definitely one of the best restaurants on North Polk street.
author: Kenzie P.

description:
Neighborhood Thai place.  Green curry chicken has huge chunks of zucchini.  Wish they would cut them smaller.  Very average.  They have brown rice though, which is a nice bonus.

Coconut sticky rice came as basically a deck of cards-sized block of rice w/ coconut sauce on top and fresh mango on the side.  I am new to coconut sticky rice and have not had it much in the U.S. (only in Thailand).  In Thailand the sauce is IN the rice (not drizzled over).  It's much better that way.  This one tastes ok, but it looks incredibly unappetizing.  I don't think I'd get it again, although like I said, it tastes pretty good.
author: Ashley K.

description:
Awesome. Some people will recommend Osha as the best Thai spot. Forget it. Osha is bland. Thai Spice is flavor exemplified.  The Basil Leaf Tofu is fantastic.

Take the 19 bus for $2, and enjoy a delicious and filling meal for two for $20. Has to be the best deal in SF.
author: Jeff M.

description: The only good thing about their food was that it was hot.  The curry and fried rice was very bland.
author: Daniel V.

description:
Very good Thai food. I admit that I am not a big Thai food connoisseur.   I tend to order the same thing all the time, and it pretty much tastes the same to me, whether it be groovy Thai (osha) or some family lunch joint.  

I do know my yellow curry though.  A yellow curry in a Thai restaurant is like the chicken entree of an American restaurant.  If you can make it stand out, then you're doing it right.  Their yellow curry is excellent, and has an effervescent zing which other places lack.  I'm going back.

This place is in-between groovy and family, with a definite groovy/upscale slant.  Prices are typical Thai, i.e., inexpensive.  We had one app and two entrees w/ brown rice, no booze, and walked out of there almost $40 poorer with a good tip.
author: Chris W.

description: Stopped-in for a quick lunch because they advertised they won some type of award for best Pad Thai which I can't get enough of when I dine at a Thai restaurant. I was not disappointed and they also offered low carb Pad Thai which was just as tasty.   Definitely one of the best pad thai's I've had in the city.   Service was just OK, not as attentive as I like, but the food was really good and not very pricey.  Nice atmosphere.
author: Greg B.

description: I wanted to like this place, but it all show and no go.  I liked the decor and the service was good, but the food was pretty bland for a Thai food place.  It is also expensive and honestly, not worth your money.
author: Vinh N.

description: Excellent service, well kept facility and decent food. I had lunch there. The salad was nice and crisp(small) I had the Tuesday special : egg plant and crispy scallops with sweet sauce on the side and rice. Fresh and yummy. I loved the garlic touch on the egg plant. It seemed a little overcooked for my taste but it tasted fine. Food was hot and service was impeccable ! I will be back to taste the daily specials. I had eaten there before but it seems they have better wait staff now. I like the smooth background music it brought memories of Pataya a few years back. Nice resort in Thailand !
author: luis r.

description: Exceptionally good Thai food. Delicious flavors. The meat are good cuts, the veggies fresh. The portions are fairly enormous. I was there with a party of twelve and sampled a good cross section of entrees and apps - it was all wonderful. Didn't try the desserts. One of the best dinner spots in Nob Hill IMO.
author: Chuck S.

description: Walking up Polk there are a ton of food options...this place had been recommended by some local friends. The atmosphere was calm and it smelled great when we walked in. The service was a little slow, but we didn't mind as we were having a lazy dinner...Fried tofu, Basil Chicken, Pumpkin curry (excellent) and Scallops.  We were impressed with the use of spice and lack of oil...left feeling very satisfied. I will be back for sure. About $48 for three people.
author: Sarah M.

description: COuld have been the roll of the dice, but we ordered 4 items to go. At best, some items were ok. I had a meat dish that we got did not taste like meat and had an awful taste to it. With all the good reviews for this place, I feel like i should try it again... but with all the great Thai places around, why bother.
author: Rah F.

description: Wasn't sure what to expect as I didn't get a chance to read my fellow yelp reviews ahead of time. Just happened to be in the neighbor and decided to stop in after walking up and down Polk street and this place looks the best. The tom yum soup was yummy... You know it's good when the soup is so tasty... Also had the chicken pumpkin curry... Yum... Proportions are similar to other Thai restaurant. The food is very tasty. The restaurant is very clean and modern looking. Will have to come back and try some more stuff!
author: Jay S.

description:
Just ok. Will not be going back.  I've had better Thai food at every other Thai restaurant I've ever been too (more than 40).  If I had to sum it up in one word: 
Bland.
author: Jon G.

description: The food is delicious, but the person who took my order on the phone was curt and rude for no reason, and the delivery person was curt and rude for no reason. Didn't your mother teach you not to be an asshole? I'm genuinely surprised by how rude they were.
author: Andy R.

description: We had a bad experience ordering take-out. It took over an hour to receive our food and it was cold when we got it. We excepted that but then discovered human hairs in our curry. We called to complain. The person we talked to acted like we were trying to get free food and they wanted the old food back in exchange for a new order. That was weird, but whatever. Then when the new order came the delivery person complained that we weren't giving back all of the old food, as if we were pulling some sort of scam for curry. He left in a huff. Anyway, it was bizarre.
author: jake c.

description:
The WORST food ever!! Stay away from the Thai Spice Prawns! The shirmp were rubber, but a very hard rubber (tasteless too).............the filling, also tasteless was a blob of dark, icky looking dog food! My dinner (satay, prawns and Thai Ice Tea was over 30 dollars and most of it ended up in the trash! 

I'll never go back and will tell everyone I know how horrible the food is. 

The person that answered the phone and the delivery guy were both very nice.
author: Tom J.

description: Solid.  Not too expensive.  Spring roll - Red Curry parlay.
author: Jon E.

description:
The food here is pretty good.  I use Pad Thai as my measure for Thai food and though Thai Spice's Pad Thai is not my favorite their other dishes are quite good.

The staff is friendly but there are not many of them, which can sometimes make service a little slow due to all of them being very busy.  The wait staff themselves are not slow at all, just too few of them.

So far all of their curry dishes have been great and their Tom Yum is one of my favorites.
author: Kristine K.

description: I haven't eaten in the restaurant but I ordered for delivery and I was happy with the food and service. It wasn't amazing but the food was ok and for a busy day of the week the process was very smooth and fairly quick. They take credit card at the door which is always helpful.
author: Lauren B.

description:
OK, we've gone to Thai Spice quite a bit and were terribly surprised today by the service. We ordered an appetizer and our waitress never put the order in. The Spicy Thai Fish was, quite frankly, dried out and had very little meat on it. We also noticed that the table next to us had trouble getting their appetizer.

The one redeeming feature was the egg plant dish. However, It didn't save the evening. We were definitely unhappy with our experience there. It is all the more disappointing because we've had several very good experiences there. This and the previous one were definitely sub-par.
author: Ed H.

description:
Best Pad Thai!!!!!!!!!!!!! I always get tofu pad thai, and this place has got everyone beat! Veggie spring rolls are good, calamari really good, sweet and sour sauce is way up there too!

When we dined there, getting the check took a little long, and we had to wait for a table, but we are definitely going back!
author: Carli M.

description: Just wanted to update them to 4 stars for their consistency. I lived in SF for three years and regularly ate here the entire time.  Always good, always timely, always - always. :-) Love it and will miss it now that I'm gone!
author: Amanda D.

description: Just had take out from here, okay priced menu good chicken curry and lots of different specials that would make me interested to come back again. good service and very pretty interior.
author: Nicole S.

description: Thai spice gets 5 stars because it is so head and shoulders ahead of most of the other watered down thai food in SF, or California, for that matter. I lived in Asia for many years and have been to Thailand 20+ times. This place is the real deal.
author: Ryan P.

description: The atmosphere is very pleasant and the place is clean.  The wait staff was very cheerful and helpful.  The food is good, but very Americanized thai.  Lots of sugar in most if the dishes. But, the food is fresh and nicely presented.
author: v n.

description:
I really want to like this place because it's so close to my house.  I've been there at least 5 times.

Unfortunately, the ambiance killed my desire to go here again.  Last night, I stopped in to eat solo.  After I was seated, a woman sat two tables away from me, ordered and then proceeded to make a cell phone call.  Since she was very loud, after about 5 minutes of listening to her blab away, I asked if she was going to be long.  It was clear she wasn't checking to see if a friend was late, she couldn't handle eating alone.  

After 10 minutes of listening to her talk louder than any of the diners in the place, I told the server to pack up my order to go because she was talking on the cell -- and I consider it to be pretty rude behavior when people are trying to have a simple, peaceful meal.  The unfortunate thing is that her behavior cost this restaurant my future business.  

The surprising thing is she was clearly old enough to know better (55+).  She was still on the phone when I left.    If they were to ban cell phone conversations, I might return.
author: Ellen B.

description:
Have been going to Thai Spice pretty regularly during the three years I've been in the neighborhood.

Whether it's dining there or getting take-out, their food is SO good. The fresh spring rolls, Pra-Ram, and Pumpkin Curry never disappoint!
author: claire s.

description:
OK..I just had to write about this cuz it was just too comical....I went with my bf and I had a coupon for get a free entree when you buy one. 

So we order the green papaya salad (yummy) some fish cake apps and a beef dish and brown rice. The salad and app came out fairly quickly, then we waited about  30 min for the meat (and no rice) so when I asked the waitress for the rice, she apologized and 10 mins later came out with two white rice bowls. 

I reminded her I ordered brown rice (i can't eat white rice) and she apologized again, and  10 min later came out with one tiny bowl of brown rice, by this time the meat was cold so I asked her to please reheat the meat...she did. 

So bf and I shared the tiny amount of rice and tough reheated meat....ok, we'll just deal with it. 

Then the waitress quickly came back with the check, and I told her we still wanted desert...trying to end the meal on a sweet note. 

She told me they had fresh mango with sticky rice ( a no-no, white rice) and fried bananas with coconut ice cream (yummy) which i ordered, and she repeated the order back to me...then 15 min later she came out with the papaya and sticky rice. To which I very nicely told her it was a mistake, and then she realized it and apologized again.

 20 min later she came out with the correct desert. 

So now I'm thinking they should have comped us something, the tea, the desert, something for all the mix ups that occurred. 

So the check comes out, and it looks too high, ($59) and she even points out that she subtracted the coupon amount ($9). So I just ask her to please re-do the math, I'm probably wrong, I tell her as to not make her feel bad...

She realized she over charged me by $15....I couldn't believe it, on top of all the mix ups, she OVER charges me $15....too effen funny. 

I was totally nice about it, and then later thought I should have said something...like, God lady next time be a little more careful or something....anyway, the food was pretty good, but service SUCKED....next time I'll order take out.
author: Brenda D.

description: 3.5 stars. This is our go-to spot for Thai in the neighborhood. I like the decor, the service is friendly and the food usually hits the spot. Last night, we ordered a shrimp pad thai and there were only 4 shrimp in it. Pretty...shrimpy. Haha. Other than that, I highly recommend the fried calamari and the pineapple fried rice.
author: Nora G.

description:
It's no Osha when it comes to the Duck Noodle Soup but it was sure tasty and didn't need that extra kick!  I would return to try their other menu items.  No sirachi though!  Boo.  Granted, I don't, typically, use the infamous hot sauce but my sister would be utterly disappointed at its absence.  It's a sweet location but the parking may be a tad bit difficult.  

The food tastes fresh and clean and with just the right amount of spices to create something tasty.  They, certainly, don't over or under do it when it comes to the fare but a lot of that they leave up to you considering they bring out the spice rack for you!  Yes, spices come out separately.  As most people have already stated, the food portions are reasonable so you won't leave hungry but pretty satisfied.
author: Dorothy S.

description: Ugh... Resist the flyer! We got a flyer toting Thai Spice as "San Francisco's Best" (or something to that effect). We ordered curry balls, tom kha soup and beef & broccoli for delivery. Took 1 hr 15 mins to arrive. Cost $26.XX before tip. All the food was room temperature. The tom kha had NO spice added to it -- literally, no spice! The curry balls were more dough than filling. The only decent part of the meal was the beef & broccoli. Up until this point, I proclaimed today was one of the best days ever, but Thai Spice knocked it down a couple notches. The day will redeem itself with some Moose Track ice cream for dessert and Big Love on the TV.
author: Emily B.

description: Pad see eew... great.  Pad thai... bomb.  Yellow curry, kinda average and a tad bland but it is yellow curry.  I only wish this place was more local, blows away all of the thai spots in my hood.
author: Justin B.

description:
I have been getting the coconut curry here for years and it is always consistently good.. I LOVE IT! 

There fresh spring rolls are good too as well as the beef and vegetable clay pot soup :)
author: M E.

description: The food was pretty average Thai cuisine. Prices are a bit too high, service was also average. It wasn't a bad place but given the choices in SF, this probably wouldn't be my first.
author: Sara K.

description:
This is my neighborhood Thai, so I've been there a lot. Most dishes I've had at Thai Spice are good. Its on a par with Thep Phanom in the Lower Haight. One time the soup was at Thai Spice was way over-salted, like the lid maybe fell off the salt shaker, but this only happened once. Apart from that I've not had a bad dish on the menu and so can recommend everything. 

Eating at the restaurant is nice. The staff are pleasant and friendly, and sufficiently attentive. The ambience is pleasant, it's a nice neighborhood restaurant, and when full it's not too noisy.

If using their delivery service, customers may claim a $3 discount with a coupon (on takeout menu). This discount is not applied to walk-in takeout orders. I've not quite got my mind around the logic of this. Another thing with delivery orders is you must tell them you have the coupon at the time of ordering and ask for your discount then. If you wait until the delivery guy shows up he won't give you the discount.
author: Paul S.

description:
This place is okie!! I came here for lunch with my folks.
The tofu dish was ok,but i think i chose not to finish it and the noodles were like any other Thai place,nothing special.

   The service was quick and the place was neat.But i really don't think any of us enjoyed the food and oh!! Do not try the sauce,it had a tangy tamarind flavor and maybe that killed my appetite.sighh...

   And sorry Miss.Thai Spice, your food wasn't spicy  at all!!!! GROWL

-Smriti
author: Smriti K.

description: So this place is ranked pretty high among the Thai restaurants in the city. And I get that. The food is mouth watering! If you come here, you definitely have to try the Thai Spice Prawns because it's stuffed with crab meat and chicken! And I absolutely love the curry puffs! They're like tiny empinadas filled with the absolute goodness of chicken and potatoes that can be dipped in a peanut or cucumber sauce. And the presentation of the plates were beautiful. I love it. But I really can't get over how tasty the food is.
author: April D.

description:
This is my go to restaurant for great takeout. It's the I've-had-a-tough-day-at-work-and-don't-feel-like-cooking restaurant. It's also a great place to dine in, their decor is a lot nicer than most other Thai places I've been to in the city. Their prices are also very reasonable.

The eggplant with black bean sauce is my staple. The first time I ordered it I couldn't get enough and ordered it every day for a week! The cashew chicken sounds like a boring basic but is actually really great. And I'm not a big curry person but I really like their red curry sauce. Honestly, I've never had anything bad here!

My mom (who lives in Ohio and thinks that eating adventurously is trying a new dish at Olive Garden) loved Thai Spice and raved about their angel wings (stuffed chicken wings).
author: Jenny L.

description:
Ordered Thai Spice online for delivery tonight.  We ordered Broccoli in oyster sauce, pad see-yew, and the green curry.

The food was above average, but nothing to write home about.  However, I really enjoyed the green curry--which I ordered Hot--and had great flavor and heat.  The pad see-yew was a little bland, as was the broccoli.

Overall, this place is pretty quick (took only about 30 minutes after I placed my order online), free delivery (if you order more than $18 worth of food), and convinent.

Good spot for a ethnic delivery.  Get the green curry if you do it!
author: Duncan K.

description: I'm not a quack but I found the duck curry to fit the bill ordinarily.
author: Inigo M.

description:
SF has plenty of places to get your Thai on, but this spot on Polk serves up great flavor that won't burn a hole in your already 'downturn' ridden wallet.

Personally, I love the fact that it's only a few blocks from my place, so ordering take out is a weekly adventure I look forward to.

The menu has a wide range of curries, and the green curry is fantastic here. It'll give you a mental sauna session, but hey, forehead condensation is a true sign that you're knee deep in Thai goodness.

My favorite dish here is the Pra Ram. Beef with Peanut sauce on top of a spinach bed. Hearty and craving obliterator.

So the next time you're on Polk, slide into Thai Spice and enjoy!
author: Mike K.

description: The order online always take a long time for delivery (45 min to an hour).  Tonight, I placed an order online and for some reason, they didn't receive the order.  I called half hour later and they told me that the order didn't go through and I have to replace the order and wait for another 45 min to 1 hr.  Lousy customer service.  I wouldn't suggest placing an order with them.  I will never place another order with them.
author: Alan M.

description: My and my GF had some time before meeting friends and we just wanted a quick bit, so we tried this place out and actually was good. The portions arnt huge but just right. We had a appetizer sampler and a salad to share. The rolls are the best item I tasted on that night. The salad was good and they loaded the steak on that thing too..satisfied our hunger and enjoyed the clean restaurant and friendly service we received. Recommended.
author: Jaime P.

description: Ended up ordering a second round of the Money Bags because they were so delicious.  Would definitely recommend this place.  Will be back soon.
author: michael s.

description:
I've been here twice and the service was pretty weak both times.  On my second visit, there were two servers and aside from me and my friend, there were no other diners.  Even so, my poor water glass was neglected and went unreplenished for far too long.  The wait staff never checked on us, as they were too busy sitting and yapping away at another table.  Instead they only made contact to (1) seat us, (2) take our orders, (3) deliver our food, and (4) listen to me bitch for more water, whilst receiving a death stare and dropping off our check.

While their Pumpkin Yellow Curry is tasty, I wouldn't order it again unless you like discovering that half of your chicken is raw.  Bon appetit!
author: Brittany N.

description: The food is decent BUT the service is terrible!!! I ordered delivery and the lady was extremely rude!!! I have ordered from them before and its the same story every time.
author: Kajal P.

description: Not just a Thai place.  Everything here was done with style and tasted fantastic.  The service was good and I enjoyed every minute of my meal. Super Fantastic Thai Fried Rice. I highly recommend this place.
author: Leigh N.

description:
They don't have beer on the menu.  
When places don't have beer, I get flustered and just point to something and say "umm, can i have this?  No, wait,..that" then I get some obscure liquid that I sip on, wishing it tasted like beer.
I got Thai Iced Tea.  I am slightly lactose intolerant.  I drank it and by the end of dinner my stomach was telling me to go F myself.

If they just served beer that wouldn't have happened.  
Or maybe when I see CREAM floating around on the top of my drink I should think "hmm, that might not be such a good choice, because I am lactose intolerant." and not drink it.   Whatever.
 
Fortunately, my super nice wonderful yelpy friend who looks exactly like Seinfeld went with me to buy some Lactaid.  
For some reason, we couldn't find it, and it turned out to be in aisle 5 right next to the Ex Lax.  Ok, two WAY different things there.  
But, I will save that for my review of Walgreen's.
author: Starla D.

description:
One of few good Thai restaurants in the city............the other being Chabaa on Irving st.  Their curry is one of the best in the city.  I enjoy the curry duck with the red sauce.  The mince chicken/pork with basil and garlic is awesome and their vegetables are very fresh.  They offer free parking a block and a half a way and trust me............looking for parking here on the weekend is very tough.  

Service was awesome.  Very attentive and I am a stickler when it comes to refilling water.  Authentic Thai Cuisine.  I come here at least once a month.
author: jason g.

description: I love Thai food. I recently ordered BBQ chicken and it was sooooo good.
author: K L.

description:
