This place is REALLY good, and it finally dawned on me why it's called Thai SPICE.

*think about it*

Or just go there and see for yourself, you won't be disappointed. Promise.

But when you go, I recommend making a reservation in advance on opentable.com so you can snatch yourself 1000 points. But if you find yourself going there at the last minute on a whim, and you are no where close to internet access, don't fret my pet... they are very accommodating towards walk-ins. It seems that much of their business is based on walk-ins. But expect a small wait. Even at 7 pm, this place was PACKED with diners.

Insider tip: they do free parking validation for the first 1 1/2  hours at the parking garage at Sacramento and Polk.
author: NirvAnna M.

description: yummy!! fresh, authentic, decent service, average prices, plenty of street parking. they have big portions, I always end up with leftovers. also, good amount of lunch specials too! my favorite is the chicken curry (super tender) and basil chicken (just the right amount of spice) with brown rice. also comes with a salad.
author: Ann T.

description: Going to a Thai restaurant is a lot like approaching a Thai chick: they all look good but you're never really sure until it is too late. Luckily I can say Thai spice is Thai and good. Food has great flavor from the curries to the entrees. The fact that they deliver too makes it very convenient to get a well-rounded Thai meal. I would give a 4 but the lady taking delivery orders is a little inept. They have coupons on the to-go menus which are useful.
author: Ed L.

description:
For a girl that once could not stand Thai food, this place is my favorite, hands down. I work near this place and will be sad when I leave. This is the only thai restaurant I have been to that uses dark chicken meat in its yellow curry, which makes it taste even richer and more delicious.

Why would this girl give four stars for a fave? Well, because of the weekend help. On weekends, the owner's brother works here, he is Thai, but he hates thai food, he hates people, he hates life. If you go to Thai Spice, hit this place up on a weekday and get the Green Curry or Basil Chicken. I also love the Flower Tea and my friend goes crazy for the Pra Ram.
author: Janelle T.

description:
I just moved to this neighborhood and I'm excited to find a great Thai place!!!!  If all goes well I will be coming here quite often.  But after reading these bad reviews, it looks like that's a big IF!!

My experience was great - the atmosphere was peaceful and quiet, and a little more upscale than my other favorite Thai places.  I guess the decoration could use a little more personality, but on the other hand it's just a standard nice place to go.  The chicken and mushroom sour soup was tasty, and my yellow curry chicken was perfect!  It was probably my favorite yellow curry I've ever tasted.  The prices are not bad at all, and our waiter was really friendly and quick.  It would have been 5 stars except that the music playing was some repetitive folk song on banjos... a little weird for a Thai restaurant.

I will definitely try this place several more times because while the curry was good, there were so many other great things on the menu.  I just hope I never run into the server who hates life....
author: Laura W.

description:
In the oil war between Thai Spice and the Middle East, Thai Spice is the clear winner.  I've never had such an oily meal in my life.  KFC's got nothing on this place.   The pad thai noodles were drenched in what I initially believed was orange sauce.  Upon closer observation, I realized it wasn't sauce.  Yep, it was all oil, baby!

If you want to die at a young age, perhaps from a stroke or heart attack, then be my guest...by all means, come here and order the pad thai. 

The decor was nice; very clean.  The staff?  Meh.  The service wasn't too remarkable!

I wouldn't go there again and I most definitely would only recommend this place to people I hate.
author: Daniela L.

description: Pretty sure this is going to be my Thai go-to in Nob Hill. Thai Spice is right down the street from my place, making it such a convenient dinner spot for an easy bite. My boyfriend and I popped in after a friend recommended it and we weren't disappointed! Since I don't eat meat, we didn't get to try the meatier options, but what we DID try was great. The basil leaf tofu is superb -- cooked perfectly with a really great flavor. We also opted for a spicy pumpkin curry and I was definitely impressed! Great, flavorful curry with a perfect amount of spice (for people that like it REALLY spicy, ask for 'Thai spicy'). All in all, great food, good atmosphere and attentive service at an affordable price!
author: Shannon E.

description:
This food is actually not bad but Thai Spice gets two stars based on 

Slowness
Mediocre/Bad Pad Thai

The food we had tonight, which was delivery, was 25 minutes later that what they said on the phone (they said 45 minutes, it took 1 hour 10). We are about 6 blocks from the restaurant.

We've also gotten take out from there (and picked it up) and they are also slow for that. 

The food is not particularly great and the price (about $10 for most dishes) is a little bit more than at comparable Thai restaurants. I recommend checking out Osha down the street. Thai House on Geary and Larkin is also good (and quick).
author: Sonia F.

description:
Really, really good take out food. Honestly, I think this is some of the best Thai food I have ever had. It was just spicy enough for the food to have a good flavor (if not heat) for the chili-head but was not too spicy for those who like things milder.

Portions are very large - we ended up ordering 4 items + rice (1 curry, 1 main dish, soup, dessert) with the expectation that we would have enough for lunch the next day - and ended up with enough for dinner as well.

We'll definitely have to try going to the restaurant as well.
author: Caroline B.

description:
This place has some pretty darn good food stuffs. The apps are fantastic, sans that shrimp thing stuffed with someother thing. Weird. Shrimp is just fine by itself. No need to over think it here. 

So, the reason it gets 4 stars is because they play the same song over and over and over again in the dining room. It's how I would imagine purgatory. You walk outta there whistling that tune and the next thing you know you get hit by a bus.

In conclusion, good food but order take-out.
author: Josh M.

description:
I ordered for delivery from here. Imagine my disappointment when my vegetarian soup arrived chock full of chicken and shrimp. And my spinach wraps that I was told had no fish sauce, did indeed have fish sauce. Ok mistakes happen. 

But here's where things get weird. When the delivery guy brought me my  correct soup, he asked for the old soup back. I told him I'd thrown it out and he got irate and started yelling at me about not throwing food out. WILL SOMEONE PLEASE TELL ME WHAT THEY INTENDED TO DO WITH THE SOUP?? I wonder if perhaps they gave me someone else's soup and were going to bring the opened and poked around in soup to that poor soul?! That is a disgusting thought!

After a good yelling at from him, I finally got my soup. And wouldn't you know - it had absolutely no flavor. What a disappointment! One of the least fulfilling meals I've had in a LONG time.
author: Cindy R.

description:
I am NOT a big fan of thai.  Mostly b/c I hate lemongrass and I really am not fond of coconut, unless it is in my dessert.  

With that said, it is surprising (or maybe it isn't so surprising) that I like this place.  The service was more than adequate and the food, delish.  I actually had a sit down service solo and didn't feel in the least awkward.  I started off with a cup of the Tom Yum Gai.  The cup was as large as a bowl!!!  Needless to say, I didn't finish it.  There were a lot of mushrooms and white chicken meat.   The taste was eh... I could take it or leave it.

The Gang Garee Gai, on the other hand, was tasty.  I didn't finish that either, but you bet that I had the server box up the leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  YUMMY.  The sauce was a little thinner than I am accustomed to, but the flavor was there and there wasn't an overpowering flavor of coconut, so that earns at least 3 stars in my book!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Found this place in a "value pak" go figure! 

anyways went here for a light dinner and from out front looks a little run down but when you step in the place is really nice very modern and clean.

not many there the night we went, Had 3 dishes to share and had a coupon as well BARGAIN! was only $24 for both of us!

we will definitely return here with or without a coupon there prices are very good and food is worth trying
author: Mark H.

description: Service could use some work as it gets slow at times. Don't get me wrong. I'd like to say that people are generally nice. But I guess customers just like to take their good ass time with ordering and paying for thier meal even though they have finished all of their food. Maybe thats just me. Their food was so-so. Their pineapple fried rice is good. Their padthai is okay. Prices are fair. I'd probably order from them as delivery than dining in as it does take forever to order and get our check.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
If you know me you know I'm all about good food for a good price. Thai Spice delivers just that, and a comfortable atmosphere as well. 

It may have been that hunger is the best spice at all, but there was not a single thing on the menu that did not look appetizing. The lemon grass chicken I ordered certainly did not disappoint, but I was a bit suspicious when the my dish looked exactly the same as my cohorts chili chicken. Gladly, each had their own unique and delightful tastes, and true to the store front, spicy. The nice thing about the dishes is they felt filling yet light, crisp and energizing.

The restaurant layout looks as if it may have come out of a graphic design catalog, without being posh or pretentious. There's something very relaxing and calming about being there. Just don't get a hot pepper stuck in your throat, or drink the Thai Tea if you're lactose intolerant.
author: Keith M.

description:
If you want Thai food, you're begging to be excited by your dinner. You want spiciness, some sweet herbs, something that will rouse your taste buds from the deepest of slumbers, and maybe make you sweat a little bit. To borrow a phrase from one of my favorite heroines, something that will make me "as moist as a snackcake." 

With that frame of mind, my response to Thai Spice is about the same as my response to a dried up rabbit turd: underwhelmed.

 It's not bad, really. Their pumpkin curry was fine, and the service was decent. The decor wasn't obnoxious, but it was certainly kitzchy a la Target. 

My roommate gets the sticky rice, and it comes in this tiny bamboo box thing. It's adorable, and there is something almost majestic and treasure-ish about it. That said, if the sticky rice treasure box was my favorite part of the meal, you understand why this place is getting 2 stars.
author: Brian K.

description:
Definitely I think some of the best red curry I have ever had.  Reasonable prices, friendly waitstaff, and nice decor.

Times visited: 3
author: Amy L.

description:
I was recently reintroduced to Coconut and I could not be happier. 

A new go to food, wow life really can be easy.

The wait for Thai Spice delivery was hellishly long but considering it was Earth day and in my mind they walked all the way from their hood to mine I was okay with it...ok only kind of, but that's because I felt like my stomach was eating itself.
author: Catrinel A.

description: We tried the spinach rolls for appetizer and eggplant chicken for entree and i have to say that they stood out. It's a nice cozy type of place located near or around nob hill district. Reasonably priced and would work well on many occasions. Great service as well with attentive waiters and staff.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
Pumpkin Yellow Curry with Chicken! Although I've seriously enjoyed all the other dishes I've tried here (many dishes), this yellow curry jazz is by far the best thing...EVER!

Also recommended is the Yum Ta Lay (Seafood Salad). If you like spicy dishes, have this dish "Thai Hot." Now, how awesome does that sound? All-the-way awesome.

With satisfying portions, fast and friendly service, and a chill atmosphere, this restaurant rocks my socks. Recommended for dates, casual to club wear. Or have your whole, fatty crew roll through.

But if you're not feeling in the mood to go out, they DELIVER! 

*I recommend avoiding the more typical items on the menu, since those can be found anywhere... dive into the exotic. Yes!
author: Tina J.

description: Seriously, this is one of the best, if not the best place for Thai Food that I've ever experienced.  It's understated, kind of intimate and simple... but the food is mouth-watering and seasoning exceptional.  Service was great, and price exactly reflective of the quality - a little more than usual but not over the top, and after the meal I felt lucky to have found this place!  Everything was great!
author: Ellen K.

description:
This is a review for their Delivery only: 

We order Thai food from here pretty regularly. Some of my favorites include their Broccoli beef and pad thai with chicken. Their thai ice tea is quite tasty too. 

But I will no longer eat here - that doesn't mean you shouldn't. I'm just a little pissed that after the 5 or 6th time order delivery, they told me our location was out of their delivery area and had to charge us $5, but that my food was ready to be delivered. This is about 40 minutes after we ordered. They magically lost my order history as well. How incredibly convenient.

Food is good, service could be better.
author: Liliana A.

description:
I felt like giving this place one star, but it wouldn't be fair because sometimes the food is good.  I always get the Pad Thai.  It's one of the only consistently good dishes.  Sometimes, if I'm really feeling like a pig, I get a mango with sticky rice.  I absolutely love mango with sticky rice.  When it's good, it's so yummy.  When it's bad, like today, it's either rotten fruit or hard rice.  Rotten fruit today!  Lucky me...

It's a hit or miss  :)

4/7/2008

Necessary update that I want to share with everyone and hope you spread this story as well.

This past Saturday around 3pm I stopped in for a Thai ice tea and mango sticky rice.  After placing the order the waiter came back to say that next time we will have to order more than the two items.  I thought perhaps I had misunderstood but he came back to explain again that I cannot only order a drink and dessert.  He made it seem as if I had displeased him greatly!  The restaurant was practically empty when we got there.  Since I was noticeably upset, he came back to say that when it's busy hours they need the seats.  The place was empty when I left, and with this kind of service I hope it stays that way!

Before this I was having a nice Saturday.  He ruined a part of my afternoon and no amount of mango sticky rice can fix that.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Now I know what it feels like to be a remorseful pig headed guy who cheats on his girlfriend. I finally found a place that has an amazing atmosphere and the best thai food and then I decide to be unfaithful and cheated on my Lemongrass with a pinch of Thai Spice. It wasn't worth it. It wasn't my cup of tea. This place was hip and contemporary with hiphop music playing in the background and it didn't provide the relaxing vibe I was hoping to get.
The portions of the food were quite small but presentation of the food was done nicely. The food was bland boring, nothing special. Not the tranquil relaxation that I so desperately needed today. Will my true love take me back? To be continued! To be continued?
author: Bradley P.

description:
This cozy restaurant was perfect for a long, quiet meal with good friends. The service was fantastic and I was overwhelmed by the vegetarian options. A friend ordered the soup and shared a few spoonfuls -- it was delicious. I ordered the Tofu and Spinach in Peanut sauce and absolutely loved it. My friends did too -- they helped me finish every last bite.

I really loved the atmosphere here. Combined with the stellar service (my water glass and green tea were never empty), Thai Spice proved to be the perfect spot for an intimate dinner with friends -- especially when most of the other restaurants nearby were booming club music or playing TVs.
author: Jenn R.

description:
For Thai food, this restaurant is pretty good.

Their chicken coconut soup and pad thai rock. Other dishes are hit or miss. I have taken some friends there and they like the restaurant as well. 

The atmosphere is great and the prices are reasonable!
author: Alex M.

description:
I ate here once before and had to try  it again before passing judgment.

My boyfriend and I live down the street from here and love Thai food but were really disappointed both times.

The Pad Thai is just eh. It didn't have much flavor but was a good size portion.

The Yellow curry was actually really good and had just the right amount of spice to it. It doesn't come with a side of rice so we ordered one side. Definitely a small portion not big enough to share.

My boyfriend tried seafood dishes both times and was beyond disgusted each time. The Pad Ta Lay (Sauteed Assorted Seafood) was on the favorites list yet the seafood is frozen and has a really fishy and salty taste. 

So stay away from the seafood and be sure to print a coupon for 15% off from their website.
author: Beth H.

description: I had been to this restaurant with my grandparents on several occasions because they were regulars. The food is good. Not 5 star, but they use fresh ingredients and provide prompt service. On mother's day last year, I took my mom thinking her first Thai experience would be above average at a local SF spot. WRONG! As soon as we walked in we were given dirty looks and no one came to seat us so we seated ourselves after 5 minutes of waiting...there was no line or wait btw. Immediately after sitting, we spotted a booger on the table. We asked the older man to clean the table. He reluctantly did so and gave us dirty looks. 5 minutes later we ordered an appetizer and drinks. Once we realized we ordered the wrong appetizer, we asked if we could change but offered to pay for the first appetizer. The same old man that gave us dirty stares asked us to leave and told us he couldn't serve us. WTF? Where do they do that at? Didn't bother me....the food is mediocre and there are 5 million other Thai places to eat ate in the city. Don't waste your time there.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Dine in or delivery, whatever.  This food always hits the spot. 

The downside to dining in is the service is little slow, but the food is never compromised.   My husband and I always split the red curry and pad thai.  Consistency is a great virtue.
author: angela t.

description:
This is a great place for lunch, under $10 for a nice plate of rice with curry ir pad thai. Unlimited refills of refreshing hot thai tea! All entrees come with Thai salad also !

Good, courteous and prompt service. Can't ask for more.
author: Sumit C.

description:
Definitely a local neighborhood favorite for me.  Good tasting Thai food at a moderate price, with good service to boot.  When things get a little busy, it sometimes takes a little longer to get one's order but overall it's a great place.

Plus, reservations can be made on OpenTable, and they have many options for 1000 pt reservations!!
author: George J.

description:
We liked this place very much until one Saturday night that the waiter with attitude served us, or not served us because we left before ordering anything...his attitude was unbearable, and because of that we will never go back to this restaurant. 

We had eaten here many many times before, and we thought there were 2 or more cooks in the kitchen because the food is excellent some time and almost tasteless other times. We couldn't quite figure out which days were excellent cook's day... but no need to figure that out any more because we are not going back. Too bad any other waiter/ waitress were nice and friendly, we always had good service until that Saturday night.
author: Wakaknee J.

description: My friend and I witnessed the Thai Spice staff displaying blatant DISCRIMINATION against a handicapped woman wearing a head scarf. She came into the restaurant alone, in a wheelchair, and was seated in the dining area at the table next to ours near the front, and upon ordering her dinner, she was apparently asked to pay for her food BEFORE being served. She asked us if we were asked to do the same. We said no. After this brief interaction, we watched her pay for her tea and then quietly leave. (Her tea had already been served, in a ceramic mug, along with her food bill -- so there was no mistake that she intended to stay and eat in the dining room). There is no reason that she should have been treated any differently than any other patron. Seeing this kind of discrimination is upsetting - what a terrible way to treat any human being. Suffice to say, we will not be dining at this restaurant again.
author: W L.

description: If they brought me a second plate of Pad Thai, I probably would have ate it. Not because the first portion was small, but because it is so good, it wouldn't matter if I was already full. I just want more. Yum.
author: Melanie L.

description:
I've walked by Thai Spice hundreds of time and have eaten there previously only once.  My impression then was it was "ok" but that it was overpriced.  Ate here again w/some discount coupons my GF got and my impression is the same.

The decor of the restaurant is very pleasing and, if you can get one of  the 2 window tables and, service on this visit was fine.  Beverages were served and water was refilled promptly w/o asking and the food ordered was served in acceptable interval and the food (with one exception) was fine.

Ordered Spinach Rolls ($8) and Angel wings ($12)  for appetizers and Lemongrass Seafood ($15)  and Pumpkin Chicken Yellow Curry ($10)  for entrees.  The spinach rolls were larger than I've seen before and had a delightful flavor w/roasted coconut flakes, peanut sauce and lime; the plate was also decorated w/orchid petals and a spice basil sauce that we couldn't resist.  The Angel wings were very large -- stuffed w/a mixture of vermicelli, chicken meat and other things -- and crisply fried; a pair of steak knives were provided to make cutting the wings easier.  The Lemongrass Seafood was the best dish of the lot -- a generous mixture of green mussels, shrimp, squid, scallops and fish seasoned w/slivered lemongrass and basil; only negative was that you had to be careful to pick away the lemon grass which is basically inedible and has the texture of straw.  The Pumpkin Chicken Yellow Curry was a disappointment -- the chicken was tough and dry -- as though it had been used to make broth and then thrown into the curry to cover it -- but oddly the pumpkin was tough and seemed undercooked.  The curry sauce on the other hand tasted fine. 

The total cost of the meal including $3 for 2 small bowls of rice (which I don't think should be charged for) and a bottle of Thai beer for $4 (which was reasonable) plus tax and tip was $65.  Pretty steep for a late lunch..  So, if you can afford the freight, you should have a decent meal and dining experience at Thai Spice but if you're looking for something more "affordable" w/equally good food (albeit not as pleasant decor or food presentation) there are many options on the same block where Thai Spice is located -- particularly Sam's Chinese Restaurant which is located only a few doors away.
author: Martin C.

description:
Along with my brother and his friends, the 7 of us sat comfortably for an evening meal together.  One couple in our group said quietly to me, "I wonder why we all came here instead of going to a 'much better' Thai restaurant just across/down the street."  Except for my brother, all these friends live within several blocks of this place.
Decor was nice, staff was fine, and food?... well... meh.
I found the som toam (green papaya salad) to be sweet with no hint of fire, which is how I like it.  When I ordered it, the waiter did not ask if I wanted any spice, in fact.  I ordered some sticky rice to accompany it, which is how I was taught by a friend who used to live in Thailand to eat the salad.  I thought that for the price of the salad, it was a very small portion.  However, a few others at the table tried this salad and rice for the first time, ever, and remarked they liked it.  
As my main dish, I ordered a fat rice noodle dish that had maybe 7 lightly spiced shrimps, fresh broccoli, matchsticks of carrot in a light, sweet gravy (maybe made from some fermented black bean paste).  This was alright, but again, not terribly interesting.  What was most unpleasant was finding the vein in each shrimp not having been completely removed -- Eeewww!  Yukky green stuff!  My brother was not too impressed with his pumpkin curry with chicken; said it was kind of bland.
Huh.  Go figure how some like the food at some place while others, not so much.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
ordered some food by delivery.com at 5:45pm and around 7pm still no food !!!!called twice until 7:45 still they didn't  even start cooking yet. so I had to cancel!!! they just said "sorry about that"
so pls don't waste your time!!!!
author: Toshie Y.

description:
Food was not bad, but nothing to write home about.  Service was rather bad though.  Ordered four iced teas, got five.  Had to ask for chopsticks twice (they don't give you any to start).  We ordered two curries and got one spoon.  We had a table full of empty plates, so when we asked (we had to ask!) to have them taken away, the server came back with additional plates.

I love Thai food, and the food was alright, but the service was just not very good.  That and I would rather go to Asian places that at least PRETEND to be authentic enough to give you chopsticks.
author: Eric M.

description:
Great "all-purpose" Thai restaurant that really kicks up the game with their presentation... a notch or two higher than you'd expect at this price bracket.

Highly reccomended: The Pad Kee Mao and the Pad Ta Lay. If you love your food spicy, order "medium" or "hot." If you order "Thai Spice" even the most hardened of spicy-food warriors will walk away in agony.

For all the people who have complained about delivery orders - We order from Thai Spice two or three times a week and are constantly awed by their fast delivery. Sometimes they're at our door in no less than 20 minutes when they say "45 minutes" over the phone.
author: Evelyn W.

description:
Really my vote is 2.5 stars.

I don't think there is a bad restaurant in SF. I do however think that there are a plethora of mediocre and 'really' mediocre restaurants, and this place is one of them.

I enjoyed the spinach roll. It was the high point of the meal, next to the wine, which was pretty nice. The sticky rice came in these individual packets inside of  little bambo steamers. We were unable to determine if it was on purpose that the rice iteself was wrapped tightly in plastic wrap, and obviously microwaved. It seemed like it had to be a mistake. Or at least that is what we wanted ot believe. Yuk.

We were the only people in the place. The service was really bad. At one point we were sitting there with empty wine glasses and empty water glasses, and short of standing on the table waving flags trying to get the attention of our waitress, a bus person, the hostess, to no avail. In fact it appeared as though the waitress who was in plain sight of me repeatedly made a point of not looking at me so she could carry on her conversation with her coworker. My companion finally did a "YOOOHOOO" in a high screechy voice and got the attention of the hostess who then summoned the waitress to work.

Geee. So sorry to inconvenience you at your work where you wait tables with coming to my table. You're wearing an apron, that tells me that you are working. My lack of the apron tells me that I am a paying costumer and also your tip. Or maybe not. Maybe you don't want a tip. Maybe you want to just stand there yapping.

I dunno. I don't think I need to have or recommend this experience. I get better attention when I'm home alone cooking for myself. The service is poor and the food is utterly mediocre.

next
author: Marz W.

description: The closest I have come to authentic Thai food since visiting Thailand last year.  When I asked for Thai hot they served it up wonderfully. :)
author: Kristi C.

description:
Terrible Thai Spice

Wow. What a grand disappointment. I haven't had Thai food this bad in years.

1. Spring rolls (fried vegie) - lacked flavor. . . simply boring.

2. Thai Fried Rice with Chicken - soy sauce? who puts soy sauce in TFR? This tasted more like Chinese food and not Thai---too moist, too salty and just plain bad.

3. Spicy shrimp stuffed with crab - where was the crab? This tasted more like shrimp stuffed with pork sausage. I liked the accompanying chili sauce and the presentation, but the dish was too salty.

4. Thick Rice Noodles with Basil, Tomato and Beef -- where was the tomato? Why the bell pepper? And a bit too much oil. Decent, but not that great.

This is the 1st time I've left a Thai restaurant without taking my unfinished meal home with me. . . I just knew if I did that it was going to turn into a science experiment in my fridge.

The service was lackluster. Our waitress was quite inexperienced and I had to repeat myself several times when I asked for things. 

Oh, and the group of 5 obnoxious Marina girls who walked in didn't help the vibe. I know that's not the restaurant's fault, but once again a group of Marina chicks managed to ruin the ambiance. . . what with the loud screeching and cackling----they even brought their own 12 pack of beer --- that's classy, no? 

Anyway, I won't be returning to Thai Spice. At least I got my 1,000 points on Opentable--that's the only positive point I have to make.
author: David R.

description:
Met up with some of my friends in Southbay. 
And since they are seventh day adventist, they don't eat pork 
but love Thai food. 

I yelp Thai Spice & found out that its just 1 min away from our condo so I figure it will much easier for everybody since I'm not great with directions and my friend's SUV do not have GPS to dine here.

We ordered chicken Satay, Tom Yum Gai, Poh Taag (bit salty), Mango shrimp Salad (delicious), Chicken Pad Thai  & Beef Pad See You (like the noodles). For desserts, we just had the FBI.....it was good.

The price affordable and guaranteed you're full. Also, I made 7 PM reservation at opentable.com which earned me a 1,000 points ^_^
author: jubi l.

description:
Delivery took an hour, on a Thursday evening, and when it got here, cold mediocre food.  OK I think I can deal with cold food, I have a microwave.  And guess what I find in my vegetarian pad thai?  CHICKEN.

Yep, they sent me meat.  Now, I will work with cold food.  I will work with an hour delivery cause it's SF.  BUT I will not work with chicken.

After 20 minutes on the phone I got a refund. 

The other item was good, so they get 2 stars.
author: Bianca P.

description:
We really like this place. We started going here a little too often and although the food is always consistently good, we had to stop coming here so that we could try other places!

It's walkable and close to transit as it is affordable.  Def a great place.
author: Tamz O.

description:
So, I think on my original review I jumped the gun a little bit. I was new to yelp and eager to get my first review out there, but hadn't yet found my stride, and reading my review now I realize that Number A) I wasn't that interesting and Letter 2) I hadn't given Thai Spice enough of an opportunity to blow me away.

I would now consider myself a Thai Spice take-out regular. I have to say, their food is maaaybe my favorite Thai to date :D Their pumpkin curry haunts my dreams with its delicious coconutty goodness. Also, when you order your food "spicy" here, they take you seriously. So be warned.

I have really only been inside this restaurant that first time, so my opinion of the restaurant still holds true, but for take out they make my life simple. Their delivery time is always a little bit long when they quote it, but they tend to show up earlier than they say. Awesome. I just pop open a bottle of wine and wait for my Thai goodness to arrive. 

You win, Thai Spice. Way to go.
author: Tara O.

description:
I will preface this by saying: I order the exact same thing every.single.time. That is no lie.  If you are looking for a good basil leaf with tofu, look no further. 

However, my companions have always either really liked their food or been veerry under-impressed.

It's close to home, cheap-ish, and the food comes quickly. But the best part about Thai Spice? The crushed ice...it's old-fashioned ,Pizza Hut after the 7th grade dance crushed ice (it earned you that 4th star, Thai Spice). Nom nom nom.
author: Christy S.

description: Thai Spice's food is yummy, presented nice and also priced well. I went for the lunch combo which is 8.95. You get a choice of 2 items served with rice. I ordered the chicken yellow curry and thai spice roll. The yellow curry was good so good I cleaned the bowl. What I absolutely loved was actually what my bf ordered, the peanut sauce beef. It comes with beef and lots of greens in peanut sauce. I ended up trading my bf peanut sauce beef for my rolls. :)
author: Jess H.

description: Their food is so good, but the service is horrible. I had an incident about 8 months ago where I ordered for pick up because my daughter was asleep & by the time we got there to get it, she woke up, so we decided to eat it there, the woman then began to tell me that you cannot eat take out food in the restaurant. I explained to her the situation & she was super unhappy about it & rude. Then she served us our potstickers with mayo on them when I specifically asked for none, then forgot about them, when I got the bill I was charged for them so I asked them to take it off. Last night I ordered delivery through their online service, I pressed cash instead of credit card, so I called to let them know I needed to use a credit card the woman said I had to call the website & she'd call me back in 5 minutes, then I explained to her that I wanted to make sure that there was no mayo on the potstickers. She told me the note said no garlic, not mayo, so I said okay well can you make sure there's no mayo please, I'm telling you now, she said okay, then someone took my card number. My food was delivered & there was mayo, I called & the woman said what do you want? I said I want new ones, she said it will be 45-1 hour, I said that's fine, then someone called me back stating that it did not say it in the note so they wouldn't be delivering it, I asked to speak to a manger, & she started laughing & said no manager here.
author: Jade D.

description:
I did wait awhile for my delivery last night, buuuut I was with my friend and wasn't totally starving, so it was OK. Most importantly, the food was tasty.

My friend got the green curry (medium) with tofu, which as a regular of Thai Spice, is her regular dish. 

I got the red curry with chicken, thai spice. OMG it was hot. I was debating between the "hot" and "thai spice" but decided I didn't want to be disappointed by the hot. Next time I'm pretty confident I'll be just fine with getting the "hot".

We each got a side of brown rice. Yay for having brown rice! Totally doesn't make sense why some places don't have it. 

Oh and the delivery guy was pretty friendly and they took my credit card when the guy came so I didn't need to read them the number over the phone. excellent, nice and convenient.
author: Caitlin B.

description:
On my most recent visit, I first noticed the new and nicely done menu(s). And now Thai Spice serves cocktails, a broad but limited set, $6 apiece. The Pina Colada was excellent, tasty, small pineapple bits galore and excellent presentation with fruit garnish and an orchid blossom(!), which is also edible.
Among other favorites, we tried the Lemon Grass Seafood. Killer variety and flavor, and lots of lemon grass there. Probably too spicy for many, so look out for those innocent looking jalapenos.
I didn't know ja;apenos and Pina Coladas were Thai ;-)
One issue: a lack of coordination among three servers who wanted to take our initial our order -- already done -- but where IS the appetizer combo? For vegetarians: my date thinks the curry puffs now contain some chicken.
author: Sam S.

description:
Thai Spice is pretty good Thai food for the neighborhood.  The wine list could be expanded big time but the food was pretty good.

The dishes that I ate - Cashew Chicken and Eggplant prawns were both tasty but a bit over salted.  Also, the basil was a bit overpowering.  Service was ok, not great.

I think Osha in the TL and Manora on 12th and Folsom are still better spots for Thai in the City.  But this fits the bill for a decent neighborhood Thai place.
author: Moe J.

description: Unlike other neighborhood restaurants, they gouge you on delivery. I ordered over $19 worth of food (in other words $24 w/tax & tip), and the manager demanded I order more -- b/c his "rule" is $20. I asked him politely to take my order since we were talking just a few cents difference, and I'd ordered from him several times before. He told me not to call back and hung up. He lost an order, and a regular customer, over 50 cents. Very poor way to do business.
author: Richard B.

description: I lived near Polk St. for a year and this was my go-to restaurant for yummy chicken satay and spring roll appetizers.  They make amazing pumpkin curry as well.  Excellent service, wait staff is extremely nice!  One cold afternoon I came in to order some takeout, and the waitress gave me some hot tea to sip while my food was being prepared!  The spice decorations on the wall are very creative and gave me ideas for my own home.  My only complaint is that if you sit by the door, you are bound to get a rush of cold air every time someone walks in or out of the restaurant.
author: Robyn Y.

description:
I ordered delivery and had the fresh spring rolls (vegetarian) the tofu satay and the crispy tofu. All 3 were awful. The spring rolls has so much basil and mint in them I would consider them inedible and I didn't even finish eating one of them. The sauce was so thick you couldn't dip the spring rolls in it.

The tofu satay and crispy tofu were exactly the same except one was on sticks and one was cut in triangles. The sauce for the satay was the exact same as for the spring rolls and once again too thick to really dip into. 

The sauce that came with the crispy tofu was better but the tofu is completely unseasoned and just deep fried. So both the satay and crispy tofu are basically tofu spoons for the sauces. I eat tofu all the time but unseasoned tofu is disgusting and the pieces are so thick that it is basically like eating tofu straight from the package. 

The last thing i will say that totally pissed me off was that the delivery guy called me and wanted me to come outside to the curb to pick up the food. Ummm if I wanted to come downstairs and outside to get the food I wouldn't have ordered delivery. I had to argue with him for about 3 minutes before he finally agreed to come up to my door. 

I will never order food from this place again.
author: Carly W.

description:
I had my birthday dinner at Thai Spice a couple of weeks ago and it was great. We had a party of about 10 people and we were able to be accommodated perfectly. This was the first time that I had been to Thai Spice, so I really had no expectations. Many of my friends had told me that the food was very good, so my only expectation was to have a great meal with the company of my close friends. 

Since it was a party and a somewhat large group, we dined family style. This worked out very well for us because there are so many items to chose from that the menu can become overwhelming. However, with family style dining, we were able to try a variety of appetizers and entrees that we individually, would not have the opportunity to experience. The food was very good and the portions were reasonable. I also very much enjoyed the ambiance and decor that this restaurant offers. 

I am a big fan of seafood soup, so that is what I ordered for my main entree and I was not disappointed. I personally do not eat meat, but my friends do and they were also quite pleased with what they ordered.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Thai Spice is my go-to take-out and delivery option.  The food is consistenly tasty and I love that when I don't have a menu in front of me, I can call and ask for any combination of ingredients and they'll whip up something to my liking. Their take-out services is speedy and delivery is, well, the average 45".

Big fan of: 
-chickens with basils
-eggplant with tofu
-yellow curry
-lemongrass chicken
author: Heather C.

description:
Great food, a little higher class thai than king of thai noodles. But a little more expenive. 

I think it taste a tad bit better than most thai places. Nice atmosphere, not dirty and grimy. Very clean and modern.
author: Steven C.

description:
this place is not bad.  i dont know why on thai menus i always kind of want to order a whole lot of stuff.  but we would end up with a lot of leftovers so we each ordered one thing.  and shared a soup.  everything was pretty decent.  

i ordered what they called a low carb pad thai.  basically a shrimp pad thai with silver noodles instead of rice noodles.  i hate it when they lable anything low carb, diet, healthy.  they should let me decide if it is or not.  the dish was good.  i dont know why thai food has raw bean sprouts in their pad thai.  i would prefer them cooked or something.  but thats just me.  my bf got their honey roast duck.  it looked fatty.  came with a lot of veggies.  the tom yum gung was good.  came with 7 shrimp!  one of them tasted like beer so i spat it out.  he also had a singha and i had a glass of riesling.

service was good.  they kept refilling our water.  almost too much.  came out to $54.  kind of pricey for two people ...  why is thai food so expensive in the city?????
author: claudia y.

description: I'm convinced this place has changed ownership, it used to be my favorite Thai place in the area, now it is ok at best. The prices went up and the food quality went down. I miss the old Thai Spice.
author: Christina L.

description:
I like it here. My friend and I had the window seat with the sequin pillows. I like the homey feel. One thing I didn't like was the70ish lady staring at my food while I was trying to eat...oh yeah..This is my review...

Here goes.

My friend was starving so he ordered the crispy spring rolls...he DOUBLE DIPPED! Oh no! He liked them...I tried 2 they were okay. The sweet and sour sauce was like crack for my date though, he kept on spooning it into his once bitten spring roll...said he liked it juicy. Hmmmm. I ordered the Chicken w/peanut sauce and spinach...very, very rich with brown rice. It was perfect and filling. It's enough for 3 people to share. There were leftovers. Normally, I get take out from Thai Spice, it's pretty good, reliable and friendly service. I live closeby so it's not a big deal kind of a place, but it's not a place to avoid either. They have good, solid Thai food. Check them out.
author: Sherie R.

description:
I'm a fan of Thai Spice, and have definitely put it at the top of my "I don't want to cook tonight" last-minute weeknight places. It's nothing uber-authentic or trendy (would probably never bring folks from out of town who I'm trying to impress), but the food always hits the spot. 

The servers are usually very friendly, but don't go there if you are in a hurry because it's not unusual to end up waiting for something at some point while you're there. 

Overall, I'd say if you live in or near Nob Hill, you should definitely keep it on your list. And if this were a review for YelpTakeout.com (if there was such a thing), I'd probably add another star.
author: Ben R.

description:
Overall, Thai Spice is pretty solid. Their spicy shrimp with chili/garlic is awesome, and some of their more traditional thai dishes are good. I have to write this update because my previously terrible experience has been eclipsed by multiple successes.

Still, their tom yum soup was garbage- that makes me sad
author: VL K.

description:
Another neighborhood gem for me. I come here quite a bit for dinner. Usually take out, although I like dining in too because they have a full bar and some awesome fruity drinks on the menu. Yesterday was my first time here for lunch. It seems as if the lunch special are definitely a better deal as far as value goes. This is one of the pricier Thai places in the city, but well worth it. Dishes I recommend here would be the Pumpkin Curry, Yellow Curry, Papaya Salad, Tom Ka soup, and Fresh Spring Rolls (I can't stand the crispy ones anywhere). There are more great dishes, but I can't remember them all. I don't think you can go wrong with anything here. I haven't in the 3 years I've been coming here. Unfortunately I never make it to dessert as I'm usually full by that time. I do hear the fried banana with coconut ice cream is not too shabby though. ;)

4 Starts because the service has been lacking at times. Usually they are on point though.
author: S A.

description:
This was decent at best.  The food just isn't very flavorful - at least, not the way you'd want it to be.  The Thai Fried Rice was really salty and goopy, no curry flavors.  The Fried Spring Rolls were also mushy, but really bland.  The Green Papaya Salad was swimming in vinegar dressing - so much so that the waiter spilled it all over the floor when he placed the dish on the table (the sub-par service is another issue).  And the Bar-B-Que Beef was like cardboard with grill marks.
Extra star for being open late.
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
Love this place.  I used to order delivery from here like 3 times a week...then I had to gain control of myself!
 
Love the spicy green beans and chicken, the minced beef with spices and basil, the sweet & sour chicken soup, AND the angel wings...woo hoo!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
They get some stars for the good-enough Thai food.  I mean, I'd go back, if I ever end up watching Labyrinth (starring: David Bowie; David Bowie's Package) at the Lumiere a couple blocks down.  But I'm not about to go out of my way for this.

Pumpkin curry: Yummy, but don't try to compare to Mekong's or Thep Phanom's.  And I like it hot, and this was not (admittedly, it wasn't marked as such).

They *did* have Singha, though it wasn't on the menu.  I just asked for one, and the biggest bottle of it I've ever seen appeared at my table, along with a chilled stein.  Soooo ... +1 for having it; -1 for not listing it.

Also, -1 or 2 for service.  They got multiple orders wrong (but did take them back and replace them with the correct versions when notified); agreed to wrap my friend's leftovers in tinfoil instead of a plastic thingie (can you say hardcore environmentalist?), but then appeared with a plastic thingie anyhow (that's what happens when you just say "yes" to everything).

Good to know it's not a desert up there.  But this is not a destination.  SF can do you better, Thai-wise.
author: Nori H.

description:
I came here for lunch a couple times and it was really just run of the mill.  Then I came here for dinner once and I was mildly surprised.  Their dinner entrees were actually pretty good.  Most thai places make their egglplant dishes real oily, but they actually managed not to at Thai Spice.  I think I'll come back for dinner, but only if I don't have to drive.  The parking around here is pretty much non existence.  

Although they do validate your parking at a nearby garage for 1.5 hours.
author: AhLin C.

description:
Thanks god I found you Thai Spice..you provides heavenly thai food for all crowds in reasonable price,isn't that cute? Thai Spice has its own charming ambience..luv it. all the spices on the wall catch my eyes somehow. that's the genius inspiration of the designer. The flowers decoration is so FAB. Give you FIVE! In term of food..Chef Wanna Wirat( I saw her name on the menu) she creates all the food intentionally..a lot of effort I can tell. Me and my friends ordered small plates Money bags ..that's worth every penny ..can't stop eating since it had been served on the table. For the entree' we ordered basil leaf chicken,simple but diliciiiiiiiious! Try the Emerald and Ruby Seabass..that's the piece of art ..luv the presentation and very tasty..

Thai spice I can't forget your mixtology..I had Mojito in Bkk..super yum..have to ask a little favor of my friend to try her lychee treasure..addicted..another one pls.
 

Service is very attentive and friendly ..
 Can't not wait for another time visiting you Thai Spice..Cheerssssssss!!!!!!!
author: pearl s.

description:
I really love the food here. We got pretty much a whole bottle of wine for only $12 and the menu selection is great. THe biggest complaint I have about this place is the service. The waitress we had seems stuck up and then a waiter took over and he seemed just as stuck up. He was asking us a question and we were trying to have a conversation and they walked away. 
I will continue to come to this place though )
author: Nir B.

description:
The food is good but delivery is an exercise in patience.  We often had to wait over 2 hours for delivery (in one instance, after almost 4 hours, I cancelled the order and they gave me an earful).  Sometimes the order would just go missing.  

Pick it up if you want your food relatively soon.
author: A. B.

description: great thai food with great pricing and fast take out me and my dorm mates go here at least a handful of times a semester if not triple that.
author: Jorge T.

description: The food is fine and elegant looking but I can't say that its better than others.  Nevertheless, its very convenient place to eat after having our nails done the next door.
author: Chloe K.

description:
My go-to Thai place used to be Dupont Thai in North Beach. There was never anyone in there, Anaconda was always playing on the TV, and they had kickin' Thai samosas. Sadly, Dupont Thai has been replaced by Citizen Thai and the Monkey (what on earth?), and gone are the Thai samosas.

Enter Thai Spice, my new old favorite. They do everything Dupont Thai did, but fresher and with more style. I highly recommend the pumpkin curry.
author: Christina S.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed the Pad Prik - a pretty standard Thai stir-fry.  I forget exactly what was in it, but damn it was tasty.  I ordered it with the pork and medium heat.  Usually I can take a lot of heat, but since I hadn't been there before, I didn't want to kill myself unknowingly.  The heat was perfect.  It was the kind you felt around your lips about 2 minutes after your initial bite.  Then, if you keep licking your lips, they feel like they're on fire and you need to stick it in a bowl full of milk.  Luckily, I didn't get to the milk bowl stage.

The absolute best thing to wash down peppers with is a nice, tall Thai iced tea.  This was the best one I've had in a really long time.  I always have to pace myself or else I'll order another one and be bouncing off the walls later in the evening.

And you know you're in an authentic Thai restaurant when your bill comes and it's all in Thai.  It prohibits you from making sure you're not being overcharged, but at least you know you're paying for real Thai - not some knockoff.
author: Alison N.

description:
It's not that hard to screw up Thai food. You've got your basics - Tom Yum soup, pad thai, green curry chicken. When it comes to Thai food, it's about making GOOD thai food. Thai Spice is another great little gem that middle polkers keep flocking to. The place is clean and the service is pleasant.

We started off with the fried calamari appetizer which we were rather impressed by. They offer large thick pieces of calamari and a spicy-sweet dipping sauce. The Tom Yum Goong soup is another staple that offers the right balance of lemongrass and spiciness and filled with shrimp and mushrooms. Now something I haven't noticed on the menu before was the pan friend noodles with duck. This dish was fantastic and has become my new favorite over pad thai and pad sew yew.  The dish was so full of flavor and filled with boneless duck, baby corn, and mushrooms. It was one of those dishes that you knew they weren't trying to fluff with noodles. I think it was on the special list so look out for it!
author: Josephine H.

description:
It was ok for Thai food I liked the green curry and the pad thai. The decor is cute and I would go back.
Service was slow and there was one waiter for the whole restaurant. It took us 20mins to get water.
author: Alison W.

description:
The chicken with spinach and peanut sauce is OK... the sauce is not particularly thick and combined with the spinach, the plate ends up being all watery. 

Avoid the beef with red curry sauce as the beef is soggy and tasteless although the sauce is tasty so I would order it with either chicken or tofu. 

It was completely dead on a Monday night. This is a good place to get takeout.
author: Noel H.

description:
Pack a load of Imodium AD (Extra Strength).

I like this place a lot for one reason:  When you order a dish Thai Spicy, it is actually Thai Spicy!  They bring it like you are in Bangkok and don't hold back.  Aside from that, the food is pretty good and very cheap, both pluses.  It also tends to be a bit rich (minus, depending).  Give it a go if "You Like it the Peppa!"
author: Naeem I.

description:
If you're looking for a quick low-key bite before going out on Polk or for some easy take-out, then Thai Spice is for you.  The food is decent but won't knock your shoes off.  Their curries and saute dishes are pretty good, but I personally haven't been enamored with their rice and noodle dishes.  They tend to be dry and with less seasoning.

The two ladies that mostly run the place are friendly and attentive, and overall they provide a good experience and meal that is also good at absorbing good amounts of C2H5OH later in the night!
author: Lemar H.

description:
The food here is solid thai food -- flavorful pad thai and great spring rolls.

I've giving this 2 stars because of the terrible service which spoiled my dinner.  I ordered take out from this place and they said it would be 10-15 minutes. So, I got in my car, drove over, double parked and much to my dismay there was a line of people inside waiting for their food.  My food didn't come out for 30 minutes and there were several other angry customers waiting at the counter.

What surprised me most was how the counter staff handled (or should I say DID NOT handle this) well.  There was no apology and when my food finally came out I made a comment around the inaccurate timing (I simply asked him to be accurate in how long it will take next time) and the server just glared at me.  Literally death stares.  He didn't say a word and just handed me my food.

I will not go back to Thai Spice because there are many other decent Thai places in town with much better service.

Try Modern Thai just a few blocks down. Same style food, with attentive service.  Or Lemon grass up further on Polk.  You will be much happier with the service and your stomach will thank you because you'll get your food in a timely manner.

Trust me, the food isn't worth the in total 45-minute wait on a Friday night.
author: Michelle P.

description: This place has the WORST service I've ever had. We waited for 15 minutes before anyone even came over to our table.  I ordered the pad thai which was super greasy and overloaded with sauce. My friend got BBQ chicken which came out GREEN! It was gross. I went here because it is a block from my place, I will never be back. I've had better thai at 2am in the Tenderloin.
author: Heather D.

description: It was twenty minutes before they closed when I called to see if they were still open.  Even though they were about to close they still said we could dine in.  When we arrived a table was set, but we decided it would be better for all involved if we just got our food to go.  Green Curry Tofu, Green Papaya Salad, Tofu Pad Thai and brown rice.  The curry was tasty, so was the green papaya salad (though I could have gone with a bit more spice in both of them) however the Pad Thai was lacking.  I will return to this place.
author: Hillary J.

description:
As long time neighborhood residents, we've come to Thai Spice for quite a while - and had used their delivery service often.  This year the prices went up, and the quality went down.  Maybe they don't have the traffic they used to, but the food we ordered, not once, but twice, was not fresh.

Example: Spring rolls ... tasted so funky that we didn't finish them.  

$14 for Duck in red curry is just too much.  There wasn't much duck in the "soup" ... it really was a $9 dish. 

We give this a one-star review because we will never return.  We gave them a second chance - and a third chance this year.  And we won't give them a fourth.  

So we are looking for a new local Thai place.
author: jack l.

description: My boyfriend ordered duck curry, I ate prawn curry, we both were sick with diahrea and vomiting all night.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Have only had Pad Thai for takeout  (I had a major craving). Good flavor. The chicken was clean white meat which is not always the case, so that's a plus. I look forward to trying more items for takeout or dining in and being able to fine-tune my rating.
author: m t.

description: Best Thai food I've had in San Francisco.  The chicken pumpkin curry was so good I nearly licked the bowl.  The pad thai and egg rolls are also delicious...and the beers are big...so really, what else could you ask for?  I went two nights ago for a birthday celebration, took one bite of the pumpkin curry and decided immediately that Thai Spice was one of my new favorite spots in the city.
author: Jessica H.

description: Dig the low carb pad thai.
author: Drew L.

description: I used to eat here twice a month-more like twice a year now.  I think the quality of the food has trailed off a bit.  Still acceptable, but now lacks the fresh taste I remembered in years past.
author: Peter S.

description:
This place is alright.  It has a great setting and ambience with quality service.  My basil pork was a little too spicy with way too much basil for one to consume, but their chicken dishes are quite good.

Just don't sit next to the window, since it's "exotic Thai" food, people are always peeking in out of curiosity.  It can be distracting.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
The walls of Thai Spice are adorned with boxes of spice and other ingredients used in Thai Style cooking. They make something nice to look at, but I sure wish they would take some of those spices off the wall and mix it up in their dishes.  The flavor in all the dishes I tried was very underwhelming, and the flavor died on my tongue before I'd even finished chewing.  The peanut sauteed chicked should also be avoided, unless you are a big fan of Skippy at dinner time.
The wait staff was decent, but absent at times despite the limited number of patrons.
author: Nosniv X.

description:
Thai Spice is good, not great. Remodeled last year, it is very clean with warm soothing colors, but I preferred the homeyness of the pre-remodeled Thai Spice. It has lost some of it's charm

The food: The pumpkin curry with chicken is divine and the praram (peanut sauce) yummy, but I tend to judge my Thai food by the Tom Kha coconut soup, and theirs seems to be lacking.

The service is warm and friendly.

If their Tom Kha was better, I'd feel comfortable giving them another star or two.
author: Brad C.

description:
Read the reviews...people hate it, people love it, it's too spicey, it's not spicey enough...

I guess you have to decide for yourself since everyone has different tastes.  As for me I've never had any issues with the food or service at this restaurant while dining in.  Food has always been fresh and delicious and the service has been friendly and quick.  

I've never ordered to-go or delivery so I can't speak to that.
author: Diane N.

description:
I'm going to go ahead and say mixed reviews on this one as I have had various experiences, the last one being not so pleasant.

Service is very important to me in a restaurant. And it can depend on the waiter. The last time I dialed in for take out, the guy really pissed me off. He picked up the phone after 5 rings

Unfriendly waiter: *mumbles something uncomprehensible*
Me: Uh... is this thai spice?
Unfriendly waiter: Yes
Me: I'd like to order takeout.
Unfriendly waiter: I SAID ONE MINUTE, I'M BUSY

I was so startled by the rudeness of this guy that I would have just hung up on him if it wasn't for the fact that I was desperate for decent takeout food around the neighborhood. The food is good, perhaps a little pricey at $10-$20 a plate just for lunch.

Other times, I have had decent service but I always got the feeling that the waiters weren't really into their jobs for whatever reason. I can understand being a waiter isn't the best job in the world but at least appear like you're friendly.
author: David N.

description:
I came here with a friend who's been raving about this place as her favorite Thai spot in the neighborhood. I definitely agree!! 

I was impressed by the selections. I ordered a couple of their clay pots (Thai spice if you can handle the heat) and it was delicious. It has a selection that some other Thai places can't compare to. I took the to-go menu and I will be checking this place out soon!
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Ok...HAWT DAMN this place is good. But I'm serious, like literally hawt damn the pad thai is f'n hot. Its a fine line of me absolutely loving it while giving myself 2nd degree burns while eating it.

Ok its not THAT hot, but it probably the most spicy pad thai I've ever had. And thats just the way it comes from this place because we don't exactly order it extra spicy or anything. Its really good pad thai though. Its got just the right amount of moisture/sauce (I like my pad thai slightly on the drier side) and the spices are excellent. The heat is very in your face, but actually goes away quickly once you are done if you quell it with something else right after.

The other thing to get here is the pumpkin curry (which actually mates very well to spicy pad thai). I can't describe how good it is. The flavor is so unique and it comes with a very generous portion of well cooked chicken (though sometimes not enough pumpkin).

We also got the bean and tofu dish which was also very good, but certainly not as good as the pad thai or pumpkin curry, but i guess you have to include something green in your meal, right?

I've only ordered take out from this place, but would have to imagine that eating in the restaurant is as good or better!

Prices are very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food.
author: Varun ..

description: Took 1.5 hours for delivery.. worst service ever and food is just mediocre.  don't waste your time.
author: Jeff L.

description: I've ordered delivery from Thai Spice many times over the years and have always been content with their food - good flavors & quality in my opinion; however, the last time I ordered delivery, they charged $0.50 per side of hot sauce.  Nickle and diming like that bugs, especially when they're is no extra charge to have the same sauce cooked into the food.
author: Raja B.

description: This is the BEST thai Restraunt I have been too thus far! Nice setting, fantastic food, reasonable pricing, and great service. Today is my second time back and the wait remebered what I ordered a week and a half ago. A must visit!
author: Millymill C.

description:
DO NOT ORDER from here!! Especially if you are hungry and want to eat in the next 2-3 hours.

Where do I begin...

Food: Bland, not interesting, bland, bland and more bland.... This is not how Thai food is supposed to be!

Service: We ordered food here knowing well ahead of time that it is not the best food, but we were hungry. We live 4 blocks away so when food wasn't here 45 minutes later, we called to see how long it would take. We got a generic response that it's on the way. Another 30 minutes later, we called again and once again were told that food is on the way. 

I mean seriously: this type of bland food with overcooked veggies is not individually prepared - it is mass produced and all they needed to do was to pack it up and have someone walk over freaking 4 blocks! 

I always read these type of posts thinking: "Sh*t happens!" and disregard these type of negative reviews. And guess what - they are true! When it happens to me, like it did with this restaurant, I know people who gave this place a negative review were not kidding! 

Eat here and order  here at your own risk! You were warned! :)
author: Lenchik O.

description:
Went here before a show at the Red Devil Lounge.  Convenient location, but there are a bunch of other places in the area as well that I'll probably try out next time.  They now have beer on the menu (if they didn't before), so we had a couple of tall Singhas.  The appetizers (laab, fresh rolls and satay) were okay...not great, but okay.  My eggplant dish in bean sauce was pretty good, but the crispy basil was not crispy.  Basically, this is a decent thai place if you're in the neighborhood and need some food, but I wouldn't travel far to get here just for dinner.  

BTW, the waiter was nice and the food came quickly...no server problems at all, unlike previous posters.
author: Mike B.

description:
DON'T EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO WAIT 2 HOURS FOR YOUR FOOD!
Just got screwed by this restaurant!
I ordered delivery at 6:30pm and called to ask how long it would take. The said one hour. At 7:45 I called again to see how much longer it would take. I was told they would call me right back and let me know. Ten minutes later still no call back. So I call again and I'm put on hold for over 3 minutes so I hung up and called back. She says she is going to call the driver because it should have been delivered. She puts me on hold again for 3 minutes and then comes back on the phone to tell me the driver does not even have my order. The only thing she offered me was a 50% off discount and that the food would be delivered in 20 minutes. I told her at this point I am so hungry I can't wait any longer and by the time the food got to me I will have already ate something and that the food should be free at this point. She didn't agree so I told her I'd blast it. Then she put me on hold again.......I hung up. I don't want the food now since they'll probably spit in it. It is now 8:30. Unbelievable...........I wonder how old those good reviews are they have on their website? Boycott this place.
author: Jessica W.

description: My favorite Thai place in town. Good service (whenever we get off our couch - sooolazy - and shuffle on over to the actual restaurant) and GREAT delivery. Oh man, just thinking about it makes me wish we were getting thai spice tonight!
author: Sarah M.

description: I must confess that I don't LOVE the appetizer menu, but then again I'm pretty much a spring roll kind of girl and those are d-lish at Thai Spice. Everything else is awesome... they will customize anything and everything for you... very accommodating. Really well priced, and delivery is usually pretty fast, too. They have great deals on the lunch menu.
author: J. A.

description: 3 stars for the pad kee mao and 1 for the chicken with cashew nuts. Didn't enjoy the chicken at all - was fried, no flavor and only oil sauce.
author: Ami D.

description: Tom Yum and sticky rice are spot on!
author: Jules S.

description: solid thai restaurant with plenty of veggie options.  so far, i've had the basil tofu, string bean tofu, spring rolls, and tom ka soup.  all were super good.  and they don't skimp on tofu in the tom ka, which is always nice.  colorful atmosphere and good service.  i only wish they were in my neighborhood.
author: Karen O.

description:
So a good friend of mine claims that *real* Thai food -- as opposed to Thai food made for white tourist consumption, i.e., food in Thai restaurants in the U.S. -- can only really be found at those sidewalk stalls, say, in Bangkok. Though my culinary adventures sometimes resemble an episode of "Jackass," even I balked at the very real possibility of being airlifted out of rural Thailand, delirious and bleeding from the corner of the eyes, with hemorrhagic fever, and so I kept to the safe mall Thai food most of the time. (And even that was fantastic, so no loss. I think.)

So I can honestly say that I'm not exactly in the greatest of positions to evaluate Thai food, but I can tell you at least that Thai Spice is a decent, tastefully-decorated, prettily-presented restaurant. No real outstanding dishes, but the Thai beef salad has the chewiness of the beef and the crunchiness of the vegetables and the pungency of the nampla just right. And the duck curry -- I'm a real sucker for duck -- is excellent, though it could have done with less sauce. But service can be kind of spotty. Thai Spice just isn't Thep Phanom, if you get my drift.

Parking: let me put it this way. If it's around 5:30 on a weekday, you'll be okay. After 7:30? Let me save you some time: There's usually a row of meters on Pine and Franklin, about 5 blocks away. And you won't actually discover those empty spaces until you've driven in ever-widening concentric circles around Polk Gulch for half an hour and cursing yourself for not hopping on MUNI instead.
author: Sunny V.

description:
I love this place.  The staff is friendly and the food is BOMB!  I go there when ever I'm feeling like some Pad Thai or some Pad si ew.  Yesterday I ordered Pad Si Bu?  I think?!  It's with crab!  SO GOOD!  I ate the rest for breakfast this morning... 

Check it out... you'll love it!
author: Noneya B.

description:
Thai Spice is a great restaurant. I've gone here several times with friends and have to reccommend the eggplant and prawns dish- and be sure to eat the little beans that come with it (they're soo good!) The duck curry is also a favorite. We've also had the pad thai and the clay pots- delicious.

Be prepared however if this is a before-going-out for the nite dinner, that you prepare to stop at home afterwards because the ambiance definately makes you want to take a nap and/or puts you in a very calm place. The lights are very low and the music is soothing, so just do a little pre-party to get re-amped for the nite.

Go here it's really good.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I guess when you order delivery at least once a week they deserve 5 stars.  I love the chicken curry: Pumpkin, Yellow, Red.  Pinapple fried rice is fantastic.  Pad Thai is also good.  

If you have a friend who might be skeptical about Thai Food get them some pumpkin curry.  I haven't met anyone who hasn't liked it.
author: Luke W.

description: I'm a fanatic thai food fan.  Came here for the first time since my guy friend was raving about it.  I tend to order the most basic, but my favorite, dishes whenever I first try out a new thai restaurant, since I think if any thai restaurant can make these dishes yummy- they're worth coming back.  Ordered seafood tom yum soup, grilled beef salad, squid garlic satay, payaya salad, crab fried rice and fish cake.  The soup was the best out of all of them, however, still not great- was just ok.  the other dishes were just so-so. The service here is not that great, we could never get the waiter/waitress even though the restaurant wasn't full at all.  Overall,  Nothing really stood about this place.
author: elle n.

description: What level spicy do you prefer? Not spicy, mild, spicy, or THAI spicy?  Unless you want to burn off your tastebuds like I tend to, I suggest any of the first three options.  More generally speaking, the dishes are bursting with flavor and the service at the table is exceptional.  Despite the fact that they switched my delicious take-home leftovers  with some half eaten, soggy, indistinguishable appetizers (potstickers, I think... is that a Thai dish? who knows. beside the point.) I will most likely come back again because it's close to home and Polk street is great.  Fin.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant- in the entire Bay Area.  If only I could find a place so good down in Morgan Hill where I live!

The presentation of the food is BEAUTIFUL and the people that work there are kind and patient.  I have brought my three small kids in several times- and they are ALWAYS nice- even when my kids are acting insane.  

Their Fresh Spring Rolls are A MUST!  The Spinach rolls are also a great start.   My favorite dish is the Cashew Nut Chicken.  I haven't found any other place that even comes close.  It is SO good!

I would HIGHLY recommend this place!  I am drooling just thinking about it now!
author: Erina K.

description: I just stumbled into this place (a colleague of mine knew of it), and it's a great find. Excellent Thai food, at a *very * reasonable price, with a very pleasant interior. Great place.
author: Bret W.

description:
Really delicious place. Great for groups - I've gone with anywhere from 4 to 20 people here and they graciously accommodate lots of people, and will split checks without a problem in my experience.  

The Thai iced teas are delicious, and the pumpkin yellow curry deserves a special shout-out.  I also was just there last night again and had some amazing vegetarian dish that I think was a red curry and had some peanut something in it that was SO good.  Check it out - you won't be disappointed.
author: Marie L.

description: I LOVE Thai food so much that I could seriously eat Pad-Thai like every other day! When we got there we got sat right away and we were really hungry so we ordered right away.  It was probably because we were so hungry, but our appetizer took a long time to come out; as did our dinner.  I did observe though that there were a lot of to-go orders being delivered and I took that as a good sign and it was a Friday night as well.  The atmosphere in the restaurant was nice and peaceful rather nice after a long week.  Both dishes we ordered were delicious and the wait staff were very nice. I will have to go back here again and try some other things on the menu, but overall it was great.
author: Lola G.

description:
Having lived only 5 blocks from it for some time now and hearing from my roommate that it was the place to go, I decided to give it a try. 

It is very charming and exotic feeling inside. They were open late on a Sunday, which made me very happy. The service was acceptable, the food arrived quickly and was quite good. 

The Thai dish I usually order all around town is strips of beef w/ garlic, bell peppers, chili paste and basil (w/ a side of rice and peanut sauce). I ordered that same meal here, but was somewhat disappointed when my dish came and the beef was ground. Other than that the food was excellent. If you're in the area definitely give it a try.
author: Braydon R.

description:
Love it.  Everyone talks about how great SF dining is and yet I have been scrambling to  find decent Thai.  This is the winner so far.  

Pumpkin curry was tasty, though a bit more veggie variety would have sealed that deal for 5 stars.  I have been back many times and have never been disappointed. 

Crowded some days, empty the next.  Free delivery is great and fast.
author: Jess K.

description: We ordered this for delivery the other night. sure, I got broccoli beef... but it was the most boring thai dish I've ever experienced. I was going for bland but it was astonishing how forgettable this dish was! They do get bonus points for sticky rice - perfect! Next time I will order the soup by which I judge thai restaurants - Tom Ka Gai. I will keep you all updated!
author: Darren M.

description:
I once had a Thai roommate.  She eats her rice with a sprinkle of sugar.  Years later I finally came to a realization that majority of the dishes from her part of the world are laden with sugar.  

I love sugar.  And I love anything deep fried.  Which explains my love for glazed krispy kreme donuts.   

But when it comes to Thai food, I want mine spicy as hell.  And I didn't seem to get it at Thai Spice, despite the name.  Rather, the pad thai was much too sweet, although not quite as sweet as the thai iced tea, and the  overcooked salmon dish had too much heavy toppings (which are, of course, sweet).

As I found out, over and over again, nothing beats Khan Toke... or Osha (which, we later found that very same night, recently opened in Glen Park, much to our delight).
author: Ange L.

description:
Like Pho I'm very picky with my Thai food and this restaurant gets a solid 3 stars.  I ordered the shrimp green curry, thai bbq beef, and pad thai.  

The green curry was very tasty and had an adequate amount of shrimp however it was filled with huge chunks of zucchinis.  The Pad Thai was less then desirable because they used the very thin cellophane noodles which is what you would find in soups more than pad thai.  Overall taste of the noodles was fair.  Lastly the Thai Beef dish was served with a tasty sauce but the beef was a bit tough.  Luckily they provided steak knives to cut the meat however chewing it was a bit of a challenge. 

The atmosphere is very casual and nice but the service needs to improve just a bit.  

I will give this another try and provide an update on my dining experience.   For the neighborhood it's a good place to get a quick bite.
author: Oscar F.

description: Was in here last week for dinner with a friend. I had the Gang Pa, which had great flavor and wasn't too filling. My friend had the chicken Pad Thai and said that he also really enjoyed it. The servers were all very pleasant and attentive. We sat near the front of the restaurant, close to the windows, where the lights were nicely dimmed and we had a great street view. I would definitely return.
author: Steve B.

description: I don't think Thai food is that hard to do.  With that said, this place was average.  I didn't think anything in particular stood out.  I certainly feel that I could go to almost any Thai place and get the same quality of food.  The place wasn't bad, so if you're up for Thai food, this wouldn't be a complete loss if you're looking for typical Thai fare.
author: Kitty L.

description:
This is a great Thai restaurant. The food is very good. I took one star for them often bringing me white rice instead of the brown rice I order.
This is minor, I love the place. Great value.
author: Dietmar B.

description: Thai Spice is delicious!  I have ordered from them four times and up until the last time did they get my order correct.  I wasn't too bummed as their substitute was still super yummy but I was expecting something else.  They are very sweet people and will definitely order from them in the future.  Obsessed with great thai food; their curry is unreal....
author: KerryLynn K.

description:
Ruam Mit (appetizer combo)  $10.95
