Gang Kiew Wan (green curry with chicken)  $8.95
Pad Kee Mao (spicy pan fried noodle w/pork)  $8.95

The appetizer platter came with 2 pieces fish cake, 2 shrimp-in-the-blankets, 2 spring rolls, 2 curry puffs, and 4 pieces of fried tofu.  Although pretty much everything on the platter was fried, it didn't have a heavy or greasy feeling. In fact, I rather liked the fish cake and spring rolls (though I loathe to admit I liked the spring rolls since it's kind of like an Italian person admitting they like Sbarro pizza). The appetizer combo came with 4 different kinds of dipping sauce: all on the really sweet side but not overbearingly sweet. The pad kee mao had a good flavor to it, but I found the exorbitant amount of dried red pepper chili flakes to be too texturally distracting. The noodles itself are pan fried so they're already going to be dry, but then to make it even more dry by adding dried flakes?  Basically, the flavor was good and it wasn't too oily, but it was kind of gritty. The green curry was smooth, creamy, flavorful, and came with fresh chunks of chicken and zucchini which surprisingly weren't overcooked or undercooked. The curry itself had a nice kick to it but didn't overbear on the flavor of the dish. The spiciness on everything was pretty spot-on; We ordered "spicy" so it wasn't "Thai spicy" but it was spicy enough that we had to drink 2 glasses of water each (and we're people who could eat raw jalapenos as a snack).  All in all, the food itself is probably worthy of 3.5 - 4 stars.
 
So why only 3 stars?  Here are my peeves with this place:

#1) They don't use fresh chili peppers, only dried flakes! When we ordered the food, we asked for a side condiment of Thai chilies in fish sauce. Her reply?  They don't have any fresh chilies, only chili powder / flakes. Somehow their food still managed to taste pretty good, so I don't want to pass judgment on this fact alone, but seriously, a Thai restaurant that doesn't have Thai chilies?  Kind of like a Chinese restaurant that doesn't have soy sauce. At least a few jalapenos would have filled the gap somewhat, but they didn't have those either.

#2)  Customer/client service is pretty bad. My husband originally ordered green curry with shrimp (not chicken). I heard him say it so I'm pretty sure the waitress heard him say it. When it came out with chicken instead, we told them we ordered shrimp. Did they offer to exchange it?  No. Instead, they merely said the order was written down as chicken, and left the table before we could even open our mouths in response. 

#3) This was our first time eating at this restaurant and only decided to try it based on the "free entrée" coupon we received a la Valpak. One would think coupons are offered in order to entice people to try their restaurant (new customers = new + possibly repeat business), but somehow redeeming the coupon seemed to piss them off!  First, they gave us a bizarre look when I asked to box up the leftover pad kee mao. There was enough for lunch the next day but the look they gave was like I was asking to box up 2 pieces of noodle. When the cashier person came to drop off our bill, she also dropped off the pad kee mao box...literally. She dropped it right in front of my husband's face and it came tumbling out of the bag. She mumbled something resembling a sorry (hey, we all have our bad days, so we were willing to overlook this) but then as she was making a motion to try and put the box back into the takeout bag, halfway through she basically made a "screw it" gesture and then not very discreetly flung the box back onto the table in front of his face again.....  

I really wanted to like this place because it's so close to the house and the food is pretty good, but don't know if we can bring ourselves back to eat here again because of the service. Normally we're pretty easy going on service and overlook a lot of things, but kind of feel like they almost didn't want us to come back?
author: Colleen L.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood Thai joint. The space is beautiful, the location is convenient and the food is outstanding. For a long time, I've been looking for a Thai restaurant that served Angel Wings the way I like it --- crusty-coated stuffed chicken wings. Thai Spice has it. The staff are great and the price is reasonable. Go there alone or go there with friends. And if you can't go there, there's always delivery. Check 'em out.
author: Jen A.

description: Consistently delicious food. Haven eaten about 6 different dishes on the menu and all have been worth my while.
author: Heidi K.

description: Thai Spice has very good Thai Food.  I would consider it one of the top Thai restaurants in SF.  Good things to get here are Pad Kee Mao, Basil Chicken, and the spring rolls.
author: Matthew S.

description: Service was quick and timely, but not overbearing. We had the Vegi spring rolls - good. The red chicken curry -eh, chicken was WAY over cooked, but the spices and rice were perfect. The Pad Thai - was not a traditional version (probably made with ketchup) and no lime was served. It was ok, but I doubt I'd go back.
author: Erica C.

description: Absolutely delicious.  I may have even given them five stars if they had not taken forever to deliver the food.  We got the yellow and red curry and both were a delight: they had a bit of a kick to them, which I was definitely diggin!  the papaya salad was good not as tasty as out the door or three seasons, but for delivery it worked just fine.  Everything was A-OK!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: A neighborhood staple - It may not be the most amazing Thai food, but I will miss this little place desperately when it's no longer two blocks away. Our staple order: Thai Spice rolls to start, chicken gang dang and pad thai with prawns. I'm getting hungry just thinking of it. Off to lunch I go...
author: Carolyn C.

description: I think some shabby Thai place hacked into my order on delivery.com and tried to pretend they were Thai Spice bc I wasn't feelin' the love for this place like some other reviewers.  The "spring" rolls were wrapped with in some tortilla thingy with a thick & unappealing sauce, the tom ka gai was coming up short on some much-needed lemongrass, and the chicken pumpkin curry had chunks of not-the-most-desirable chicken... different with bits of pumpkin but still pretty average.  Maybe I'm just cranky bc I was uber-disappointed after paying a pretty penny, waiting almost an hour, and being too lazy to pick up trusty ol' Khoon Chang on the corner.  I guess it gets a couple stars for filling the tummy but, alas, I'm taking away a few for needing to jump on the PC and tell the world before we even put away the leftovers.
author: Tara G.

description: I'm not gonna play like I am a maj Thai food connoisseur, especially as  a Mexi in the Bay Area, dig? But this is totally great, totally cheap, and I appreciate that the name of the restaurant does not dick you around.
author: Shannon V.

description: I have tried other Thai restaurants on Polk and I have to say that this is my favorite. The atmosphere is cozy, great window seat for people watching. The pad thai is awesome and the chicken gang dang is my favorite curry dish. I am also stoked on the fact that they deliver! The food is just the right amount to leave you completely satisfied.
author: Melanie T.

description: Thai Spice is our favorite neighborhood Thai restaurant to dine while in SF.  The service is awesome & the food is excellent.  We also enjoy OSHA, but usually choose Thai Spice for the realxed atmosphere, yummy dishes, and awesome service--Joe is the best!
author: Dolores B.

description: This place can make Pad Thai right!  FINALLY.  In Nob Hill, there are like a bajillion Thai places to choose from... but Thai Spice remains one of the few that isn't too pricey AND has good quality food.  We entered the restaurant and the waiter kind of looked at us from the other side of the restaurant, but didn't walk over - don't know what that was about.  The service was a bit slow.  The Pad Thai came out with crushed peanuts on the side and an abundant side to mix in of bean sprouts and carrots = DELICIOUS.  It's a cute restaurant and definitely worth trying if you are in the area and craving some delicious Pad Thai!
author: Karen T.

description:
once upon a time, jenny and i went to park my car in cow hollow (stupid nob hill parking nonsense) and on the way back towards thai spice, happened upon a garage sale. jenny, always one for a bargain, spotted a perfect little round side table. she haggled (badly) the price down to $12. wonderful. i got to carry the table. we got a cab, the cab driver tried to buy the table from us, or to barter the ride for the table (not on my watch!) and i told him he could have it for $20. jenny then announces we only paid $12. clearly, he wouldn't pay the $20. thanks, jenny. then we took our table inside thai spice. minus one star for not thinking my "we brought our own table, thanks" joke was funny. we ordered red curry and pad thai to go, and spring rolls. then we took our table down the street for some sangria  and came back later for our to go. 

BASICALLY, it was fab. no complaints, would def come back. drunk thai food is delicious. and it was even better later, when i was drunker.
author: Jessi B.

description: They may as well rename this place, Just Like Any Other Thai Place. The food is tasty but nothing to write home about. The fried calamari is pretty good - the sauce is the highlight. The fried spring rolls are tasty too - again, the sauce is the best part. Everything else is pretty average. Just think back to the last mediocre Thai place you went (most likely the last Thai place you went) and imagine that food - that's Thai Spice.
author: Tom C.

description:
So we're walking down the street, G asks, Crepe, Thai or Kabob. Difficult for me to say no to Thai. 

Friday night the place was half empty,  G wasn't going for eggplant so we settled on Pad See You and Penang Curry, both were excellent, the Penang sauce GOOD and the Pad See You al-dente. check it out, warm decor too

ps - their website has coupons!
author: James H.

description: If you go, do yourself a favor and order the app, which is spinach leaves, that you roll yourself with peanuts, mint, some "special sauce"--they are the best.  Also very good, was the sweet and sour soup with veggies and tofu. All so inexpensive too! They have redone the inside, and it's very nice, and they also deliver after 5pm!
author: Rita M.

description: i like this place because it's convenient, the ambiance is nice but casual, and the food is decent. for all the times that i've gone, there have been a few off days (i.e. the eggplant was not cooked long enough) but i always go back and usually it's good. there are some better thai places though, so if you have a car head down to koh samui and the monkey :) their green papaya salad is the best! and so was their scallop curry.
author: Shirley L.

description: I really want to like this place because the interior is so nice and welcoming.  Unfortunately, though, that doesn't make their food taste any better.  The first time I came, I had their fish dish.  Something about it was really OFF--the fish itself had an unappealing taste and smell, which couldn't be masked even by the heavy sauce.  I came again, hoping for the best, but was disappointed again.  I had the beef salad and pad thai, standard fare that still came out poorly.
author: M A N I K.

description: I decided to try here because there always seem to be people in here.  Not crowded but enough people to get me curious.  I ordered the Pad thai and I have to be honest, it was nyah.  Not sure if I spelled that right but nyah means it just didn't impress me.  The service was really slow too and they weren't even busy.  I'll try it again just to see if my experience was a fluke but I don't think anything's going to change.
author: John B.

description: Love this place! It's my go-to Thai spot in the semi-neighborhood. You can dine in or have it delivered and it's not as expensive as my alternative- Lemongrass on Polk. The red curries are my favorite, but I do dabble in the pad Thais, basil chickens, green curries and yellow curries...What am I saying, I love it all. And you can head over to Amelie for a bottle of vino to make a night out it in the 'hood.
author: Defne A.

description: I like their stir fried noodles here. My usual is the pad see ew with pork. I like how they give you a wide variety of hot sauces when you ask for it. Their staff are nice and friendly too.
author: Lester L.

description: I love Thai Spice. It's really quick and has great food that's reasonably priced. It's perfect for takeout, but has a cute atmosphere, too.
author: Roseanne W.

description: Where do I start? My basis for a good Thai place starts with the basics, Pad Thai. If a Thai restaurant can't even get Pad Thai right, then they are dead to me. I went to Thai Spice the other night and got the veggie Pad Thai to go. There was enough oil on the noodles that I could have started my own restaurant. Plus it tasted like they emptied the contents of a Heinz Ketchup bottle for the sauce. Skip this place and keep on walking.
author: Raymond M.

description: Ok, so the food is good but the service sucks.   I placed an  online order.  I recieved email confirmation that my order was being processed and would arrive shortly.  Ninety minutes later I called to inquire why my order had not arrived at my house.  The person who answered said they had not checked their order printer and had therefore not started my order and if I wanted my order it would take another 45 minutes.   They refused to give me a discount or any other compensation and were very apathetic about my situation, despite me speaking with the employee and "person in charge".   I called several times on several days and a manager was never available for me to discuss this situation with them.
author: Mariana B.

description: This restaurant is pretty great because they deliver, which is always a plus!  Their beef salad is awesome and their portions are huge.  The spicy eggplant is also amazing, adding tofu really adds to the dish.  I only had one problem with this place and they cleared it up quickly, they brought over the wrong soup once and actually drove back and brought a new soup (the one I ordered).  They were nice and felt bad for their mistake but corrected the error in a heartbeat!  So, if you're lazy and need a decent Thai place that delivers this one is pretty standard and should fix the craving.
author: Steven K.

description:
My boyfriend and I are obsessed with the Spicy Tofu Eggplant at Thai Spice.  Luckily we live only a couple blocks away because we come here once or twice a week, and we always get the same thing.

Maybe the rest of the menu sucks, I wouldn't really know.  Once you try the Spicy Tofu Eggplant, assuming you aren't too "macho" to go vegetarian, at least for a night, you will never want to try anything else on the menu.
author: Nora Z.

description: This place is a pretty run of the mill restaurant, nothing outstanding, or particularly memorable. But I really enjoyed my Thai meal here, good tom yum soup, good pad thai, and a tasty, spicy calamari salad, and a good yellow curry. We ate lots of food here and I think the bill was like 150ish for 8 or so of us, hard to remember as we had been drinking previously.
author: Karl L.

description: Great everyday restaurant. Nice atmosphere and good selection although pretty standard Thai. You can tell curry is made from scratch
author: Rob S.

description: I like this restaurant a lot. I haven't been here for a while but my past experiences were great. The ambiance was nice and the people there are friendly. I must agree though, they are not the fastest servers...but if you have some time to kill with a friend, who cares?
author: meL Z.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood Thai place-- I especially like their tofu dishes. An added plus, you can get a post-dinner drink at Bigfoot which is a couple of doors away.
author: shoba d.

description: Grabbed some take out about a week ago and it really was quite decent. The peanut sauce was a great great thing, the lemongrass chicken was just the right amount of spicy, and the seafood pad thai was delicious. Highly recommended for a quick bite.
author: Irene F.

description: My girlfriend absolutely RAVED about this place and the yellow curry so finally I decided to try it. Ambiance/Decor: typical nice & clean. Price: $5-$10. Service: pretty good, not fancy they serve you like they own the place. Food: the dishes here are more home cooking Thai then restaurant cuisine. It is really good but you have to be one to appreciate non-American Thai food. The dishes are simple but it doesn't taste mass produced. I've recently spent 2 weeks in Thailand and this place is as close as SF can get...at least for now.
author: Kat F.

description: we ordered the pad thai shrimp and the duck red curry, both mild spice both were excellent.
author: Tim O.

description: OK ok this is a hole in the wall..but you know what? the food is great..my favs are the gang garee gai(chicken in coconut curry), pad thai, green papaya salad..yummy! Dress casually, no frills kind of place.
author: Not M.

description: It's pretty good food and the nice ambiance of the restaurant's slick decor and comfortable seating are rather atypical of an average Thai restaurant.  Thai Spice is my favorite restaurant so far in the Polk Gulch area.
author: Femita J.

description:
This place it's fine for Thai food not too good and not too bad. I love silver noodle soup with ground pork and prawn especially when it's cold out.

The pumpkin curry is amazing. I love it. the rest of the food that we ordered was ok.  The service is good / fast which is the plus.
author: Grace C.

description: It's not my favorite Thai place, but it's decent enough. It's very convenient to my apartment, so I come here when I don't feel like venturing into the Loin (where the best Thai restaurants are in my opinion).
author: Kelly L.

description: This place is good. Get the fried banana ice cream.
author: Johnnie M.

description: Perfectly acceptable Thai food.  Acceptable pricing, acceptable service, acceptable taste, acceptable selection, acceptable delivery.
author: Flemm F.

description: I love this place! Ive been there several times and had many different things and never been dissapointed. I love the Beef Salad and the Yellow Curry.  I recently discovered they deliver to my new apt, that could be very dangerous.
author: Tamara F.

description: Possibly the best peanut sauce I've ever had, including in Thailand.  Great food, but very slow service and a bit overpriced.  They seem to go more for presentation now (as opposed to a couple of years ago), and the price refelcts that.
author: Adam S.

description: Thai Spice is close to where I live. For a 'neighborhood Thai' it's decent. It's clean and cosy. Still, I prefer to walk a couple of blocks to go to Little Thai.
author: Timmy T.

description:
Not good this time!  Although I had yet to visit this store in person, I had ordered take out several times.  The food has always been pretty good.  

Today however, I ventured in during lunch with a friend. There were about 5 tables sat, with one waiter and one waitress.  For some reason the waitress was very very very rude.  Not sure why.  After waiting a long while to be greeted, I finally had to call her over so that we could place our order.  After a few dirty looks, she asked the other person to wait on us.  When the food came it didn't exactly taste the same as usual.  

Having been a waiter, I always leave at least 15% even after receiving not-so-great service.  Today was the first time in my entire life that I could not leave gratuity for a server.  

Long story short - both my friend and I got sick within 30 minutes of leaving the restaurant.  

Between the horrible service and bad food - We won't be going back.
author: W S.

description: So so good.  love the food, always good & fresh.  Service is great, friendly, & attentive.  They offer mild, spicy, & Thai spicy dishes.  Warning Thai spicy is fire hot.
author: A A.

description: Good thai food- although I do prefer Lemongrass down the street. Large menu and everything I tried (tofu with string beans, pineapple fried rice, pumpkin curry) was tasty stuff. However, the place gets 4 stars for having good food and $9 carafes of more than decent house wine. $9- for a carafe (a glass is $2.95)! I'm in love.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Not the best Thai food in the city, but it's good enough for me. I ordered the barbecue chicken and was surprised to be handed literally half a chicken on my plate. That being said, they're pretty generous with their portions. However, I was totally skimped on the sauce and only got enough to pour onto one chicken breast. That sauce was really good, so I don't understand why they gave me so little of it. But hey, my Thai iced tea was really good. Then again, is it possible to mess up Thai iced tea?
author: Natalie T.

description: Great Thai Food at good prices.  Big Bonus? - - I love restaurants that serve "white meat" as thier standard "cut" for thier chicken dishes. None of that rubbery meat that most Asian restaurants serve :)  -  This restaurant is pretty much my standard go -to - Thai restaurant for take out/delivery...Give them a try!
author: Christian S.

description: I had a great experience here.  The service was quick, and they serve late, it was like... 10 when we got there.  sweet.  The food was really enjoyable as well, and pretty good prices.  The pad thai was excellent ( i LOVE pad thai), the green curry was enjoyable, although I could have handled a little more spice, and the soup, which i don't remember the name of was just delicious.  If i didn't live really far away, I'd make this a regular spot.
author: Caleb D.

description:
I go to, and order from, this Thai restaurant on a regular basis, not only because it's just a few blocks from my apartment, but also because it's consistently good.  And speedy.  

In my two years as a frequent customer, I've only been disappointed by the Thai Spice fare twice: when my (vegetarian-friendly) Rainbow Soup was a-swim with prawns, and when my tofu pad thai was delivered chockfull of nothing short of ground chicken.  

The profuse apologies that followed these minor slip-ups dissipated my fleeting chagrin, though, especially when my angst was further drowned in a complimentary carafe of (watered down?) house wine.
author: Hannah J.

description: Been coming here now for years. Their three flavor fish and Seafood soup is just outstanding. The service and hospitality is awesome, not to mention very reasonable prices. A must for any foodie...
author: Evaristo V.

description: Of all the Thai restaurants I have been too this one wasn't bad but was not spectacular.  Deserves an A-OK.  The food was hit or miss on most of the dishes we tried.  Their mild curry was actually quite spicy too.  I would say I probably had better Thai food at Osha's.  Not much to say, good or bad.  Probably down to go again, but not anytime soon.
author: Clifford C.

description: I'm not usually a big fan of thai food. My wife took me here and I'm seriously blown away. The BBQ chicken was phenomenal. Great atmosphere and presentation. I would definitely come back. I've eaten at marni thai many times because my wife likes it, but this place blows marni thai away. Hands down best thai I've had.
author: geoff h.

description: Cheap & good Thai food that delivers (yes I'm lazy because I really don't live very far from the restaurant), but hey Free Delivery.  My ex. (yes, we're still friends) swears the food at Yukol Thai in the Marina is far better, but I tried it last week - honestly, I think you like what is close to you...because Yukol was good (I had the seaweed salad, and Shrimp Curry) but not amazing.
author: Rebecca W B.

description:
i used to go here back when it was just a grody dining room with carpeting and bad art. so i am old-school i guess. 

the food is reliably good, tho you might have to tell them if you want something to be spicy, cause they tend to err on the side of milder. don't miss the thai beef salad (this is spicy enuf as it is) or the golden spring rolls. i also like the green curry and the minced chicken with basil. but everything is consistently good. 

also, they do have beer. just thai beer. :)
author: rachel p.

description: One of my favorite Thai restaurants in town.  They make a mean Pad See Ew, which I order with tofu rather than meat.  I also like their pumpkin yellow curry, preferably accompanied with sticky rice.  When we get Thai delivered, this is our default place.  Yum, yum, yum.  An extra star for now using biodegradable containers.
author: Squirrel L.

description: I had the chicken phad thai. It was alright, but nothing spectacular.
author: Tien H.

description: Started ordering delivery from here because they had coupons on their menu.  Of course, we always forget to use them.  Anyway, I love the curries here and the pineapple fried rice is yummy.  There are actually many dishes that we've tried and have enjoyed the majority of them.  Delivery time is pretty good.
author: Lisa C.

description: I lover their silver noodle soup and sauted eggplant. Their curries are good too. Overall, I always get my Thai cravings taken care of when I come here. The food is standard, but good.
author: Jana C.

description: A great, go to to-go place. Get the Cashew Nut Chicken and Pad See Ew with Beef. The Cashew Chicken comes with hearty pieces of chicken, sauteed yellow and green onions, peppers, and of course, cashews. It has a bit of a Chinese sweet and sour chicken flavor, mixed with Thai spices. Delicious.
author: Laura D.

description: Complete fail. We ordered delivery to an address 3 blocks away at 8.30pm and despite calling to follow up twice, food hasn't arrived yet by 10.15pm. Almost 2 hours! Staff on the phone were rude, first trying to connect us to the driver, who didn't pick up. Then, on second call, blaming us that we 'didn't pick up when the driver called'. We sat next to the phone the whole time. We asked if they could check with the driver. They said they didn't know whe he was. 100% lousy. Never had anything like that before.
author: Benjamin H.

description: Duck salad and green curry are amazing here...and it is hard to make really good green curry.  I can't wait to try the red curry!
author: Ryan C.

description:
food is great... Especially the curry...  yum

my only complaint is the service is REALLLLLLLLLY slow :(

worth checking out... food is worth the wait
author: Andrew K.

description: I got takeout here and it took FOREVER! Unfriendly staff and overpriced food. They wouldn't even let me get a cup of soup to go saying I had to get a bowl. Not cool .
author: Kyla L.

description: I've only eaten their food via delivery.com   They have lots of vegetarian options, and I recommend their 'asian pumpkin yellow curry'.   If you beg and plead and maybe even threaten sectarian violence, they MIGHT make your curry spicy enough to satisfy.  My roomate says that the $10 seafood pad thai is the best on delivery.com in the 94133.  Can be a bit slow on the delivery, but they never forget or screw up your order.  Big plus for all the vegetarian foods.
author: Jeremy P.

description: Typical average thai restaurant with shitty service. My dish was pretty good but I'd rather check out the other thai restuarants in the neighborhood before going back.
author: Michael A.

description: The outside of this restaurant is cute, though I've never dined in--I stick to delivery. The food is good, but there's stiff competition for good Thai food in this city, and I've had much better. The only reason I've ordered from them a couple times is cause, as usual, I'm too lazy to get my ever-expanding bum off the couch and walk to Osha or Bangkok or Siam or any of my other more favorite Thai places.
author: Lara L.

description: One star, only because actual food arrived at our table.  Really fishy flavor in the food.  The service was slow ( but I know we cant have it all, and I have worked at a restaurant so I dont really expect perfection)  but the food was just blahhhhhhhhhhhh.  Try Ar Roi Thai in Nob Hill.... yuuuumy food!!!!!
author: Shelly L.

description: Thai Spice is good.  Delivery during bad weather is great.
author: QuodE D.

description: Never had a delivery guy yell at me before. He began the call upon arrival at the apartment building with a threat to leave and charge us a cancellation fee if we did not get downstairs and pick the food up immediately ourselves. Incredulous, we asked that he please ring the front door and deliver to our apartment on the 5th floor, unable to believe that a food delivery person would refuse to deliver to the door. He refused, restated for us to come downstairs, then also insisted that the single bag of food being delivered deserved a much higher tip than what we charged to the card. Needless to say, after going downstairs ourselves, and him nearly refusing to hand over the prepaid food altogether, there was no additional tip in cash to go along with what had already been paid. The delivery guy's instruction to pay more tip next time was answered with a you-must-be-crazy-to-think-there's-going-to-be-a-next-time. The food is nothing special, took 85 minutes, and overpriced ($10 appetizer?), and most definitely not worth that kind of abuse. Upon calling the restaurant, they said they would investigate. That was over a week ago. Wow.
author: SE E.

description: I love the food at Thai Spice.  Perhaps I would even go so far to  say it is the best Thai I have eaten in the Bay Area (order the veggie red curry).  I would love to give this place a 4th  star but the bitchy servers devour the celestial 4.  I don't know why people are in the service industry if they simply are not interested in serving?!  Be prepared to have a loooong meal, but worth every single bite!
author: Jessica L.

description: Lunch special: spicy eggplant and egg roll. Quaint interior. Seems quality has gone done last 5 years. Perhaps different chef. Used to be the owner's mother-in-law. See may have passed away. Or maybe it's new owners just in general. Too bad. Used to be nice respite on Polk St.
author: miriam b.

description: I used order food from here but lately its been going down in quality.  Don't bother phoning in a to go order.  It takes about an hour and half to get food here.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
author: Buddy R.

description: I chose to celebrate my birthday here this year. I figured it wasn't to much cash and everyone I invited could afford it. The location is pretty central and on a Thursday night isn't so packed that you can't have a chat. The food was pretty good. They got new menus and updated the decor since I'd been last. The silver noodle salad was my favorite and the service was ok. The first timers even liked the place. I'm sure I'll be back. mmm.....
author: Marianne s.

description: This is my comfort food of the city... never crowded, reasonably priced!  I love it!  Can't say enough!
author: Allison G.

description: Talk about another go-to.  Tonight's menu - my neighborhood Thai.  (ok down a few blocks and up on Polk some), but still close enough I can eat-in.  Which I did tonight (out of all nights, my friend wants to eat-in on the rainy storm night. ugh).  Usually I just order in & they arrive pretty quickly.  Regardless, I love me some Thai Spice!  Great dishes.  Always consistent.  Spring Rolls, Gra Praw, Pad Thai. Thai BBQ Beef.  Delicious.  Order right & you can't go wrong.  :)
author: Natalie P.

description: I love thai food.  This thai food was pretty good.  We ordered soft shell crab as an appetizer.  It comes with tempura style veggies.  I was extremely hungry when I came here, so this dish tasted really good to me.  Plus, I love "fried."  We ordered a curry dish and pad thai (of course).  I thought both were good.  I adore sticky rice, and so we ate it with the curry.  Yummy.  I think this is a good lunch spot.
author: Sarah F.

description:
My wife and I have tried 7-8 Thai places in the city and keep coming back to Thai Spice.   Consistent and tasty food, plus they deliver (we have actually never eaten there).  

Far superior to Lemongrass further down Polk which we think is not even worth going to.  

Best Thai we have had (and good ambiance) is Citizen Thai in North Beach (but they do not deliver).
author: michael d.

description: This place had decent food and service, but nothing really stood out.  On the other hand, nothing went wrong, which is a good thing considering some of the poor service I have received at other Thai places in the neighborhood.  So, all in all, this is a good Thai place for lunch or dinner.  I would certainly recommend this place to anyone in Russian/Nob Hill who is looking for a decent Thai place.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I love their pumpkin yellow curry and for desert the sticky rice with mango!!! Yum! Can't wait til my next visit.
author: Clementine O.

description: I really do love this place.  I live about 3 blocks away, so it's really convenient for me, and I guess you could say I'm biased because of it's close proximity, but really though, the food is delicious!  I've never actually sat down to eat in the restaurant, but have gotten take-out on a number of occasions.  The portions are pretty big for the price, and are consistently good.  I thought it was obnoxious that I had to pay extra for peanut sauce, but when I saw how HUGE the take-out tub was, I was sold.  Best $2 you could ever spend.  The peanut sauce was unbelievable good, and I had so much left over that I actually attempted to fry my own tofu the next day just so I could use the sauce.  The tofu didn't turn out so well, but that sauce was damn good!
author: Katie J.

description: Best pad thai in city!
author: Danielle G.

description: This is a great neighborhood joint. The place is clean and the atmosphere is nice. The food is great. I mix it up between ordering delivery or eating inside at the restaurant since I live nearby. Either way, the food is very good. Sure, you can find better Thai in the city, but for the price this is a great value. I prefer it over Lemongrass which is down the street (but Lemongrass is good too).  My favorites dishes are green curry w/ chicken, pad see ooh! :) w/ beef, or pad thai with shrimp.
author: Carter F.

description:
i've bounced around sf trying different thai places in the city, but, everywhere i go i compare it to thai spice, it's really that good! i order the same thing everytime, pad kee mao with ground chicken and cilantro added on top, i've always been happy with this place, it's clean, smells good, decor is nice, bathrooms are clean, service is good, food comes out pretty quick. i don't have any complaints about this place...

HOWEVER! i could write VOLUMES on the terribly written yelp by "Jay L S" what's that Jay? they "dehydrated" the chicken before cooking it??? im sure that is standard operating proceedure... "look! here comes JAY L S!!!  dehydrate the chicken!!! ALSO you ate "hear" twice?? hit the speel chek buttin wunce in a whyle. finally.... "bush is a loser" okaaaayy... not sure what place that statement has in the review of a thai restaurant but.... okaaaayy. sorry Jay, i can only give your review 1 STAR, at least you were smart enough to eat there. you got yelped... OUCH!
author: Steve M.

description:
I'm starting to get all my Thai a little mixed up. I need to remember to focus more when I'm eating. But as I recall, this was good but not great. Didn't have any problem with the service.

Eric M, thai restaurants don't usually give you chopsticks and if you go to Thailand you generally won't get chopsticks either.
author: frontpack e.

description: I gave this 5 stars because I'll take good food over good service anyday. That said, the veggie spring rolls get better and better every time, and the seafood soup is to die for! I go here a lot when I visit my friend who lievs a block away, and we usually share plates, which is the best way to do it with any restaurant in the city. Pretty affordable too!
author: T W.

description: I got the duck noodle soup here, and although it was rather lacking in the duck department, it was tasty enough and reasonably priced. The place has a nice ambiance to it, and the food came out pretty quickly. I wouldn't be surprised if I came back, but I'll definitely make sure not to order by phone, given the other reviews.
author: Chris L.

description:
atmosphere: clean lines, design-modern
food: not the best, small portions
price: overpriced
service: very good, fast
author: A D.

description: Another great everyday Thai restaurant! Thai is my favorite food, and everything I've ordered here has been tasty. And it meets my triumvirate criteria of great food, great prices, and great interior; for an excellent overall dining experience!
author: Micah K.

description: Absolutely great and inexpensive with very nice people serving you.
author: Corinne d.

description: I love their pad thai and their mixed veggies have a great sauce. Their service is good. The prices are reasonable.
author: Marika C.

description: love this place for the pad thai and the cashew chicken with rice - always a pleaser.  the wait staff is somewhat "spaced out" but they eventually get the job done. the fresh spring rolls are really bad (it must be all the mint they put it them) but try the crispy ones instead, they are much much better...
author: Rachel W.

description:
I am giving two stars for the deco and service.

We ordered a seafood dish and a curry dish. The seafood was smelly and the veggie in the curry dish was not well cooked. I don't know if we just picked the wrong dishes, wrong time or wrong restaurant.
author: Amy C.

description:
I go there pretty often and the taste of the same food changes every single time. Seems like the chef forgets to put something in it and sometime puts too much. I hate going there for dinner so I usually just order to go. Even then, when i pick it up, walking into that door makes me feel mis-fit. The waitor(ess) just either ignore me or look at me like I'm they are doing me a favor. So I walk to the counter to pick up my order. I asked for chopstick and the guy said "oh, we don't have chopstick for To-Go" in a you got your food and go already kind of way. No apology and he did not offer an alternative utensil. Just these minor things that  made a difference. 

The reason I gave it 2 stars is because of their lunch. I love going there for lunch. There are fewer people and the food taste much better and more consistent.  The WAITER is really NICE but the WAITRESS is the BAD like dinner time. It seems like see is having period everyday! Other than that, it's a much better experience than dinner.
author: Howie L.

description:
I don't know if this is the best Thai place in San Francisco, but it is the one we like the most.  I always order their beef salad and calamari.  The beef salad is a little heavy on the fish sauce, but I like it that way.  The service is fast, the restaurant never seems to be crowded, and most of the staff is friendly....some maybe more than others.  
We always take a 15% off coupon, usually found in Valpak or printed from their website.
author: Tommy B.

description: I put two stars, but it's more like 2 and a half. The food is good, very nicely spicy, but it was too expensive and the portions were too small. With so many other thai places around I wonder how they can get away with it.
author: Adam R.

description: Thai spice should earn a solid 3.5 stars. Sometimes when I do the half stars I round down, but in the case of this place I will round up because they did manage to add some extra pumpkin to my soup, which normally would have been pumpkin free. Yes, when I visited Thai Spice, I was on my pumpkin kick and anything and everything I ordered needed to contain some form of the squash. We went to this small Polk street restaurant when I first moved to the city as a celebration dinner for finally landing an apartment! We ordered an appetizer of lettuce rolls filled with minced chicken and coconut, served with a dark and slightly fishy tasting sauce. The shredded toasted coconut made up for the fishiness of the sauce (for those of you who don't know me, I am not a fan of the fish). My dad ordered traditional pad see ew, and I, the tom yum gha with an addition of pumpkin (note, this is not normally how the chicken soup is served). The soup was flavorful and chock full of vegetables (including my beloved pumpkin) and the portions were quite substantial. The pad see ew was decent and we managed to finish all of the food. This is a cute and accommodating place, and as far as Thai restaurants in the city go, one of the better choices.
author: Kate A.

description: Not bad - the menu is a bit basic and I pretty much order the same stuff, although it is always good. Dining-in the service is pretty quick. I ordered for delivery once and it almost took an hour!
author: Dan C.

description: The food here is really good.  But that definitely doesn't make up for their horrible service!  It took them 30 minutes to ask for our order! I was there with a big party and and the place is small so they definitely couldn't have forgotten about us.  Then they made every one order an entree saying it was against their policy for customers to share! Then instead of bringing out our plates together, they brought each meal about 10 minutes apart! Then it took them another 30 minutes to bring us our check after we asked, and we had to ask them 4 times for the check!  If you're a masochist that likes good food, then go here, but I definitely wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.  The service is horrible!!
author: Esther Y.

description: This place is horrible. I've never been to the restaurant, but I ordered delivery from them.  First off, the guy on the phone had no idea what they had on the menu. I wanted the Pad Thai Bu and he had no clue what I was talking about. Even after giving him the number on the menu he had no clue.  Then the delivery guy comes and the bill is $17 and I give him $20 and he turns to take off. Normally I wouldn't mind tipping him that much but because he didn't even bother to give me change or ask if I needed change, but assumed to take the $3, so I stopped him. I ended up only giving him $1. So incredibly rude!!!! On top of all this, their original pad thai tasted like ketchup was just poured on it(if you didn't know, so restaurants use this for pad thai) and the basil chicken was so salty I had to drink a ton of water just to get it down. I will never order from them again even though they are the closest Thai place by me!!!! disgusting!!
author: Thuy N.

description: standard thai restaurant...nice inside.  the food is good, but i much prefer marnee in the sunset.
author: Roshni R.

description: My favorite local thai place.  Not sure why, but it's never crowded, so getting a seat right away isn't a problem.  The pad thai is nice and tangy, and the seafood special in brown sauce are great.  I live in the neighborhood and get 10-15% off coupons all the time in the mail, so those definitely come in handy!
author: LT B.

description: pumpkin:perfect texture. potatoes: potatoe-y, the desired outcome. yellow curry: consistency of backwash, more watered down than ryan seacrests'   ipod.  The veggie menu: promising, will return. my lunch break: a time to make right choices, i would put this in the pseudo-destructive party. this review: more of a salvo, really, 10.80 cents for brown rice and sub-par urine pigmented coconut milk!!!
author: Christopher J.

description:
Was on vacation in San Francisco and saw this small place which looked interesting. Because it was mid-day, we went back in the evening for dinner. 
Decor was striking, service very good and not intimidating which was important as we do not have much experience with Thai food.
The wine list is short, but adequate. I couldn't decide between 2 different wines and they poured me a taste of each, which made it easy as I did not really like one of them.
We ordered from the special menu which had a large variety of offerings for small plates and "regulars". We ordered Twins plates (small plate) and Veggie belly (special) and both were excellent. Twins plates was described as a Thai style bbq chicken and green papaya salad. The portion was big enough to satisfy a light appetite for dinner and very tasty. The Veggie Belly, a mixture of eggplant, green beans and tofu in a spicy sauce was tops. 
Did not have dessert as we have some favorites that we had not visited yet.
I would go back any time to sample other dishes.
author: b b.

description: Very comparable to Chai-Yo in food quality, but I think I would give the nod to Chai-Yo if I had to make a choice.  I'm rarely disappointed with my food, but I'm rarely blown away either.  I wouldn't drive to go to Thai Spice, but it's a very solid option if you are in the area.  The Pumpkin Yellow Curry with Chicken is one of the better options.
author: Luke P.

description: Unfortunately I have not yet tasted the food but wanted to after reading some reviews and may change my review should I decide to go to the restaurant. I just tried to place an order for delivery and was told that there would be a five dollar charge despite the fact that the menu I am staring at says free delivery. I could understand the logic if I was far from the restaurant but I checked the distance and I am 1.4 miles from their location - not far at all (5 min drive max). I was annoyed by the response so decided to order from one of my favorite Chinese places the offers truly FREE delivery. Out of curiosity I checked the distance of the Chinese place and it is 4.8 miles form my house - almost clear across the City and no charge. I will probably give them an additional five bucks for making the trek - it is the principle. To bad I could not try the Thai as there were about four hungry people and a large order waiting but it was a five dollar charge and some false advertisement that separated us.
author: Oren H.

description: Disappointed, to say the least! I was super hungry so I ordered (online) 2 dishes for  a lunch delivery- chicken pad thai and coconut curry for $21 before the tip! The pad thai has no flavor and they used rice noodles instead of the normal pad thai noodles- unhappy with my pad thai I moved on to the curry- until I realized that they didn't give rice with the curry! Who does that? I have never had to order rice with a curry dish- shouldn't that be an automatic side? Will not be ordering delivery from here again.
author: Mandy F.

description: Big prawns in the pad thai, out of this world coconut ice cream and fried bananas...and the 2nd time I went there, I saw the sign for free parking in a nearby garage.  Will have to take advantage of that next time (if I don't feel like walking, that is).
author: Catherine Y.

description: i developed my taste for thai food while living in seattle (weird huh), where there seem to be an overabundance of thai expats. thai spice is the only place so far in SF that i think measures up to the saucy, spicy goodness of thai tom or thai-ger room on university ave near the uw.
author: jaja w.

description: this is my preferred delivery spot.  i've gone back and forth between thai spice and lemongrass, but i think i have to stick with thai spice.  price is right, the food is fresh (with nice tender crisp veggies and sauces that aren't too heavy), and you'll have your dinner lickety split.
author: nicole l.

description: After trying thai chai yo down on Polk Street for my first thai food experience in SF, I accepted the fact that SF was not a thai food mecca. It was horrible. My bf dragged me here one night against my will and i gladly changed my mind. The food was amazing. I had pad kee mao and bbq chicken. Both were absolutely scruptious and full of flavor. I have since returned numerous times, brought friends and plan to take my mom there when she comes this weekend. And a great thing about here is they deliver and send out coupons in the mail so I think it's like 20% off if you plan right. Not a bad deal for great thai food.
author: Sarah I.

description: Everything was delicious. The ambiance was comforting with a well dressed pleasant crowd. I ordered Green Curry and it came beautifully presented and garnished on the side. Generous portions of delicious food. The owner even came out and asked if everything was alright and was quick to refill our container of brown rice. The beers were very affordable as well. Can't wait to go to Thai Spice again.  I didn't get to try any other mixed drinks but they seemed quite delectable as well. FANTASTIC.
author: Benji Y.

description: came from the groomer to enjoy some thai food.  ordered the ginger chicken with brown rice and pad ke mao (thai spicy).  it was THE JOINT.  eat it.  EAT IT.
author: Jon K.

description: Thai Spice gets four stars for meeting our weekly takeout needs. Ready for pickup in less than 15 minutes. Solid pad thai and curry dishes. Tasty, spicy (upon request) pad kee mao. Good portions, decent prices, clean flavors. As a frame of reference, our favorite day-to-day Thai is King of Thai #1, but it's a little far for us now. And we do like nearby Jitlada, but it's a little pricey and slow for takeout.
author: Midori S.

description: If you are down with Thai food then this is worth a stop. The appetizers are great and the portions are big. As with most Thai places you get a ton of food for a nice price. It is on Polk in Nob Hill so parking is tough, but the food is good!
author: Niko P.

description: Why do they put coupons on their website that they will not honor?  I tried to place an order for delivery and get the $2 off with a minimum $18 order, but they said I had to have a $20 order.  The website clearly says $18 minimum with an expiration of 12/31/08.  It's 12/17/08.  The lady was very rude about this.  Why not take the order and then change the website?  They'd rather loose a customer.  There are too many great thai restaurants in SF to be so rude.
author: Ryan P.

description: Slow, slow, slow delivery.  But once the food got here it was really good.  I would suggest either eating in or ordering when you're not hungry yet :)
author: Carolyn A.

description: I only take off one star because of parking.Other than that a standard favorite!!!!!!A standard S.F. Thai food place! always good food & service! give it a try!
author: John m.

description: Have been here couple of times.. Ambience doesn't resemble any of the thai restaurants around, yet the food is about the same. Nothing special or different. I liked it, just coz I love Thai food.. Good place to go out for Lunch esp. with colleagues.
author: Gnash S.

description:
Food is decent.  Don't get dishes that are primarily seafood (with clams or mussels) because the seafood is not the freshest.
The service is not too decent.  Some waiters are great, majority are not so good.  If you don't tip one guy well, he lets you know.  Need I say more.  I've heard this happened more than once.  Also when they're busy some of the waiters become irritated, which is understandable.  But if they get irritated before the customers do, that's not a good sign.  I was also served super watered down Thai Iced tea.  When I asked for a replacement, they said they were out.  Also, once I came in midday for takeout.  As soon as the waitress saw me, she said they weren't really open for business.  I asked if they were ok with takeout, she said yes.  As I was waiting that 8 minutes for pad thai, two people came in and sat down to eat.  She served them. Maybe the waitress was too shy to tell them to leave, I don't know.  In any case, it was a weird experience.
On the other hand, generally speaking more than half of the experiences I had here were ok.  I've been here a lot because of convenience and I'll still go, hoping not have a bad experience.  When I do happen to have a bad experience, I'm not surprised.
author: busy b.

description: Well-priced Thai food in a comfortable atmosphere amid the Polk Gulch. Good lunch menu and fast service make this place a good spot in the afternoon.
author: Jeremy J.

description: I ordered the pumpkin curry with chicken, it came with no chicken.  It then came back with dark meat chicken, (that tasted sour) and this dish is typically done with white meat.  The waitress agreed it is usually done with white mean, but said they do this particular dish there with dark (but she really understood why I was surprised).  Came back with white meat.  By now my rice was cold, and their was no offer of new rice.  It was ok, but I've had this dish other places in the City where it is much better.  The waitress was very nice and patient tho, and some of the other food looked really good, so since I'm in the area alot I will probably try it again.
author: G C.

description: If I could give 0 stars I would. I have been a customer here for 3 years. I liked their food. After tonight I changed my mind. We missed the delivery guy. I called 4 minutes after I missed their call. The delivery guy said he was already back at the restaurant and it would take 45 minutes to deliver our food. Uh, no thanks to the cold food. And if it took 4 minutes to get back there, why 45 minutes? I talked to the manager who lied to me about 8 times; (delivery guy is here, he already left, the food will just have to be cold, we will make new food for you....). After paying nearly $40 there SHOULD be better service. I asked to speak to his manager and/or get his managers name. He refused to give it to me. AWFUL service. AWFUL attitude. I'll just go to Little Thai instead.
author: Jodi C.

description: This is my first time posting a review on Yelp and I'm doing so because I wanted to share my experience at Thai Spice. Two stars for the meal, which was good, but as I have only eaten there once I have not had any other dishes there to compare. No stars for the attitude of the waiter. I was there in the afternoon on Sunday (5/25) and when I came to pay it was by credit card. The guy who served me also gave me the chit to sign. I put the amount of the meal in the Total section and he suddenly said to me "It's not fair". I said "what's not fair". His reply. "You have not written anything down for a tip". I was totally surprised and a little annoyed at his rudeness. I replied "First of all you are not meant to ask for a tip, and second I was going to leave it on the table". Now this was when his behavior became totally unacceptable to me. He said "I don't believe you". I was dumbstruck for a second and then asked him to repeat what he had said in case I misheard. He again said "I don't believe you". I told him that I was definitely going to leave the tip on the table but after this exchange I had changed my mind and was not going to leave him one. He said it was unfair that I treated restaurants like this. I said I didn't, that I usually left a tip for good service but as he was so rude he would not be getting one now. He kept on repeating "I don't care" to everything I said. I said it was obvious he did not care because of his attitude which I also told him stunk. I really enjoyed the beef dish I had but there is no way I would return to this place because of this server's attitude. When I recounted this episode to a friend he asked me if I had asked for the owner so I could complain. Normally I would have but I was so surprised by this guy's attitude that to do so escaped me at the time. Having read a few of the other posts now I am wondering if I got the 'family weekend' guy.  On reflection, I also had to get the guy's attention for him to take my order (he was not busy as I was the ONLY customer at that time) and he never took my plates away when I was finished or asked if I wanted anything else. I waited for him to come over but when he didn't I went up to initiate paying my bill. I like Thai food and have eaten in qutie a lot of Thai restaurants in the city but this is the first time I have ever encountered such rude service from a member of the Thai community.
author: mary f.
